      60            0 :             SampleAnalysis analyse(const IConfig &cfg, FDuration* first, FDuration* last) {

      63            0 :                     samples.reserve(static_cast<size_t>(last - first));
      64            0 :                     for (auto current = first; current != last; ++current) {
      65            0 :                         samples.push_back( current->count() );

      80              :                                 FDuration(e.upper_bound),

     188              :                 template <typename URng, typename Estimator>
     189              :                 static sample
     190            0 :                 resample( URng& rng,
     191              :                           unsigned int resamples,
     192              :                           double const* first,
     193              :                           double const* last,
     194              :                           Estimator& estimator ) {
     195            0 :                     auto n = static_cast<size_t>( last - first );
     196            0 :                     Catch::uniform_integer_distribution<size_t> dist( 0, n - 1 );
     197              : 
     198            0 :                     sample out;
     199            0 :                     out.reserve( resamples );
     200            0 :                     std::vector<double> resampled;
     201            0 :                     resampled.reserve( n );
     202            0 :                     for ( size_t i = 0; i < resamples; ++i ) {
     203            0 :                         resampled.clear();
     204            0 :                         for ( size_t s = 0; s < n; ++s ) {
     205            0 :                             resampled.push_back( first[dist( rng )] );
     206              :                         }
     207            0 :                         const auto estimate =
     208            0 :                             estimator( resampled.data(), resampled.data() + resampled.size() );
     209            0 :                         out.push_back( estimate );
     210              :                     }
     211            0 :                     std::sort( out.begin(), out.end() );
     212            0 :                     return out;
     213            0 :                 }
     214              : 
     215            0 :                 static double outlier_variance( Estimate<double> mean,
     216              :                                                 Estimate<double> stddev,
     217              :                                                 int n ) {
     218            0 :                     double sb = stddev.point;
     219            0 :                     double mn = mean.point / n;
     220            0 :                     double mg_min = mn / 2.;
     221            0 :                     double sg = (std::min)( mg_min / 4., sb / std::sqrt( n ) );
     222            0 :                     double sg2 = sg * sg;
     223            0 :                     double sb2 = sb * sb;
     224              : 
     225            0 :                     auto c_max = [n, mn, sb2, sg2]( double x ) -> double {
     226            0 :                         double k = mn - x;
     227            0 :                         double d = k * k;
     228            0 :                         double nd = n * d;
     229            0 :                         double k0 = -n * nd;
     230            0 :                         double k1 = sb2 - n * sg2 + nd;
     231            0 :                         double det = k1 * k1 - 4 * sg2 * k0;
     232            0 :                         return static_cast<int>( -2. * k0 /
     233            0 :                                                  ( k1 + std::sqrt( det ) ) );
     234            0 :                     };
     235              : 
     236            0 :                     auto var_out = [n, sb2, sg2]( double c ) {
     237            0 :                         double nc = n - c;
     238            0 :                         return ( nc / n ) * ( sb2 - nc * sg2 );
     239            0 :                     };
     240              : 
     241            0 :                     return (std::min)( var_out( 1 ),
     242            0 :                                        var_out(
     243            0 :                                            (std::min)( c_max( 0. ),
     244            0 :                                                        c_max( mg_min ) ) ) ) /
     245            0 :                            sb2;
     246              :                 }
     247              : 
     248            0 :                 static double erf_inv( double x ) {
     249              :                     // Code accompanying the article "Approximating the erfinv
     250              :                     // function" in GPU Computing Gems, Volume 2
     251              :                     double w, p;
     252              : 
     253            0 :                     w = -log( ( 1.0 - x ) * ( 1.0 + x ) );
     254              : 
     255            0 :                     if ( w < 6.250000 ) {
     256            0 :                         w = w - 3.125000;
     257            0 :                         p = -3.6444120640178196996e-21;
     258            0 :                         p = -1.685059138182016589e-19 + p * w;
     259            0 :                         p = 1.2858480715256400167e-18 + p * w;
     260            0 :                         p = 1.115787767802518096e-17 + p * w;
     261            0 :                         p = -1.333171662854620906e-16 + p * w;
     262            0 :                         p = 2.0972767875968561637e-17 + p * w;

     264            0 :                         p = -4.0545662729752068639e-14 + p * w;
     265            0 :                         p = -8.1519341976054721522e-14 + p * w;
     266            0 :                         p = 2.6335093153082322977e-12 + p * w;
     267            0 :                         p = -1.2975133253453532498e-11 + p * w;
     268            0 :                         p = -5.4154120542946279317e-11 + p * w;
     269            0 :                         p = 1.051212273321532285e-09 + p * w;
     270            0 :                         p = -4.1126339803469836976e-09 + p * w;
     271            0 :                         p = -2.9070369957882005086e-08 + p * w;
     272            0 :                         p = 4.2347877827932403518e-07 + p * w;
     273            0 :                         p = -1.3654692000834678645e-06 + p * w;
     274            0 :                         p = -1.3882523362786468719e-05 + p * w;
     275            0 :                         p = 0.0001867342080340571352 + p * w;
     276            0 :                         p = -0.00074070253416626697512 + p * w;
     277            0 :                         p = -0.0060336708714301490533 + p * w;
     278            0 :                         p = 0.24015818242558961693 + p * w;
     279            0 :                         p = 1.6536545626831027356 + p * w;
     280            0 :                     } else if ( w < 16.000000 ) {
     281            0 :                         w = sqrt( w ) - 3.250000;
     282            0 :                         p = 2.2137376921775787049e-09;
     283            0 :                         p = 9.0756561938885390979e-08 + p * w;
     284            0 :                         p = -2.7517406297064545428e-07 + p * w;

     320              :                     }
     321            0 :                     return p * x;
     322              :                 }
     323              : 
     324              :                 static double
     325            0 :                 standard_deviation( double const* first, double const* last ) {
     326            0 :                     auto m = Catch::Benchmark::Detail::mean( first, last );
     327              :                     double variance =
     328            0 :                         std::accumulate( first,
     329              :                                          last,
     330              :                                          0.,
     331            0 :                                          [m]( double a, double b ) {
     332            0 :                                              double diff = b - m;
     333            0 :                                              return a + diff * diff;
     334              :                                          } ) /
     335            0 :                         static_cast<double>( last - first );
     336            0 :                     return std::sqrt( variance );
     337              :                 }
     338              : 
     339            0 :                 static sample jackknife( double ( *estimator )( double const*,
     340              :                                                                 double const* ),
     341              :                                          double* first,
     342              :                                          double* last ) {
     343            0 :                     const auto second = first + 1;
     344            0 :                     sample results;
     345            0 :                     results.reserve( static_cast<size_t>( last - first ) );
     346              : 
     347            0 :                     for ( auto it = first; it != last; ++it ) {
     348            0 :                         std::iter_swap( it, first );
     349            0 :                         results.push_back( estimator( second, last ) );
     350              :                     }
     351              : 
     352            0 :                     return results;
     353            0 :                 }
     354              : 
     355              : 
     356              :             } // namespace
     357              :         }     // namespace Detail
     358              :     }         // namespace Benchmark
     359              : } // namespace Catch
     360              : 
     361              : namespace Catch {
     362              :     namespace Benchmark {
     363              :         namespace Detail {
     364              : 
     365            0 :             double weighted_average_quantile( int k,
     366              :                                               int q,
     367              :                                               double* first,
     368              :                                               double* last ) {
     369            0 :                 auto count = last - first;
     370            0 :                 double idx = static_cast<double>((count - 1) * k) / static_cast<double>(q);
     371            0 :                 int j = static_cast<int>(idx);
     372            0 :                 double g = idx - j;
     373            0 :                 std::nth_element(first, first + j, last);
     374            0 :                 auto xj = first[j];
     375            0 :                 if ( Catch::Detail::directCompare( g, 0 ) ) {
     376            0 :                     return xj;
     377              :                 }
     378              : 
     379            0 :                 auto xj1 = *std::min_element(first + (j + 1), last);
     380            0 :                 return xj + g * (xj1 - xj);
     381              :             }
     382              : 
     383              :             OutlierClassification
     384            0 :             classify_outliers( double const* first, double const* last ) {
     385            0 :                 std::vector<double> copy( first, last );
     386              : 
     387            0 :                 auto q1 = weighted_average_quantile( 1, 4, copy.data(), copy.data() + copy.size() );
     388            0 :                 auto q3 = weighted_average_quantile( 3, 4, copy.data(), copy.data() + copy.size() );
     389            0 :                 auto iqr = q3 - q1;
     390            0 :                 auto los = q1 - ( iqr * 3. );
     391            0 :                 auto lom = q1 - ( iqr * 1.5 );
     392            0 :                 auto him = q3 + ( iqr * 1.5 );
     393            0 :                 auto his = q3 + ( iqr * 3. );
     394              : 
     395            0 :                 OutlierClassification o;
     396            0 :                 for ( ; first != last; ++first ) {
     397            0 :                     const double t = *first;
     398            0 :                     if ( t < los ) {
     399            0 :                         ++o.low_severe;
     400            0 :                     } else if ( t < lom ) {
     401            0 :                         ++o.low_mild;
     402            0 :                     } else if ( t > his ) {
     403            0 :                         ++o.high_severe;
     404            0 :                     } else if ( t > him ) {
     405            0 :                         ++o.high_mild;
     406              :                     }
     407            0 :                     ++o.samples_seen;
     408              :                 }
     409            0 :                 return o;
     410            0 :             }
     411              : 
     412            0 :             double mean( double const* first, double const* last ) {
     413            0 :                 auto count = last - first;
     414            0 :                 double sum = 0.;
     415            0 :                 while (first != last) {
     416            0 :                     sum += *first;
     417            0 :                     ++first;
     418              :                 }
     419            0 :                 return sum / static_cast<double>(count);
     420              :             }
     421              : 
     422            0 :             double normal_cdf( double x ) {
     423            0 :                 return std::erfc( -x / std::sqrt( 2.0 ) ) / 2.0;
     424              :             }
     425              : 
     426            0 :             double erfc_inv(double x) {
     427            0 :                 return erf_inv(1.0 - x);
     428              :             }
     429              : 
     430            0 :             double normal_quantile(double p) {
     431              :                 static const double ROOT_TWO = std::sqrt(2.0);
     432              : 
     433            0 :                 double result = 0.0;
     434            0 :                 assert(p >= 0 && p <= 1);
     435            0 :                 if (p < 0 || p > 1) {
     436            0 :                     return result;
     437              :                 }
     438              : 
     439            0 :                 result = -erfc_inv(2.0 * p);
     440              :                 // result *= normal distribution standard deviation (1.0) * sqrt(2)
     441            0 :                 result *= /*sd * */ ROOT_TWO;
     442              :                 // result += normal disttribution mean (0)
     443            0 :                 return result;
     444              :             }
     445              : 
     446              :             Estimate<double>
     447            0 :             bootstrap( double confidence_level,
     448              :                        double* first,
     449              :                        double* last,
     450              :                        sample const& resample,
     451              :                        double ( *estimator )( double const*, double const* ) ) {
     452            0 :                 auto n_samples = last - first;
     453              : 
     454            0 :                 double point = estimator( first, last );
     455              :                 // Degenerate case with a single sample
     456            0 :                 if ( n_samples == 1 )
     457            0 :                     return { point, point, point, confidence_level };
     458              : 
     459            0 :                 sample jack = jackknife( estimator, first, last );
     460              :                 double jack_mean =
     461            0 :                     mean( jack.data(), jack.data() + jack.size() );
     462            0 :                 double sum_squares = 0, sum_cubes = 0;
     463            0 :                 for ( double x : jack ) {
     464            0 :                     auto difference = jack_mean - x;
     465            0 :                     auto square = difference * difference;
     466            0 :                     auto cube = square * difference;
     467            0 :                     sum_squares += square;
     468            0 :                     sum_cubes += cube;
     469              :                 }
     470              : 
     471            0 :                 double accel = sum_cubes / ( 6 * std::pow( sum_squares, 1.5 ) );
     472            0 :                 long n = static_cast<long>( resample.size() );
     473            0 :                 double prob_n = static_cast<double>(
     474            0 :                     std::count_if( resample.begin(),
     475              :                                    resample.end(),
     476            0 :                                    [point]( double x ) { return x < point; } )) /
     477            0 :                     static_cast<double>( n );
     478              :                 // degenerate case with uniform samples
     479            0 :                 if ( Catch::Detail::directCompare( prob_n, 0. ) ) {
     480            0 :                     return { point, point, point, confidence_level };
     481              :                 }
     482              : 
     483            0 :                 double bias = normal_quantile( prob_n );
     484            0 :                 double z1 = normal_quantile( ( 1. - confidence_level ) / 2. );
     485              : 
     486            0 :                 auto cumn = [n]( double x ) -> long {
     487            0 :                     return std::lround( normal_cdf( x ) *
     488            0 :                                         static_cast<double>( n ) );
     489            0 :                 };
     490            0 :                 auto a = [bias, accel]( double b ) {
     491            0 :                     return bias + b / ( 1. - accel * b );
     492            0 :                 };
     493            0 :                 double b1 = bias + z1;
     494            0 :                 double b2 = bias - z1;
     495            0 :                 double a1 = a( b1 );
     496            0 :                 double a2 = a( b2 );
     497            0 :                 auto lo = static_cast<size_t>( (std::max)( cumn( a1 ), 0l ) );
     498              :                 auto hi =
     499            0 :                     static_cast<size_t>( (std::min)( cumn( a2 ), n - 1 ) );
     500              : 
     501            0 :                 return { point, resample[lo], resample[hi], confidence_level };
     502            0 :             }
     503              : 
     504            0 :             bootstrap_analysis analyse_samples(double confidence_level,
     505              :                                                unsigned int n_resamples,
     506              :                                                double* first,
     507              :                                                double* last) {
     508            0 :                 auto mean = &Detail::mean;
     509            0 :                 auto stddev = &standard_deviation;
     510              : 
     511              : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_USE_ASYNC)
     512              :                 auto Estimate = [=](double(*f)(double const*, double const*)) {
     513              :                     std::random_device rd;
     514              :                     auto seed = rd();
     515              :                     return std::async(std::launch::async, [=] {
     516              :                         SimplePcg32 rng( seed );
     517              :                         auto resampled = resample(rng, n_resamples, first, last, f);
     518              :                         return bootstrap(confidence_level, first, last, resampled, f);
     519              :                     });
     520              :                 };
     521              : 
     522              :                 auto mean_future = Estimate(mean);
     523              :                 auto stddev_future = Estimate(stddev);
     524              : 
     525              :                 auto mean_estimate = mean_future.get();
     526              :                 auto stddev_estimate = stddev_future.get();
     527              : #else
     528            0 :                 auto Estimate = [=](double(*f)(double const* , double const*)) {
     529            0 :                     std::random_device rd;
     530            0 :                     auto seed = rd();
     531            0 :                     SimplePcg32 rng( seed );
     532            0 :                     auto resampled = resample(rng, n_resamples, first, last, f);
     533            0 :                     return bootstrap(confidence_level, first, last, resampled, f);
     534            0 :                 };
     535              : 
     536            0 :                 auto mean_estimate = Estimate(mean);
     537            0 :                 auto stddev_estimate = Estimate(stddev);
     538              : #endif // CATCH_USE_ASYNC
     539              : 
     540            0 :                 auto n = static_cast<int>(last - first); // seriously, one can't use integral types without hell in C++
     541            0 :                 double outlier_variance = Detail::outlier_variance(mean_estimate, stddev_estimate, n);
     542              : 
     543            0 :                 return { mean_estimate, stddev_estimate, outlier_variance };
     544              :             }
     545              :         } // namespace Detail
     546              :     } // namespace Benchmark
     547              : } // namespace Catch

     556              : // Performs equivalent check of std::fabs(lhs - rhs) <= margin
     557              : // But without the subtraction to allow for INFINITY in comparison
     558            0 : bool marginComparison(double lhs, double rhs, double margin) {
     559            0 :     return (lhs + margin >= rhs) && (rhs + margin >= lhs);
     560              : }

     590            0 :     bool Approx::equalityComparisonImpl(const double other) const {
     591              :         // First try with fixed margin, then compute margin based on epsilon, scale and Approx's value
     592              :         // Thanks to Richard Harris for his help refining the scaled margin value
     593            0 :         return marginComparison(m_value, other, m_margin)
     594            0 :             || marginComparison(m_value, other, m_epsilon * (m_scale + std::fabs(std::isinf(m_value)? 0 : m_value)));
     595              :     }

     926            0 :     void Config::readBazelEnvVars() {
     927              :         // Register a JUnit reporter for Bazel. Bazel sets an environment
     928              :         // variable with the path to XML output. If this file is written to
     929              :         // during test, Bazel will not generate a default XML output.
     930              :         // This allows the XML output file to contain higher level of detail
     931              :         // than what is possible otherwise.
     932            0 :         const auto bazelOutputFile = Detail::getEnv( "XML_OUTPUT_FILE" );
     933              : 
     934            0 :         if ( bazelOutputFile ) {
     935            0 :             m_data.reporterSpecifications.push_back(
     936            0 :                 { "junit", std::string( bazelOutputFile ), {}, {} } );
     937              :         }
     938              : 
     939            0 :         const auto bazelTestSpec = Detail::getEnv( "TESTBRIDGE_TEST_ONLY" );
     940            0 :         if ( bazelTestSpec ) {
     941              :             // Presumably the test spec from environment should overwrite
     942              :             // the one we got from CLI (if we got any)
     943            0 :             m_data.testsOrTags.clear();
     944            0 :             m_data.testsOrTags.push_back( bazelTestSpec );
     945              :         }
     946              : 
     947            0 :         const auto bazelShardOptions = readBazelShardingOptions();

     949            0 :             std::ofstream f( bazelShardOptions->shardFilePath,
     950            0 :                              std::ios_base::out | std::ios_base::trunc );
     951            0 :             if ( f.is_open() ) {
     952            0 :                 f << "";
     953            0 :                 m_data.shardIndex = bazelShardOptions->shardIndex;
     954            0 :                 m_data.shardCount = bazelShardOptions->shardCount;

     956            0 :         }
     957              :

     960            0 :             m_data.prematureExitGuardFilePath = bazelExitGuardFile;

    1015            0 :     }
    1016              : 
    1017              : 
    1018            0 :     Capturer::Capturer( StringRef macroName,
    1019              :                         SourceLineInfo const& lineInfo,
    1020              :                         ResultWas::OfType resultType,
    1021            0 :                         StringRef names ) {
    1022            0 :         auto trimmed = [&] (size_t start, size_t end) {
    1023            0 :             while (names[start] == ',' || isspace(static_cast<unsigned char>(names[start]))) {
    1024            0 :                 ++start;
    1025              :             }
    1026            0 :             while (names[end] == ',' || isspace(static_cast<unsigned char>(names[end]))) {
    1027            0 :                 --end;
    1028              :             }
    1029            0 :             return names.substr(start, end - start + 1);
    1030            0 :         };
    1031            0 :         auto skipq = [&] (size_t start, char quote) {
    1032            0 :             for (auto i = start + 1; i < names.size() ; ++i) {
    1033            0 :                 if (names[i] == quote)
    1034            0 :                     return i;
    1035            0 :                 if (names[i] == '\\')
    1036            0 :                     ++i;
    1037              :             }
    1038            0 :             CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("CAPTURE parsing encountered unmatched quote");
    1039            0 :         };
    1040              : 
    1041            0 :         size_t start = 0;
    1042            0 :         std::stack<char> openings;
    1043            0 :         for (size_t pos = 0; pos < names.size(); ++pos) {
    1044            0 :             char c = names[pos];
    1045            0 :             switch (c) {
    1046            0 :             case '[':
    1047              :             case '{':
    1048              :             case '(':
    1049              :             // It is basically impossible to disambiguate between
    1050              :             // comparison and start of template args in this context
    1051              : //            case '<':
    1052            0 :                 openings.push(c);
    1053            0 :                 break;
    1054            0 :             case ']':
    1055              :             case '}':
    1056              :             case ')':
    1057              : //           case '>':
    1058            0 :                 openings.pop();
    1059            0 :                 break;
    1060            0 :             case '"':
    1061              :             case '\'':
    1062            0 :                 pos = skipq(pos, c);
    1063            0 :                 break;
    1064            0 :             case ',':
    1065            0 :                 if (start != pos && openings.empty()) {
    1066            0 :                     m_messages.emplace_back(macroName, lineInfo, resultType);
    1067            0 :                     m_messages.back().message += trimmed(start, pos);
    1068            0 :                     m_messages.back().message += " := "_sr;
    1069            0 :                     start = pos;
    1070              :                 }
    1071            0 :                 break;
    1072            0 :             default:; // noop
    1073              :             }
    1074              :         }
    1075            0 :         assert(openings.empty() && "Mismatched openings");
    1076            0 :         m_messages.emplace_back(macroName, lineInfo, resultType);
    1077            0 :         m_messages.back().message += trimmed(start, names.size() - 1);
    1078            0 :         m_messages.back().message += " := "_sr;
    1079            0 :     }
    1080            0 :     Capturer::~Capturer() {
    1081            0 :         assert( m_captured == m_messages.size() );
    1082            0 :         for (auto const& message : m_messages) {
    1083            0 :             IResultCapture::popScopedMessage( message.sequence );
    1084              :         }
    1085            0 :     }
    1086              : 
    1087            0 :     void Capturer::captureValue( size_t index, std::string const& value ) {
    1088            0 :         assert( index < m_messages.size() );
    1089            0 :         m_messages[index].message += value;
    1090            0 :         IResultCapture::pushScopedMessage( CATCH_MOVE( m_messages[index] ) );
    1091            0 :         m_captured++;
    1092            0 :     }

    1247          118 :                             m_tests.emplace( &test );

    1276              :                 }

    1315              :                     }

    1486            1 :     int Session::runInternal() {
    1487            1 :         if ( m_startupExceptions ) { return UnspecifiedErrorExitCode; }
    1488              : 
    1489            1 :         if (m_configData.showHelp || m_configData.libIdentify) {
    1490            0 :             return 0;
    1491              :         }
    1492              : 
    1493            1 :         if ( m_configData.shardIndex >= m_configData.shardCount ) {
    1494            0 :             Catch::cerr() << "The shard count (" << m_configData.shardCount
    1495            0 :                           << ") must be greater than the shard index ("
    1496            0 :                           << m_configData.shardIndex << ")\n"
    1497            0 :                           << std::flush;
    1498            0 :             return UnspecifiedErrorExitCode;
    1499              :         }
    1500              : 
    1501              :         CATCH_TRY {
    1502            1 :             config(); // Force config to be constructed
    1503              : 
    1504              :             // We need to retrieve potential Bazel config with the full Config
    1505              :             // constructor, so we have to create the guard file after it is created.
    1506            1 :             setUpGuardFile( m_config->getExitGuardFilePath() );
    1507              : 
    1508            1 :             seedRng( *m_config );
    1509              : 
    1510            1 :             if (m_configData.filenamesAsTags) {
    1511            0 :                 applyFilenamesAsTags();
    1512              :             }
    1513              : 
    1514              :             // Set up global config instance before we start calling into other functions
    1515            1 :             getCurrentMutableContext().setConfig(m_config.get());
    1516              : 
    1517              :             // Create reporter(s) so we can route listings through them
    1518            1 :             auto reporter = prepareReporters(m_config.get());
    1519              : 
    1520            1 :             auto const& invalidSpecs = m_config->testSpec().getInvalidSpecs();
    1521            1 :             if ( !invalidSpecs.empty() ) {
    1522            0 :                 for ( auto const& spec : invalidSpecs ) {
    1523            0 :                     reporter->reportInvalidTestSpec( spec );
    1524              :                 }
    1525            0 :                 return InvalidTestSpecExitCode;
    1526              :             }
    1527              : 
    1528              : 
    1529              :             // Handle list request
    1530            1 :             if (list(*reporter, *m_config)) {
    1531            0 :                 return 0;
    1532              :             }
    1533              : 
    1534            1 :             TestGroup tests { CATCH_MOVE(reporter), m_config.get() };
    1535            1 :             auto const totals = tests.execute();
    1536              : 
    1537              :             // If we got here, running the tests finished normally-enough.
    1538              :             // They might've failed, but that would've been reported elsewhere.
    1539            1 :             tearDownGuardFile( m_config->getExitGuardFilePath() );
    1540              : 
    1541            1 :             if ( tests.hadUnmatchedTestSpecs()
    1542            1 :                 && m_config->warnAboutUnmatchedTestSpecs() ) {
    1543            0 :                 return UnmatchedTestSpecExitCode;
    1544              :             }
    1545              : 
    1546            1 :             if ( totals.testCases.total() == 0
    1547            1 :                 && !m_config->zeroTestsCountAsSuccess() ) {

    1625          236 :         TestCaseProperties parseSpecialTag( StringRef tag ) {
    1626          236 :             if( !tag.empty() && tag[0] == '.' )
    1627            0 :                 return TestCaseProperties::IsHidden;
    1628          236 :             else if( tag == "!throws"_sr )
    1629            0 :                 return TestCaseProperties::Throws;
    1630          236 :             else if( tag == "!shouldfail"_sr )
    1631            0 :                 return TestCaseProperties::ShouldFail;
    1632          236 :             else if( tag == "!mayfail"_sr )
    1633            0 :                 return TestCaseProperties::MayFail;
    1634          236 :             else if( tag == "!nonportable"_sr )
    1635            0 :                 return TestCaseProperties::NonPortable;
    1636          236 :             else if( tag == "!benchmark"_sr )
    1637            0 :                 return TestCaseProperties::Benchmark | TestCaseProperties::IsHidden;
    1638              :             else

    1640              :         }

    1643          118 :                 && tag.size() > 0

    1653            0 :         std::string makeDefaultName() {
    1654              :             static size_t counter = 0;
    1655            0 :             return "Anonymous test case " + std::to_string(++counter);
    1656              :         }
    1657              : 
    1658          118 :         constexpr StringRef extractFilenamePart(StringRef filename) {
    1659          118 :             size_t lastDot = filename.size();
    1660          472 :             while (lastDot > 0 && filename[lastDot - 1] != '.') {
    1661          354 :                 --lastDot;
    1662              :             }
    1663              :             // In theory we could have filename without any extension in it
    1664          118 :             if ( lastDot == 0 ) { return StringRef(); }
    1665              : 
    1666          118 :             --lastDot;
    1667          118 :             size_t nameStart = lastDot;
    1668         1554 :             while (nameStart > 0 && filename[nameStart - 1] != '/' && filename[nameStart - 1] != '\\') {
    1669         1436 :                 --nameStart;
    1670              :             }
    1671              : 
    1672          118 :             return filename.substr(nameStart, lastDot - nameStart);
    1673              :         }
    1674              : 
    1675              :         // Returns the upper bound on size of extra tags ([#file]+[.])
    1676          118 :         constexpr size_t sizeOfExtraTags(StringRef filepath) {
    1677              :             // [.] is 3, [#] is another 3
    1678          118 :             const size_t extras = 3 + 3;
    1679          118 :             return extractFilenamePart(filepath).size() + extras;
    1680              :         }
    1681              :     } // end unnamed namespace

    1683            0 :     bool operator<(  Tag const& lhs, Tag const& rhs ) {

    1685            0 :         return cmp( lhs.original, rhs.original );
    1686              :     }

    1688              :         Detail::CaseInsensitiveEqualTo cmp;
    1689            0 :         return cmp( lhs.original, rhs.original );

    1698              : 
    1699          118 :     TestCaseInfo::TestCaseInfo(StringRef _className,
    1700              :                                NameAndTags const& _nameAndTags,
    1701          118 :                                SourceLineInfo const& _lineInfo):
    1702          118 :         name( _nameAndTags.name.empty() ? makeDefaultName() : _nameAndTags.name ),
    1703          118 :         className( _className ),
    1704          118 :         lineInfo( _lineInfo )
    1705              :     {
    1706          118 :         StringRef originalTags = _nameAndTags.tags;
    1707              :         // We need to reserve enough space to store all of the tags
    1708              :         // (including optional hidden tag and filename tag)
    1709          118 :         auto requiredSize = originalTags.size() + sizeOfExtraTags(_lineInfo.file);
    1710          118 :         backingTags.reserve(requiredSize);
    1711              : 
    1712              :         // We cannot copy the tags directly, as we need to normalize
    1713              :         // some tags, so that [.foo] is copied as [.][foo].
    1714          118 :         size_t tagStart = 0;
    1715          118 :         size_t tagEnd = 0;
    1716          118 :         bool inTag = false;
    1717         1288 :         for (size_t idx = 0; idx < originalTags.size(); ++idx) {
    1718         1170 :             auto c = originalTags[idx];
    1719         1170 :             if (c == '[') {
    1720          118 :                 CATCH_ENFORCE(
    1721              :                     !inTag,
    1722              :                     "Found '[' inside a tag while registering test case '"
    1723              :                         << _nameAndTags.name << "' at " << _lineInfo );
    1724              : 
    1725          118 :                 inTag = true;
    1726          118 :                 tagStart = idx;
    1727              :             }
    1728         1170 :             if (c == ']') {
    1729          118 :                 CATCH_ENFORCE(
    1730              :                     inTag,
    1731              :                     "Found unmatched ']' while registering test case '"
    1732              :                         << _nameAndTags.name << "' at " << _lineInfo );
    1733              : 
    1734          118 :                 inTag = false;
    1735          118 :                 tagEnd = idx;
    1736          118 :                 assert(tagStart < tagEnd);
    1737              : 
    1738              :                 // We need to check the tag for special meanings, copy
    1739              :                 // it over to backing storage and actually reference the
    1740              :                 // backing storage in the saved tags
    1741          118 :                 StringRef tagStr = originalTags.substr(tagStart+1, tagEnd - tagStart - 1);
    1742          118 :                 CATCH_ENFORCE( !tagStr.empty(),
    1743              :                                "Found an empty tag while registering test case '"
    1744              :                                    << _nameAndTags.name << "' at "
    1745              :                                    << _lineInfo );
    1746              : 
    1747          118 :                 enforceNotReservedTag(tagStr, lineInfo);
    1748          118 :                 properties |= parseSpecialTag(tagStr);
    1749              :                 // When copying a tag to the backing storage, we need to
    1750              :                 // check if it is a merged hide tag, such as [.foo], and
    1751              :                 // if it is, we need to handle it as if it was [foo].
    1752          118 :                 if (tagStr.size() > 1 && tagStr[0] == '.') {
    1753            0 :                     tagStr = tagStr.substr(1, tagStr.size() - 1);
    1754              :                 }
    1755              :                 // We skip over dealing with the [.] tag, as we will add
    1756              :                 // it later unconditionally and then sort and unique all
    1757              :                 // the tags.
    1758          118 :                 internalAppendTag(tagStr);
    1759              :             }
    1760              :         }
    1761          118 :         CATCH_ENFORCE( !inTag,
    1762              :                        "Found an unclosed tag while registering test case '"
    1763              :                            << _nameAndTags.name << "' at " << _lineInfo );
    1764              : 
    1765              : 
    1766              :         // Add [.] if relevant
    1767          118 :         if (isHidden()) {
    1768            0 :             internalAppendTag("."_sr);
    1769              :         }
    1770              : 
    1771              :         // Sort and prepare tags
    1772          354 :         std::sort(begin(tags), end(tags));
    1773          354 :         tags.erase(std::unique(begin(tags), end(tags)),
    1774          236 :                    end(tags));

    1796            0 :     std::string TestCaseInfo::tagsAsString() const {
    1797            0 :         std::string ret;
    1798              :         // '[' and ']' per tag
    1799            0 :         std::size_t full_size = 2 * tags.size();
    1800            0 :         for (const auto& tag : tags) {
    1801            0 :             full_size += tag.original.size();
    1802              :         }
    1803            0 :         ret.reserve(full_size);
    1804            0 :         for (const auto& tag : tags) {
    1805            0 :             ret.push_back('[');
    1806            0 :             ret += tag.original;
    1807            0 :             ret.push_back(']');
    1808              :         }
    1809              : 
    1810            0 :         return ret;
    1811            0 :     }
    1812              : 
    1813          118 :     void TestCaseInfo::internalAppendTag(StringRef tagStr) {
    1814          118 :         backingTags += '[';
    1815          118 :         const auto backingStart = backingTags.size();
    1816          118 :         backingTags += tagStr;
    1817          118 :         const auto backingEnd = backingTags.size();
    1818          118 :         backingTags += ']';
    1819          118 :         tags.emplace_back(StringRef(backingTags.c_str() + backingStart, backingEnd - backingStart));
    1820          118 :     }
    1821              : 
    1822         1012 :     bool operator<( TestCaseInfo const& lhs, TestCaseInfo const& rhs ) {
    1823              :         // We want to avoid redoing the string comparisons multiple times,
    1824              :         // so we store the result of a three-way comparison before using
    1825              :         // it in the actual comparison logic.
    1826         1012 :         const auto cmpName = lhs.name.compare( rhs.name );
    1827         1012 :         if ( cmpName != 0 ) {
    1828         1012 :             return cmpName < 0;
    1829              :         }
    1830            0 :         const auto cmpClassName = lhs.className.compare( rhs.className );
    1831            0 :         if ( cmpClassName != 0 ) {
    1832            0 :             return cmpClassName < 0;
    1833              :         }
    1834            0 :         return lhs.tags < rhs.tags;
    1835              :     }

    1891            0 :             should_use = true;

    1893            0 :                 return false;
    1894              :             }
    1895              :         }

    1897            0 :             if (pattern->matches(testCase)) {
    1898            0 :                 return false;
    1899              :             }
    1900              :         }
    1901            0 :         return should_use;
    1902              :     }

    1904            0 :     void TestSpec::Filter::serializeTo( std::ostream& out ) const {
    1905            0 :         bool first = true;

    1907            0 :             if ( !first ) {

    1909              :             }

    1911            0 :             first = false;
    1912              :         }

    1914            0 :             if ( !first ) {
    1915            0 :                 out << ' ';
    1916              :             }
    1917            0 :             out << *pattern;
    1918            0 :             first = false;

    1933            0 :     bool TestSpec::matches( TestCaseInfo const& testCase ) const {
    1934            0 :         return std::any_of( m_filters.begin(), m_filters.end(), [&]( Filter const& f ){ return f.matches( testCase ); } );

    1937            0 :     TestSpec::Matches TestSpec::matchesByFilter( std::vector<TestCaseHandle> const& testCases, IConfig const& config ) const {
    1938            0 :         Matches matches;
    1939            0 :         matches.reserve( m_filters.size() );
    1940            0 :         for ( auto const& filter : m_filters ) {
    1941            0 :             std::vector<TestCaseHandle const*> currentMatches;
    1942            0 :             for ( auto const& test : testCases )
    1943            0 :                 if ( isThrowSafe( test, config ) &&
    1944            0 :                      filter.matches( test.getTestCaseInfo() ) )
    1945            0 :                     currentMatches.emplace_back( &test );
    1946            0 :             matches.push_back(
    1947            0 :                 FilterMatch{ extractFilterName( filter ), currentMatches } );
    1948            0 :         }
    1949            0 :         return matches;
    1950            0 :     }

    1960            0 :                 out << ',';
    1961              :             }
    1962            0 :             out << filter;
    1963            0 :             first = false;
    1964              :         }

    1975              :     namespace {
    1976          478 :         static auto getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch() -> uint64_t {
    1977          478 :             return std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::nanoseconds>(std::chrono::steady_clock::now().time_since_epoch()).count();
    1978              :         }
    1979              :     } // end unnamed namespace
    1980              : 
    1981          239 :     void Timer::start() {
    1982          239 :        m_nanoseconds = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
    1983          239 :     }
    1984          239 :     auto Timer::getElapsedNanoseconds() const -> uint64_t {
    1985          239 :         return getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch() - m_nanoseconds;
    1986              :     }
    1987          239 :     auto Timer::getElapsedMicroseconds() const -> uint64_t {
    1988          239 :         return getElapsedNanoseconds()/1000;
    1989              :     }
    1990            0 :     auto Timer::getElapsedMilliseconds() const -> unsigned int {
    1991            0 :         return static_cast<unsigned int>(getElapsedMicroseconds()/1000);
    1992              :     }
    1993          239 :     auto Timer::getElapsedSeconds() const -> double {
    1994          239 :         return static_cast<double>(getElapsedMicroseconds())/1000000.0;
    1995              :     }

    2006              : 
    2007              : namespace Detail {
    2008              : 
    2009              :     namespace {
    2010              :         const int hexThreshold = 255;
    2011              : 
    2012              :         struct Endianness {
    2013              :             enum Arch : uint8_t {
    2014              :                 Big,
    2015              :                 Little
    2016              :             };
    2017              : 
    2018            0 :             static Arch which() {
    2019            0 :                 int one = 1;
    2020              :                 // If the lowest byte we read is non-zero, we can assume
    2021              :                 // that little endian format is used.
    2022            0 :                 auto value = *reinterpret_cast<char*>(&one);
    2023            0 :                 return value ? Little : Big;
    2024              :             }
    2025              :         };
    2026              : 
    2027              :         template<typename T>
    2028            0 :         std::string fpToString(T value, int precision) {
    2029            0 :             if (Catch::isnan(value)) {
    2030            0 :                 return "nan";
    2031              :             }
    2032              : 
    2033            0 :             ReusableStringStream rss;
    2034            0 :             rss << std::setprecision(precision)
    2035            0 :                 << std::fixed
    2036            0 :                 << value;
    2037            0 :             std::string d = rss.str();
    2038            0 :             std::size_t i = d.find_last_not_of('0');
    2039            0 :             if (i != std::string::npos && i != d.size() - 1) {
    2040            0 :                 if (d[i] == '.')
    2041            0 :                     i++;
    2042            0 :                 d = d.substr(0, i + 1);
    2043              :             }
    2044            0 :             return d;
    2045            0 :         }
    2046              :     } // end unnamed namespace
    2047              : 
    2048            0 :     std::string convertIntoString(StringRef string, bool escapeInvisibles) {
    2049            0 :         std::string ret;
    2050              :         // This is enough for the "don't escape invisibles" case, and a good
    2051              :         // lower bound on the "escape invisibles" case.
    2052            0 :         ret.reserve( string.size() + 2 );
    2053              : 
    2054            0 :         if ( !escapeInvisibles ) {
    2055            0 :             ret += '"';
    2056            0 :             ret += string;
    2057            0 :             ret += '"';
    2058            0 :             return ret;
    2059              :         }
    2060              : 
    2061            0 :         size_t last_start = 0;
    2062            0 :         auto write_to = [&]( size_t idx ) {
    2063            0 :             if ( last_start < idx ) {
    2064            0 :                 ret += string.substr( last_start, idx - last_start );
    2065              :             }
    2066            0 :             last_start = idx + 1;
    2067            0 :         };
    2068              : 
    2069            0 :         ret += '"';
    2070            0 :         for ( size_t i = 0; i < string.size(); ++i ) {
    2071            0 :             const char c = string[i];
    2072            0 :             if ( c == '\r' || c == '\n' || c == '\t' || c == '\f' ) {
    2073            0 :                 write_to( i );
    2074            0 :                 if ( c == '\r' ) { ret.append( "\\r" ); }
    2075            0 :                 if ( c == '\n' ) { ret.append( "\\n" ); }
    2076            0 :                 if ( c == '\t' ) { ret.append( "\\t" ); }
    2077            0 :                 if ( c == '\f' ) { ret.append( "\\f" ); }
    2078              :             }
    2079              :         }
    2080            0 :         write_to( string.size() );
    2081            0 :         ret += '"';
    2082              : 
    2083            0 :         return ret;
    2084            0 :     }
    2085              :

    2090            0 :     std::string rawMemoryToString( const void *object, std::size_t size ) {
    2091              :         // Reverse order for little endian architectures
    2092            0 :         int i = 0, end = static_cast<int>( size ), inc = 1;
    2093            0 :         if( Endianness::which() == Endianness::Little ) {
    2094            0 :             i = end-1;
    2095            0 :             end = inc = -1;
    2096              :         }
    2097              : 
    2098            0 :         unsigned char const *bytes = static_cast<unsigned char const *>(object);
    2099            0 :         ReusableStringStream rss;
    2100            0 :         rss << "0x" << std::setfill('0') << std::hex;
    2101            0 :         for( ; i != end; i += inc )
    2102            0 :              rss << std::setw(2) << static_cast<unsigned>(bytes[i]);
    2103            0 :        return rss.str();
    2104            0 :     }

    2627          645 :     void AssertionHandler::complete() {

    2630              : 
    2631              :             // If you find your debugger stopping you here then go one level up on the
    2632              :             // call-stack for the code that caused it (typically a failed assertion)
    2633              : 
    2634              :             // (To go back to the test and change execution, jump over the throw, next)
    2635            0 :             CATCH_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER();
    2636              :         }
    2637          645 :         if (m_reaction.shouldThrow) {
    2638            0 :             throw_test_failure_exception();
    2639              :         }
    2640          645 :         if ( m_reaction.shouldSkip ) {
    2641            0 :             throw_test_skip_exception();
    2642              :         }

    2727            0 :     static size_t find_first_separator(Catch::StringRef sr) {
    2728            0 :         auto is_separator = []( char c ) {
    2729            0 :             return c == ' ' || c == ':' || c == '=';
    2730              :         };
    2731            0 :         size_t pos = 0;
    2732            0 :         while (pos < sr.size()) {
    2733            0 :             if (is_separator(sr[pos])) { return pos; }
    2734            0 :             ++pos;
    2735              :         }
    2736              : 
    2737            0 :         return Catch::StringRef::npos;
    2738              :     }
    2739              : 
    2740              : } // namespace

    2746            1 :             void TokenStream::loadBuffer() {
    2747            1 :                 m_tokenBuffer.clear();
    2748              : 
    2749              :                 // Skip any empty strings
    2750            1 :                 while ( it != itEnd && it->empty() ) {
    2751            0 :                     ++it;
    2752              :                 }
    2753              : 
    2754            1 :                 if ( it != itEnd ) {
    2755            0 :                     StringRef next = *it;
    2756            0 :                     if ( isOptPrefix( next[0] ) ) {
    2757            0 :                         auto delimiterPos = find_first_separator(next);
    2758            0 :                         if ( delimiterPos != StringRef::npos ) {
    2759            0 :                             m_tokenBuffer.push_back(
    2760              :                                 { TokenType::Option,
    2761            0 :                                   next.substr( 0, delimiterPos ) } );
    2762            0 :                             m_tokenBuffer.push_back(
    2763              :                                 { TokenType::Argument,
    2764            0 :                                   next.substr( delimiterPos + 1, next.size() ) } );
    2765              :                         } else {
    2766            0 :                             if ( next.size() > 1 && next[1] != '-' && next.size() > 2 ) {
    2767              :                                 // Combined short args, e.g. "-ab" for "-a -b"
    2768            0 :                                 for ( size_t i = 1; i < next.size(); ++i ) {
    2769            0 :                                     m_tokenBuffer.push_back(
    2770              :                                         { TokenType::Option,
    2771            0 :                                           next.substr( i, 1 ) } );
    2772              :                                 }
    2773              :                             } else {
    2774            0 :                                 m_tokenBuffer.push_back(
    2775              :                                     { TokenType::Option, next } );
    2776              :                             }
    2777              :                         }
    2778              :                     } else {
    2779            0 :                         m_tokenBuffer.push_back(
    2780              :                             { TokenType::Argument, next } );
    2781              :                     }
    2782              :                 }
    2783            1 :             }
    2784              :

    3034            0 :                         os << '[';
    3035            0 :                         required = false;
    3036              :                     }

    3040              :                 }

    3076            0 :                     return result;
    3077            0 :             }
    3078            0 :             return Detail::Result::ok();

    3080              : 
    3081              :         Detail::InternalParseResult
    3082            1 :         Parser::parse( std::string const& exeName,
    3083              :                        Detail::TokenStream tokens ) const {
    3084              : 
    3085              :             struct ParserInfo {
    3086              :                 ParserBase const* parser = nullptr;
    3087              :                 size_t count = 0;
    3088              :             };
    3089            1 :             std::vector<ParserInfo> parseInfos;
    3090            1 :             parseInfos.reserve( m_options.size() + m_args.size() );
    3091           37 :             for ( auto const& opt : m_options ) {
    3092           36 :                 parseInfos.push_back( { &opt, 0 } );
    3093              :             }
    3094            2 :             for ( auto const& arg : m_args ) {
    3095            1 :                 parseInfos.push_back( { &arg, 0 } );
    3096              :             }
    3097              : 
    3098            1 :             m_exeName.set( exeName );
    3099              : 
    3100              :             auto result = Detail::InternalParseResult::ok(
    3101            1 :                 Detail::ParseState( ParseResultType::NoMatch, CATCH_MOVE(tokens) ) );
    3102            1 :             while ( result.value().remainingTokens() ) {
    3103            0 :                 bool tokenParsed = false;
    3104              : 
    3105            0 :                 for ( auto& parseInfo : parseInfos ) {
    3106            0 :                     if ( parseInfo.parser->cardinality() == 0 ||
    3107            0 :                          parseInfo.count < parseInfo.parser->cardinality() ) {

    3113              :                              ParseResultType::NoMatch ) {
    3114            0 :                             tokenParsed = true;
    3115            0 :                             ++parseInfo.count;
    3116            0 :                             break;
    3117              :                         }
    3118              :                     }
    3119              :                 }
    3120              : 
    3121            0 :                 if ( result.value().type() == ParseResultType::ShortCircuitAll )
    3122            0 :                     return result;

    3522              : 
    3523              :     namespace {
    3524              :         //! A do-nothing implementation of colour, used as fallback for unknown
    3525              :         //! platforms, and when the user asks to deactivate all colours.
    3526              :         class NoColourImpl final : public ColourImpl {
    3527              :         public:
    3528            0 :             NoColourImpl( IStream* stream ): ColourImpl( stream ) {}
    3529              : 
    3530              :         private:
    3531            0 :             void use( Colour::Code ) const override {}
    3532              :         };
    3533              :     } // namespace

    3538              : 
    3539              : #if defined ( CATCH_CONFIG_COLOUR_WIN32 ) /////////////////////////////////////////
    3540              : 
    3541              : namespace Catch {
    3542              : namespace {
    3543              : 
    3544              :     class Win32ColourImpl final : public ColourImpl {
    3545              :     public:
    3546              :         Win32ColourImpl(IStream* stream):
    3547              :             ColourImpl(stream) {
    3548              :             CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO csbiInfo;
    3549              :             GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo( GetStdHandle( STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE ),
    3550              :                                         &csbiInfo );
    3551              :             originalForegroundAttributes = csbiInfo.wAttributes & ~( BACKGROUND_GREEN | BACKGROUND_RED | BACKGROUND_BLUE | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY );
    3552              :             originalBackgroundAttributes = csbiInfo.wAttributes & ~( FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY );
    3553              :         }
    3554              : 
    3555              :         static bool useImplementationForStream(IStream const& stream) {
    3556              :             // Win32 text colour APIs can only be used on console streams
    3557              :             // We cannot check that the output hasn't been redirected,
    3558              :             // so we just check that the original stream is console stream.
    3559              :             return stream.isConsole();
    3560              :         }
    3561              : 
    3562              :     private:
    3563              :         void use( Colour::Code _colourCode ) const override {
    3564              :             switch( _colourCode ) {
    3565              :                 case Colour::None:      return setTextAttribute( originalForegroundAttributes );
    3566              :                 case Colour::White:     return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE );
    3567              :                 case Colour::Red:       return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_RED );
    3568              :                 case Colour::Green:     return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    3569              :                 case Colour::Blue:      return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_BLUE );
    3570              :                 case Colour::Cyan:      return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    3571              :                 case Colour::Yellow:    return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    3572              :                 case Colour::Grey:      return setTextAttribute( 0 );
    3573              : 
    3574              :                 case Colour::LightGrey:     return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY );
    3575              :                 case Colour::BrightRed:     return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_RED );
    3576              :                 case Colour::BrightGreen:   return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    3577              :                 case Colour::BrightWhite:   return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE );
    3578              :                 case Colour::BrightYellow:  return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    3579              : 
    3580              :                 case Colour::Bright: CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "not a colour" );
    3581              : 
    3582              :                 default:
    3583              :                     CATCH_ERROR( "Unknown colour requested" );
    3584              :             }
    3585              :         }
    3586              : 
    3587              :         void setTextAttribute( WORD _textAttribute ) const {
    3588              :             SetConsoleTextAttribute( GetStdHandle( STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE ),
    3589              :                                      _textAttribute |
    3590              :                                          originalBackgroundAttributes );
    3591              :         }
    3592              :         WORD originalForegroundAttributes;
    3593              :         WORD originalBackgroundAttributes;
    3594              :     };
    3595              : 
    3596              : } // end anon namespace
    3597              : } // end namespace Catch
    3598              : 
    3599              : #endif // Windows/ ANSI/ None
    3600              : 
    3601              : 
    3602              : #if defined( CATCH_PLATFORM_LINUX ) \

    3614              :     class ANSIColourImpl final : public ColourImpl {
    3615              :     public:
    3616            1 :         ANSIColourImpl( IStream* stream ): ColourImpl( stream ) {}
    3617              : 
    3618            1 :         static bool useImplementationForStream(IStream const& stream) {
    3619              :             // This is kinda messy due to trying to support a bunch of
    3620              :             // different platforms at once.
    3621              :             // The basic idea is that if we are asked to do autodetection (as
    3622              :             // opposed to being told to use posixy colours outright), then we
    3623              :             // only want to use the colours if we are writing to console.
    3624              :             // However, console might be redirected, so we make an attempt at
    3625              :             // checking for that on platforms where we know how to do that.
    3626            1 :             bool useColour = stream.isConsole();
    3627              : #if defined( CATCH_INTERNAL_HAS_ISATTY ) && \
    3628              :     !( defined( __DJGPP__ ) && defined( __STRICT_ANSI__ ) )
    3629            1 :             ErrnoGuard _; // for isatty
    3630            1 :             useColour = useColour && isatty( STDOUT_FILENO );
    3631              : #    endif
    3632              : #    if defined( CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC ) || defined( CATCH_PLATFORM_IPHONE )
    3633              :             useColour = useColour && !isDebuggerActive();
    3634              : #    endif
    3635              : 
    3636            1 :             return useColour;
    3637            1 :         }
    3638              : 
    3639              :     private:
    3640           10 :         void use( Colour::Code _colourCode ) const override {
    3641           10 :             auto setColour = [&out =
    3642           10 :                                   m_stream->stream()]( char const* escapeCode ) {
    3643              :                 // The escape sequence must be flushed to console, otherwise
    3644              :                 // if stdin and stderr are intermixed, we'd get accidentally
    3645              :                 // coloured output.
    3646           10 :                 out << '\033' << escapeCode << std::flush;
    3647           20 :             };
    3648           10 :             switch( _colourCode ) {
    3649            5 :                 case Colour::None:
    3650            5 :                 case Colour::White:     return setColour( "[0m" );
    3651            0 :                 case Colour::Red:       return setColour( "[0;31m" );
    3652            0 :                 case Colour::Green:     return setColour( "[0;32m" );
    3653            0 :                 case Colour::Blue:      return setColour( "[0;34m" );
    3654            0 :                 case Colour::Cyan:      return setColour( "[0;36m" );
    3655            0 :                 case Colour::Yellow:    return setColour( "[0;33m" );
    3656            0 :                 case Colour::Grey:      return setColour( "[1;30m" );
    3657              : 
    3658            1 :                 case Colour::LightGrey:     return setColour( "[0;37m" );
    3659            1 :                 case Colour::BrightRed:     return setColour( "[1;31m" );
    3660            2 :                 case Colour::BrightGreen:   return setColour( "[1;32m" );
    3661            0 :                 case Colour::BrightWhite:   return setColour( "[1;37m" );
    3662            1 :                 case Colour::BrightYellow:  return setColour( "[1;33m" );
    3663              : 
    3664            0 :                 case Colour::Bright: CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "not a colour" );
    3665            0 :                 default: CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Unknown colour requested" );
    3666              :             }
    3667              :         }
    3668              :     };
    3669              : 
    3670              : } // end anon namespace

    3778              : 
    3779              : #if defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC) || defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_IPHONE)
    3780              : 
    3781              : #  include <cassert>
    3782              : #  include <sys/types.h>
    3783              : #  include <unistd.h>
    3784              : #  include <cstddef>
    3785              : #  include <ostream>
    3786              : 
    3787              : #ifdef __apple_build_version__
    3788              :     // These headers will only compile with AppleClang (XCode)
    3789              :     // For other compilers (Clang, GCC, ... ) we need to exclude them
    3790              : #  include <sys/sysctl.h>
    3791              : #endif
    3792              : 
    3793              :     namespace Catch {
    3794              :         #ifdef __apple_build_version__
    3795              :         // The following function is taken directly from the following technical note:
    3796              :         // https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/qa/qa1361/_index.html
    3797              : 
    3798              :         // Returns true if the current process is being debugged (either
    3799              :         // running under the debugger or has a debugger attached post facto).
    3800              :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
    3801              :             int                 mib[4];
    3802              :             struct kinfo_proc   info;
    3803              :             std::size_t         size;
    3804              : 
    3805              :             // Initialize the flags so that, if sysctl fails for some bizarre
    3806              :             // reason, we get a predictable result.
    3807              : 
    3808              :             info.kp_proc.p_flag = 0;
    3809              : 
    3810              :             // Initialize mib, which tells sysctl the info we want, in this case
    3811              :             // we're looking for information about a specific process ID.
    3812              : 
    3813              :             mib[0] = CTL_KERN;
    3814              :             mib[1] = KERN_PROC;
    3815              :             mib[2] = KERN_PROC_PID;
    3816              :             mib[3] = getpid();
    3817              : 
    3818              :             // Call sysctl.
    3819              : 
    3820              :             size = sizeof(info);
    3821              :             if( sysctl(mib, sizeof(mib) / sizeof(*mib), &info, &size, nullptr, 0) != 0 ) {
    3822              :                 Catch::cerr() << "\n** Call to sysctl failed - unable to determine if debugger is active **\n\n" << std::flush;
    3823              :                 return false;
    3824              :             }
    3825              : 
    3826              :             // We're being debugged if the P_TRACED flag is set.
    3827              : 
    3828              :             return ( (info.kp_proc.p_flag & P_TRACED) != 0 );
    3829              :         }
    3830              :         #else
    3831              :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    3832              :             // We need to find another way to determine this for non-appleclang compilers on macOS
    3833              :             return false;
    3834              :         }
    3835              :         #endif
    3836              :     } // namespace Catch
    3837              : 
    3838              : #elif defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_LINUX) || defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_QNX)
    3839              :     #include <fstream>
    3840              :     #include <string>
    3841              : 
    3842              :     namespace Catch{
    3843              :         // The standard POSIX way of detecting a debugger is to attempt to
    3844              :         // ptrace() the process, but this needs to be done from a child and not
    3845              :         // this process itself to still allow attaching to this process later
    3846              :         // if wanted, so is rather heavy. Under Linux we have the PID of the
    3847              :         // "debugger" (which doesn't need to be gdb, of course, it could also
    3848              :         // be strace, for example) in /proc/$PID/status, so just get it from
    3849              :         // there instead.
    3850            0 :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
    3851              :             // Libstdc++ has a bug, where std::ifstream sets errno to 0
    3852              :             // This way our users can properly assert over errno values
    3853            0 :             ErrnoGuard guard;
    3854            0 :             std::ifstream in("/proc/self/status");
    3855            0 :             for( std::string line; std::getline(in, line); ) {
    3856              :                 static const int PREFIX_LEN = 11;
    3857            0 :                 if( line.compare(0, PREFIX_LEN, "TracerPid:\t") == 0 ) {
    3858              :                     // We're traced if the PID is not 0 and no other PID starts
    3859              :                     // with 0 digit, so it's enough to check for just a single
    3860              :                     // character.
    3861            0 :                     return line.length() > PREFIX_LEN && line[PREFIX_LEN] != '0';
    3862              :                 }
    3863            0 :             }
    3864              : 
    3865            0 :             return false;
    3866            0 :         }
    3867              :     } // namespace Catch
    3868              : #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
    3869              :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
    3870              :     namespace Catch {
    3871              :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    3872              :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
    3873              :         }
    3874              :     }
    3875              : #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
    3876              :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
    3877              :     namespace Catch {
    3878              :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    3879              :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
    3880              :         }
    3881              :     }
    3882              : #else
    3883              :     namespace Catch {
    3884              :        bool isDebuggerActive() { return false; }
    3885              :     }
    3886              : #endif // Platform
    3887              : 
    3888              : 
    3889              : 
    3890              : 
    3891              : namespace Catch {
    3892              : 
    3893            0 :     void ITransientExpression::streamReconstructedExpression(
    3894              :         std::ostream& os ) const {
    3895              :         // We can't make this function pure virtual to keep ITransientExpression
    3896              :         // constexpr, so we write error message instead
    3897            0 :         os << "Some class derived from ITransientExpression without overriding streamReconstructedExpression";
    3898            0 :     }

    3900            0 :     void formatReconstructedExpression( std::ostream &os, std::string const& lhs, StringRef op, std::string const& rhs ) {
    3901            0 :         if( lhs.size() + rhs.size() < 40 &&
    3902            0 :                 lhs.find('\n') == std::string::npos &&
    3903            0 :                 rhs.find('\n') == std::string::npos )
    3904            0 :             os << lhs << ' ' << op << ' ' << rhs;
    3905              :         else
    3906            0 :             os << lhs << '\n' << op << '\n' << rhs;
    3907            0 :     }
    3908              : }

    3920              :                       << "The message was: " << e.what() << '\n';
    3921              :         std::terminate();
