    3950            1 :     IMutableEnumValuesRegistry::~IMutableEnumValuesRegistry() = default;
    3951              : 
    3952              :     namespace Detail {
    3953              : 
    3954              :         namespace {
    3955              :             // Extracts the actual name part of an enum instance
    3956              :             // In other words, it returns the Blue part of Bikeshed::Colour::Blue
    3957            0 :             StringRef extractInstanceName(StringRef enumInstance) {
    3958              :                 // Find last occurrence of ":"
    3959            0 :                 size_t name_start = enumInstance.size();
    3960            0 :                 while (name_start > 0 && enumInstance[name_start - 1] != ':') {
    3961            0 :                     --name_start;
    3962              :                 }
    3963            0 :                 return enumInstance.substr(name_start, enumInstance.size() - name_start);
    3964              :             }
    3965              :         }
    3966              : 
    3967            0 :         std::vector<StringRef> parseEnums( StringRef enums ) {
    3968            0 :             auto enumValues = splitStringRef( enums, ',' );
    3969            0 :             std::vector<StringRef> parsed;
    3970            0 :             parsed.reserve( enumValues.size() );
    3971            0 :             for( auto const& enumValue : enumValues ) {
    3972            0 :                 parsed.push_back(trim(extractInstanceName(enumValue)));
    3973              :             }
    3974            0 :             return parsed;
    3975            0 :         }
    3976              : 
    3977            0 :         EnumInfo::~EnumInfo() = default;

    3979            0 :         StringRef EnumInfo::lookup( int value ) const {
    3980            0 :             for( auto const& valueToName : m_values ) {
    3981            0 :                 if( valueToName.first == value )
    3982            0 :                     return valueToName.second;
    3983              :             }
    3984            0 :             return "{** unexpected enum value **}"_sr;
    3985              :         }

    3987            0 :         Catch::Detail::unique_ptr<EnumInfo> makeEnumInfo( StringRef enumName, StringRef allValueNames, std::vector<int> const& values ) {
    3988            0 :             auto enumInfo = Catch::Detail::make_unique<EnumInfo>();
    3989            0 :             enumInfo->m_name = enumName;
    3990            0 :             enumInfo->m_values.reserve( values.size() );

    3994            0 :             std::size_t i = 0;
    3995            0 :             for( auto value : values )
    3996            0 :                 enumInfo->m_values.emplace_back(value, valueNames[i++]);
    3997              :

    4026              : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
    4027              :     namespace {
    4028            0 :         static std::string tryTranslators(
    4029              :             std::vector<
    4030              :                 Detail::unique_ptr<IExceptionTranslator const>> const& translators ) {
    4031            0 :             if ( translators.empty() ) {
    4032            0 :                 std::rethrow_exception( std::current_exception() );
    4033              :             } else {
    4034            0 :                 return translators[0]->translate( translators.begin() + 1,
    4035            0 :                                                   translators.end() );
    4036              :             }
    4037              :         }
    4038              : 
    4039              :     }
    4040              : #endif //!defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
    4041              : 
    4042            1 :     ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::~ExceptionTranslatorRegistry() = default;
    4043              : 
    4044            0 :     void ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::registerTranslator( Detail::unique_ptr<IExceptionTranslator>&& translator ) {
    4045            0 :         m_translators.push_back( CATCH_MOVE( translator ) );
    4046            0 :     }
    4047              : 
    4048              : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
    4049            0 :     std::string ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::translateActiveException() const {
    4050              :         // Compiling a mixed mode project with MSVC means that CLR
    4051              :         // exceptions will be caught in (...) as well. However, these do
    4052              :         // do not fill-in std::current_exception and thus lead to crash
    4053              :         // when attempting rethrow.
    4054              :         // /EHa switch also causes structured exceptions to be caught
    4055              :         // here, but they fill-in current_exception properly, so
    4056              :         // at worst the output should be a little weird, instead of
    4057              :         // causing a crash.
    4058            0 :         if ( std::current_exception() == nullptr ) {
    4059            0 :             return "Non C++ exception. Possibly a CLR exception.";
    4060              :         }
    4061              : 
    4062              :         // First we try user-registered translators. If none of them can
    4063              :         // handle the exception, it will be rethrown handled by our defaults.
    4064              :         try {
    4065            0 :             return tryTranslators(m_translators);
    4066              :         }
    4067              :         // To avoid having to handle TFE explicitly everywhere, we just
    4068              :         // rethrow it so that it goes back up the caller.
    4069            0 :         catch( TestFailureException& ) {
    4070            0 :             return "{ nested assertion failed }";
    4071            0 :         }
    4072            0 :         catch( TestSkipException& ) {
    4073            0 :             return "{ nested SKIP() called }";
    4074            0 :         }
    4075            0 :         catch( std::exception const& ex ) {
    4076            0 :             return ex.what();
    4077            0 :         }
    4078            0 :         catch( std::string const& msg ) {
    4079            0 :             return msg;
    4080            0 :         }
    4081            0 :         catch( const char* msg ) {
    4082            0 :             return msg;
    4083            0 :         }
    4084            0 :         catch(...) {
    4085            0 :             return "Unknown exception";
    4086            0 :         }
    4087              :     }
    4088              : 
    4089              : #else // ^^ Exceptions are enabled // Exceptions are disabled vv
    4090              :     std::string ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::translateActiveException() const {
    4091              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("Attempted to translate active exception under CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS!");
    4092              :     }
    4093              : #endif
    4094              : 
    4095              : }
    4096              : 
    4097              : 
    4098              : 
    4099              : /** \file
    4100              :  * This file provides platform specific implementations of FatalConditionHandler
    4101              :  *
    4102              :  * This means that there is a lot of conditional compilation, and platform
    4103              :  * specific code. Currently, Catch2 supports a dummy handler (if no
    4104              :  * handler is desired), and 2 platform specific handlers:
    4105              :  *  * Windows' SEH
    4106              :  *  * POSIX signals
    4107              :  *
    4108              :  * Consequently, various pieces of code below are compiled if either of
    4109              :  * the platform specific handlers is enabled, or if none of them are
    4110              :  * enabled. It is assumed that both cannot be enabled at the same time,
    4111              :  * and doing so should cause a compilation error.
    4112              :  *
    4113              :  * If another platform specific handler is added, the compile guards
    4114              :  * below will need to be updated taking these assumptions into account.
    4115              :  */
    4116              : 
    4117              : 
    4118              : 
    4119              : #include <algorithm>
    4120              : 
    4121              : #if !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH ) && !defined( CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS )
    4122              : 
    4123              : namespace Catch {
    4124              : 
    4125              :     // If neither SEH nor signal handling is required, the handler impls
    4126              :     // do not have to do anything, and can be empty.
    4127              :     void FatalConditionHandler::engage_platform() {}
    4128              :     void FatalConditionHandler::disengage_platform() noexcept {}
    4129              :     FatalConditionHandler::FatalConditionHandler() = default;
    4130              :     FatalConditionHandler::~FatalConditionHandler() = default;
    4131              : 
    4132              : } // end namespace Catch
    4133              : 
    4134              : #endif // !CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH && !CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS
    4135              : 
    4136              : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH ) && defined( CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS )
    4137              : #error "Inconsistent configuration: Windows' SEH handling and POSIX signals cannot be enabled at the same time"
    4138              : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH && CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS
    4139              : 
    4140              : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH ) || defined( CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS )
    4141              : 
    4142              : namespace {
    4143              :     //! Signals fatal error message to the run context
    4144            0 :     void reportFatal( char const * const message ) {
    4145            0 :         Catch::getCurrentContext().getResultCapture()->handleFatalErrorCondition( message );
    4146            0 :     }
    4147              : 
    4148              :     //! Minimal size Catch2 needs for its own fatal error handling.
    4149              :     //! Picked empirically, so it might not be sufficient on all
    4150              :     //! platforms, and for all configurations.
    4151              :     constexpr std::size_t minStackSizeForErrors = 32 * 1024;
    4152              : } // end unnamed namespace
    4153              : 
    4154              : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH || CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS
    4155              : 
    4156              : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH )
    4157              : 
    4158              : namespace Catch {
    4159              : 
    4160              :     struct SignalDefs { DWORD id; const char* name; };
    4161              : 
    4162              :     // There is no 1-1 mapping between signals and windows exceptions.
    4163              :     // Windows can easily distinguish between SO and SigSegV,
    4164              :     // but SigInt, SigTerm, etc are handled differently.
    4165              :     static constexpr SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
    4166              :         { EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION,  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
    4167              :         { EXCEPTION_STACK_OVERFLOW, "SIGSEGV - Stack overflow" },
    4168              :         { EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
    4169              :         { EXCEPTION_INT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO, "Divide by zero error" },
    4170              :     };
    4171              : 
    4172              :     // Since we do not support multiple instantiations, we put these
    4173              :     // into global variables and rely on cleaning them up in outlined
    4174              :     // constructors/destructors
    4175              :     static LPTOP_LEVEL_EXCEPTION_FILTER previousTopLevelExceptionFilter = nullptr;
    4176              : 
    4177              : 
    4178              :     static LONG CALLBACK topLevelExceptionFilter(PEXCEPTION_POINTERS ExceptionInfo) {
    4179              :         for (auto const& def : signalDefs) {
    4180              :             if (ExceptionInfo->ExceptionRecord->ExceptionCode == def.id) {
    4181              :                 reportFatal(def.name);
    4182              :             }
    4183              :         }
    4184              :         // If a filter was previously registered, invoke it
    4185              :         if (previousTopLevelExceptionFilter) {
    4186              :             return previousTopLevelExceptionFilter(ExceptionInfo);
    4187              :         }
    4188              :         // Otherwise, pass along all exceptions.
    4189              :         // This stops us from eating debugger breaks etc.
    4190              :         return EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
    4191              :     }
    4192              : 
    4193              :     // For MSVC, we reserve part of the stack memory for handling
    4194              :     // memory overflow structured exception.
    4195              :     FatalConditionHandler::FatalConditionHandler() {
    4196              :         ULONG guaranteeSize = static_cast<ULONG>(minStackSizeForErrors);
    4197              :         if (!SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize)) {
    4198              :             // We do not want to fully error out, because needing
    4199              :             // the stack reserve should be rare enough anyway.
    4200              :             Catch::cerr()
    4201              :                 << "Failed to reserve piece of stack."
    4202              :                 << " Stack overflows will not be reported successfully.";
    4203              :         }
    4204              :     }
    4205              : 
    4206              :     // We do not attempt to unset the stack guarantee, because
    4207              :     // Windows does not support lowering the stack size guarantee.
    4208              :     FatalConditionHandler::~FatalConditionHandler() = default;
    4209              : 
    4210              : 
    4211              :     void FatalConditionHandler::engage_platform() {
    4212              :         // Register as a the top level exception filter.
    4213              :         previousTopLevelExceptionFilter = SetUnhandledExceptionFilter(topLevelExceptionFilter);
    4214              :     }
    4215              : 
    4216              :     void FatalConditionHandler::disengage_platform() noexcept {
    4217              :         if (SetUnhandledExceptionFilter(previousTopLevelExceptionFilter) != topLevelExceptionFilter) {
    4218              :             Catch::cerr()
    4219              :                 << "Unexpected SEH unhandled exception filter on disengage."
    4220              :                 << " The filter was restored, but might be rolled back unexpectedly.";
    4221              :         }
    4222              :         previousTopLevelExceptionFilter = nullptr;
    4223              :     }
    4224              : 
    4225              : } // end namespace Catch
    4226              : 
    4227              : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH
    4228              : 
    4229              : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS )
    4230              : 
    4231              : #include <signal.h>
    4232              : 
    4233              : namespace Catch {
    4234              : 
    4235              :     struct SignalDefs {
    4236              :         int id;
    4237              :         const char* name;
    4238              :     };
    4239              : 
    4240              :     static constexpr SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
    4241              :         { SIGINT,  "SIGINT - Terminal interrupt signal" },
    4242              :         { SIGILL,  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
    4243              :         { SIGFPE,  "SIGFPE - Floating point error signal" },
    4244              :         { SIGSEGV, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
    4245              :         { SIGTERM, "SIGTERM - Termination request signal" },
    4246              :         { SIGABRT, "SIGABRT - Abort (abnormal termination) signal" }
    4247              :     };
    4248              : 
    4249              : // Older GCCs trigger -Wmissing-field-initializers for T foo = {}
    4250              : // which is zero initialization, but not explicit. We want to avoid
    4251              : // that.
    4252              : #if defined(__GNUC__)
    4253              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic push
    4254              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wmissing-field-initializers"
    4255              : #endif
    4256              : 
    4257              :     static char* altStackMem = nullptr;
    4258              :     static std::size_t altStackSize = 0;
    4259              :     static stack_t oldSigStack{};
    4260              :     static struct sigaction oldSigActions[sizeof(signalDefs) / sizeof(SignalDefs)]{};
    4261              : 
    4262          168 :     static void restorePreviousSignalHandlers() noexcept {
    4263              :         // We set signal handlers back to the previous ones. Hopefully
    4264              :         // nobody overwrote them in the meantime, and doesn't expect
    4265              :         // their signal handlers to live past ours given that they
    4266              :         // installed them after ours..
    4267         1176 :         for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs) / sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i) {
    4268         1008 :             sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &oldSigActions[i], nullptr);
    4269              :         }
    4270              :         // Return the old stack
    4271          168 :         sigaltstack(&oldSigStack, nullptr);
    4272          168 :     }
    4273              : 
    4274            0 :     static void handleSignal( int sig ) {
    4275            0 :         char const * name = "<unknown signal>";
    4276            0 :         for (auto const& def : signalDefs) {
    4277            0 :             if (sig == def.id) {
    4278            0 :                 name = def.name;
    4279            0 :                 break;
    4280              :             }
    4281              :         }
    4282              :         // We need to restore previous signal handlers and let them do
    4283              :         // their thing, so that the users can have the debugger break
    4284              :         // when a signal is raised, and so on.
    4285            0 :         restorePreviousSignalHandlers();
    4286            0 :         reportFatal( name );
    4287            0 :         raise( sig );
    4288            0 :     }
    4289              : 
    4290            1 :     FatalConditionHandler::FatalConditionHandler() {
    4291            1 :         assert(!altStackMem && "Cannot initialize POSIX signal handler when one already exists");
    4292            1 :         if (altStackSize == 0) {
    4293            1 :             altStackSize = std::max(static_cast<size_t>(SIGSTKSZ), minStackSizeForErrors);
    4294              :         }
    4295        32769 :         altStackMem = new char[altStackSize]();
    4296            1 :     }
    4297              : 
    4298            1 :     FatalConditionHandler::~FatalConditionHandler() {
    4299            1 :         delete[] altStackMem;
    4300              :         // We signal that another instance can be constructed by zeroing
    4301              :         // out the pointer.
    4302            1 :         altStackMem = nullptr;
    4303            1 :     }
    4304              : 
    4305          168 :     void FatalConditionHandler::engage_platform() {
    4306              :         stack_t sigStack;
    4307          168 :         sigStack.ss_sp = altStackMem;
    4308          168 :         sigStack.ss_size = altStackSize;
    4309          168 :         sigStack.ss_flags = 0;
    4310          168 :         sigaltstack(&sigStack, &oldSigStack);
    4311          168 :         struct sigaction sa = { };
    4312              : 
    4313          168 :         sa.sa_handler = handleSignal;
    4314          168 :         sa.sa_flags = SA_ONSTACK;
    4315         1176 :         for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i) {
    4316         1008 :             sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &sa, &oldSigActions[i]);
    4317              :         }
    4318          168 :     }
    4319              : 
    4320              : #if defined(__GNUC__)
    4321              : #    pragma GCC diagnostic pop
    4322              : #endif
    4323              : 
    4324              : 
    4325          168 :     void FatalConditionHandler::disengage_platform() noexcept {
    4326          168 :         restorePreviousSignalHandlers();
    4327          168 :     }
    4328              : 
    4329              : } // end namespace Catch
    4330              : 
    4331              : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS

    4409              : namespace Detail {
    4410              :     namespace {
    4411              :         template<typename WriterF, std::size_t bufferSize=256>
    4412              :         class StreamBufImpl final : public std::streambuf {
    4413              :             char data[bufferSize];
    4414              :             WriterF m_writer;
    4415              : 
    4416              :         public:
    4417            0 :             StreamBufImpl() {
    4418            0 :                 setp( data, data + sizeof(data) );
    4419            0 :             }
    4420              : 
    4421            0 :             ~StreamBufImpl() noexcept override {
    4422            0 :                 StreamBufImpl::sync();
    4423            0 :             }
    4424              : 
    4425              :         private:
    4426            0 :             int overflow( int c ) override {
    4427            0 :                 sync();
    4428              : 
    4429            0 :                 if( c != EOF ) {
    4430            0 :                     if( pbase() == epptr() )
    4431            0 :                         m_writer( std::string( 1, static_cast<char>( c ) ) );
    4432              :                     else
    4433            0 :                         sputc( static_cast<char>( c ) );
    4434              :                 }
    4435            0 :                 return 0;
    4436              :             }
    4437              : 
    4438            0 :             int sync() override {
    4439            0 :                 if( pbase() != pptr() ) {
    4440            0 :                     m_writer( std::string( pbase(), static_cast<std::string::size_type>( pptr() - pbase() ) ) );
    4441            0 :                     setp( pbase(), epptr() );
    4442              :                 }
    4443            0 :                 return 0;
    4444              :             }
    4445              :         };
    4446              : 
    4447              :         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    4448              :

    4450              :

    4452            0 :                 if ( !str.empty() ) {
    4453            0 :                     writeToDebugConsole( str );
    4454              :                 }
    4455            0 :             }

    4529            0 :                 return Detail::make_unique<Detail::CerrStream>();
    4530            0 :             } else if ( filename == "%stdout" ) {

    4546            0 :         static bool needsEscape( char c ) {
    4547            0 :             return c == '"' || c == '\\' || c == '\b' || c == '\f' ||
    4548            0 :                    c == '\n' || c == '\r' || c == '\t';
    4549              :         }
    4550              : 
    4551            0 :         static Catch::StringRef makeEscapeStringRef( char c ) {
    4552            0 :             if ( c == '"' ) {
    4553            0 :                 return "\\\""_sr;
    4554            0 :             } else if ( c == '\\' ) {
    4555            0 :                 return "\\\\"_sr;
    4556            0 :             } else if ( c == '\b' ) {
    4557            0 :                 return "\\b"_sr;
    4558            0 :             } else if ( c == '\f' ) {
    4559            0 :                 return "\\f"_sr;
    4560            0 :             } else if ( c == '\n' ) {
    4561            0 :                 return "\\n"_sr;
    4562            0 :             } else if ( c == '\r' ) {
    4563            0 :                 return "\\r"_sr;
    4564            0 :             } else if ( c == '\t' ) {
    4565            0 :                 return "\\t"_sr;
    4566              :             }
    4567            0 :             Catch::Detail::Unreachable();
    4568              :         }

    4678            0 :     void JsonValueWriter::writeImpl( Catch::StringRef value, bool quote ) {
    4679            0 :         if ( quote ) { m_os << '"'; }
    4680            0 :         size_t current_start = 0;
    4681            0 :         for ( size_t i = 0; i < value.size(); ++i ) {
    4682            0 :             if ( needsEscape( value[i] ) ) {
    4683            0 :                 if ( current_start < i ) {
    4684            0 :                     m_os << value.substr( current_start, i - current_start );
    4685              :                 }
    4686            0 :                 m_os << makeEscapeStringRef( value[i] );
    4687            0 :                 current_start = i + 1;
    4688              :             }
    4689              :         }
    4690            0 :         if ( current_start < value.size() ) {
    4691            0 :             m_os << value.substr( current_start, value.size() - current_start );
    4692              :         }
    4693            0 :         if ( quote ) { m_os << '"'; }
    4694            0 :     }
    4695              : 
    4696              : } // namespace Catch

    4700              :

    4702              : 
    4703            0 :     auto operator << (std::ostream& os, LazyExpression const& lazyExpr) -> std::ostream& {
    4704            0 :         if (lazyExpr.m_isNegated)
    4705            0 :             os << '!';
    4706              : 
    4707            0 :         if (lazyExpr) {
    4708            0 :             if (lazyExpr.m_isNegated && lazyExpr.m_transientExpression->isBinaryExpression())
    4709            0 :                 os << '(' << *lazyExpr.m_transientExpression << ')';
    4710              :             else
    4711            0 :                 os << *lazyExpr.m_transientExpression;
    4712              :         } else {
    4713            0 :             os << "{** error - unchecked empty expression requested **}";
    4714              :         }
    4715            0 :         return os;
    4716              :     }

    4728              :     LeakDetector::LeakDetector() {
    4729              :         int flag = _CrtSetDbgFlag(_CRTDBG_REPORT_FLAG);
    4730              :         flag |= _CRTDBG_LEAK_CHECK_DF;
    4731              :         flag |= _CRTDBG_ALLOC_MEM_DF;
    4732              :         _CrtSetDbgFlag(flag);
    4733              :         _CrtSetReportMode(_CRT_WARN, _CRTDBG_MODE_FILE | _CRTDBG_MODE_DEBUG);
    4734              :         _CrtSetReportFile(_CRT_WARN, _CRTDBG_FILE_STDERR);
    4735              :         // Change this to leaking allocation's number to break there
    4736              :         _CrtSetBreakAlloc(-1);
    4737              :     }

    4762            0 :         void listTags(IEventListener& reporter, IConfig const& config) {
    4763            0 :             auto const& testSpec = config.testSpec();
    4764            0 :             std::vector<TestCaseHandle> matchedTestCases = filterTests(getAllTestCasesSorted(config), testSpec, config);
    4765              : 
    4766            0 :             std::map<StringRef, TagInfo, Detail::CaseInsensitiveLess> tagCounts;
    4767            0 :             for (auto const& testCase : matchedTestCases) {
    4768            0 :                 for (auto const& tagName : testCase.getTestCaseInfo().tags) {
    4769            0 :                     auto it = tagCounts.find(tagName.original);
    4770            0 :                     if (it == tagCounts.end())
    4771            0 :                         it = tagCounts.insert(std::make_pair(tagName.original, TagInfo())).first;
    4772            0 :                     it->second.add(tagName.original);
    4773              :                 }
    4774              :             }
    4775              : 
    4776            0 :             std::vector<TagInfo> infos; infos.reserve(tagCounts.size());
    4777            0 :             for (auto& tagc : tagCounts) {
    4778            0 :                 infos.push_back(CATCH_MOVE(tagc.second));
    4779              :             }
    4780              : 
    4781            0 :             reporter.listTags(infos);
    4782            0 :         }
    4783              : 
    4784            0 :         void listReporters(IEventListener& reporter) {
    4785            0 :             std::vector<ReporterDescription> descriptions;
    4786              : 
    4787            0 :             auto const& factories = getRegistryHub().getReporterRegistry().getFactories();

    4789            0 :             for (auto const& fac : factories) {
    4790            0 :                 descriptions.push_back({ fac.first, fac.second->getDescription() });
    4791              :             }
    4792              : 
    4793            0 :             reporter.listReporters(descriptions);
    4794            0 :         }
    4795              : 
    4796            0 :         void listListeners(IEventListener& reporter) {

    4798              : 
    4799              :             auto const& factories =
    4800            0 :                 getRegistryHub().getReporterRegistry().getListeners();

    4804              :             }
    4805              :

    4808              :

    4810              : 
    4811            0 :     void TagInfo::add( StringRef spelling ) {

    4814            0 :     }

    4816            0 :     std::string TagInfo::all() const {
    4817              :         // 2 per tag for brackets '[' and ']'

    4820            0 :             size += spelling.size();

    4826            0 :             out += spelling;
    4827            0 :             out += ']';
    4828              :         }
    4829            0 :         return out;
    4830            0 :     }
    4831              : 
    4832            1 :     bool list( IEventListener& reporter, Config const& config ) {
    4833            1 :         bool listed = false;

    4835            0 :             listed = true;

    4922              : namespace Catch {

    4924              :     namespace {
    4925              :         //! A no-op implementation, used if no reporter wants output
    4926              :         //! redirection.
    4927              :         class NoopRedirect : public OutputRedirect {
    4928          310 :             void activateImpl() override {}
    4929          310 :             void deactivateImpl() override {}
    4930          168 :             std::string getStdout() override { return {}; }
    4931          168 :             std::string getStderr() override { return {}; }
    4932          168 :             void clearBuffers() override {}
    4933              :         };
    4934              : 
    4935              :         /**
    4936              :          * Redirects specific stream's rdbuf with another's.
    4937              :          *
    4938              :          * Redirection can be stopped and started on-demand, assumes
    4939              :          * that the underlying stream's rdbuf aren't changed by other
    4940              :          * users.
    4941              :          */
    4942              :         class RedirectedStreamNew {
    4943              :             std::ostream& m_originalStream;
    4944              :             std::ostream& m_redirectionStream;
    4945              :             std::streambuf* m_prevBuf;
    4946              : 
    4947              :         public:
    4948            0 :             RedirectedStreamNew( std::ostream& originalStream,
    4949            0 :                                  std::ostream& redirectionStream ):
    4950            0 :                 m_originalStream( originalStream ),
    4951            0 :                 m_redirectionStream( redirectionStream ),
    4952            0 :                 m_prevBuf( m_originalStream.rdbuf() ) {}
    4953              : 
    4954            0 :             void startRedirect() {
    4955            0 :                 m_originalStream.rdbuf( m_redirectionStream.rdbuf() );
    4956            0 :             }
    4957            0 :             void stopRedirect() { m_originalStream.rdbuf( m_prevBuf ); }
    4958              :         };
    4959              : 
    4960              :         /**
    4961              :          * Redirects the `std::cout`, `std::cerr`, `std::clog` streams,
    4962              :          * but does not touch the actual `stdout`/`stderr` file descriptors.
    4963              :          */
    4964              :         class StreamRedirect : public OutputRedirect {
    4965              :             ReusableStringStream m_redirectedOut, m_redirectedErr;
    4966              :             RedirectedStreamNew m_cout, m_cerr, m_clog;
    4967              : 
    4968              :         public:
    4969            0 :             StreamRedirect():
    4970            0 :                 m_cout( Catch::cout(), m_redirectedOut.get() ),
    4971            0 :                 m_cerr( Catch::cerr(), m_redirectedErr.get() ),
    4972            0 :                 m_clog( Catch::clog(), m_redirectedErr.get() ) {}
    4973              : 
    4974            0 :             void activateImpl() override {
    4975            0 :                 m_cout.startRedirect();
    4976            0 :                 m_cerr.startRedirect();
    4977            0 :                 m_clog.startRedirect();
    4978            0 :             }
    4979            0 :             void deactivateImpl() override {
    4980            0 :                 m_cout.stopRedirect();
    4981            0 :                 m_cerr.stopRedirect();
    4982            0 :                 m_clog.stopRedirect();
    4983            0 :             }
    4984            0 :             std::string getStdout() override { return m_redirectedOut.str(); }
    4985            0 :             std::string getStderr() override { return m_redirectedErr.str(); }
    4986            0 :             void clearBuffers() override {
    4987            0 :                 m_redirectedOut.str( "" );
    4988            0 :                 m_redirectedErr.str( "" );
    4989            0 :             }
    4990              :         };
    4991              : 
    4992              : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_NEW_CAPTURE )
    4993              : 
    4994              :         // Windows's implementation of std::tmpfile is terrible (it tries
    4995              :         // to create a file inside system folder, thus requiring elevated
    4996              :         // privileges for the binary), so we have to use tmpnam(_s) and
    4997              :         // create the file ourselves there.
    4998              :         class TempFile {
    4999              :         public:
    5000              :             TempFile( TempFile const& ) = delete;
    5001              :             TempFile& operator=( TempFile const& ) = delete;
    5002              :             TempFile( TempFile&& ) = delete;
    5003              :             TempFile& operator=( TempFile&& ) = delete;
    5004              : 
    5005              : #    if defined( _MSC_VER )
    5006              :             TempFile() {
    5007              :                 if ( tmpnam_s( m_buffer ) ) {
    5008              :                     CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR( "Could not get a temp filename" );
    5009              :                 }
    5010              :                 if ( fopen_s( &m_file, m_buffer, "wb+" ) ) {
    5011              :                     char buffer[100];
    5012              :                     if ( strerror_s( buffer, errno ) ) {
    5013              :                         CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR(
    5014              :                             "Could not translate errno to a string" );
    5015              :                     }
    5016              :                     CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR( "Could not open the temp file: '"
    5017              :                                          << m_buffer
    5018              :                                          << "' because: " << buffer );
    5019              :                 }
    5020              :             }
    5021              : #    else
    5022              :             TempFile() {
    5023              :                 m_file = std::tmpfile();
    5024              :                 if ( !m_file ) {
    5025              :                     CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR( "Could not create a temp file." );
    5026              :                 }
    5027              :             }
    5028              : #    endif
    5029              : 
    5030              :             ~TempFile() {
    5031              :                 // TBD: What to do about errors here?
    5032              :                 std::fclose( m_file );
    5033              :                 // We manually create the file on Windows only, on Linux
    5034              :                 // it will be autodeleted
    5035              : #    if defined( _MSC_VER )
    5036              :                 std::remove( m_buffer );
    5037              : #    endif
    5038              :             }
    5039              : 
    5040              :             std::FILE* getFile() { return m_file; }
    5041              :             std::string getContents() {
    5042              :                 ReusableStringStream sstr;
    5043              :                 constexpr long buffer_size = 100;
    5044              :                 char buffer[buffer_size + 1] = {};
    5045              :                 long current_pos = ftell( m_file );
    5046              :                 CATCH_ENFORCE( current_pos >= 0,
    5047              :                                "ftell failed, errno: " << errno );
    5048              :                 std::rewind( m_file );
    5049              :                 while ( current_pos > 0 ) {
    5050              :                     auto read_characters =
    5051              :                         std::fread( buffer,
    5052              :                                     1,
    5053              :                                     std::min( buffer_size, current_pos ),
    5054              :                                     m_file );
    5055              :                     buffer[read_characters] = '\0';
    5056              :                     sstr << buffer;
    5057              :                     current_pos -= static_cast<long>( read_characters );
    5058              :                 }
    5059              :                 return sstr.str();
    5060              :             }
    5061              : 
    5062              :             void clear() { std::rewind( m_file ); }
    5063              : 
    5064              :         private:
    5065              :             std::FILE* m_file = nullptr;
    5066              :             char m_buffer[L_tmpnam] = { 0 };
    5067              :         };
    5068              : 
    5069              :         /**
    5070              :          * Redirects the actual `stdout`/`stderr` file descriptors.
    5071              :          *
    5072              :          * Works by replacing the file descriptors numbered 1 and 2
    5073              :          * with an open temporary file.
    5074              :          */
    5075              :         class FileRedirect : public OutputRedirect {
    5076              :             TempFile m_outFile, m_errFile;
    5077              :             int m_originalOut = -1;
    5078              :             int m_originalErr = -1;
    5079              : 
    5080              :             // Flushes cout/cerr/clog streams and stdout/stderr FDs
    5081              :             void flushEverything() {
    5082              :                 Catch::cout() << std::flush;
    5083              :                 fflush( stdout );
    5084              :                 // Since we support overriding these streams, we flush cerr
    5085              :                 // even though std::cerr is unbuffered
    5086              :                 Catch::cerr() << std::flush;
    5087              :                 Catch::clog() << std::flush;
    5088              :                 fflush( stderr );
    5089              :             }
    5090              : 
    5091              :         public:
    5092              :             FileRedirect():
    5093              :                 m_originalOut( dup( fileno( stdout ) ) ),
    5094              :                 m_originalErr( dup( fileno( stderr ) ) ) {
    5095              :                 CATCH_ENFORCE( m_originalOut >= 0, "Could not dup stdout" );
    5096              :                 CATCH_ENFORCE( m_originalErr >= 0, "Could not dup stderr" );
    5097              :             }
    5098              : 
    5099              :             std::string getStdout() override { return m_outFile.getContents(); }
    5100              :             std::string getStderr() override { return m_errFile.getContents(); }
    5101              :             void clearBuffers() override {
    5102              :                 m_outFile.clear();
    5103              :                 m_errFile.clear();
    5104              :             }
    5105              : 
    5106              :             void activateImpl() override {
    5107              :                 // We flush before starting redirect, to ensure that we do
    5108              :                 // not capture the end of message sent before activation.
    5109              :                 flushEverything();
    5110              : 
    5111              :                 int ret;
    5112              :                 ret = dup2( fileno( m_outFile.getFile() ), fileno( stdout ) );
    5113              :                 CATCH_ENFORCE( ret >= 0,
    5114              :                                "dup2 to stdout has failed, errno: " << errno );
    5115              :                 ret = dup2( fileno( m_errFile.getFile() ), fileno( stderr ) );
    5116              :                 CATCH_ENFORCE( ret >= 0,
    5117              :                                "dup2 to stderr has failed, errno: " << errno );
    5118              :             }
    5119              :             void deactivateImpl() override {
    5120              :                 // We flush before ending redirect, to ensure that we
    5121              :                 // capture all messages sent while the redirect was active.
    5122              :                 flushEverything();
    5123              : 
    5124              :                 int ret;
    5125              :                 ret = dup2( m_originalOut, fileno( stdout ) );
    5126              :                 CATCH_ENFORCE(
    5127              :                     ret >= 0,

    5240            0 :     Optional<unsigned int> parseUInt(std::string const& input, int base) {
    5241            0 :         auto trimmed = trim( input );
    5242              :         // std::stoull is annoying and accepts numbers starting with '-',
    5243              :         // it just negates them into unsigned int
    5244            0 :         if ( trimmed.empty() || trimmed[0] == '-' ) {
    5245            0 :             return {};
    5246              :         }
    5247              : 
    5248              :         CATCH_TRY {
    5249            0 :             size_t pos = 0;
    5250            0 :             const auto ret = std::stoull( trimmed, &pos, base );
    5251              : 
    5252              :             // We did not consume the whole input, so there is an issue
    5253              :             // This can be bunch of different stuff, like multiple numbers
    5254              :             // in the input, or invalid digits/characters and so on. Either
    5255              :             // way, we do not want to return the partially parsed result.
    5256            0 :             if ( pos != trimmed.size() ) {
    5257            0 :                 return {};
    5258              :             }
    5259              :             // Too large
    5260            0 :             if ( ret > std::numeric_limits<unsigned int>::max() ) {
    5261            0 :                 return {};
    5262              :             }
    5263            0 :             return static_cast<unsigned int>(ret);
    5264              :         }
    5265            0 :         CATCH_CATCH_ANON( std::invalid_argument const& ) {
    5266              :             // no conversion could be performed
    5267            0 :         }
    5268            0 :         CATCH_CATCH_ANON( std::out_of_range const& ) {
    5269              :             // the input does not fit into an unsigned long long
    5270            0 :         }
    5271            0 :         return {};
    5272            0 :     }

    5326              :         // Safe rotr implementation thanks to John Regehr
    5327              :         CATCH2_CLANG_NO_SANITIZE_INTEGER
    5328          240 :         uint32_t rotate_right(uint32_t val, uint32_t count) {
    5329          240 :             const uint32_t mask = 31;
    5330          240 :             count &= mask;
    5331          240 :             return (val >> count) | (val << (-count & mask));
    5332              :         }
    5333              :

    5355              :         // should suffice for our use case.
    5356            0 :         for (uint64_t s = 0; s < skip; ++s) {
    5357            0 :             static_cast<void>((*this)());

    5359            0 :     }

    5361              :     CATCH2_CLANG_NO_SANITIZE_INTEGER
    5362          240 :     SimplePcg32::result_type SimplePcg32::operator()() {
    5363              :         // prepare the output value
    5364          240 :         const uint32_t xorshifted = static_cast<uint32_t>(((m_state >> 18u) ^ m_state) >> 27u);

    5366              : 
    5367              :         // advance state
    5368          240 :         m_state = m_state * 6364136223846793005ULL + s_inc;
    5369              : 
    5370          240 :         return output;
    5371              :     }

    5494            0 :         kvPair splitKVPair(StringRef kvString) {

    5496            0 :                 std::find( kvString.begin(), kvString.end(), '=' ) -
    5497            0 :                 kvString.begin() );

    5499            0 :             return { kvString.substr( 0, splitPos ),
    5500            0 :                      kvString.substr( splitPos + 1, kvString.size() ) };
    5501              :         }

    5503              : 
    5504              :     namespace Detail {
    5505            1 :         std::vector<std::string> splitReporterSpec( StringRef reporterSpec ) {
    5506              :             static constexpr auto separator = "::";
    5507              :             static constexpr size_t separatorSize = 2;
    5508              : 
    5509            1 :             size_t separatorPos = 0;
    5510            1 :             auto findNextSeparator = [&reporterSpec]( size_t startPos ) {
    5511              :                 static_assert(
    5512              :                     separatorSize == 2,
    5513              :                     "The code below currently assumes 2 char separator" );
    5514              : 
    5515            1 :                 auto currentPos = startPos;
    5516              :                 do {
    5517           15 :                     while ( currentPos < reporterSpec.size() &&
    5518            7 :                             reporterSpec[currentPos] != separator[0] ) {
    5519            7 :                         ++currentPos;
    5520              :                     }
    5521            1 :                     if ( currentPos + 1 < reporterSpec.size() &&
    5522            0 :                          reporterSpec[currentPos + 1] == separator[1] ) {
    5523            0 :                         return currentPos;
    5524              :                     }
    5525            1 :                     ++currentPos;
    5526            1 :                 } while ( currentPos < reporterSpec.size() );
    5527              : 
    5528            1 :                 return static_cast<size_t>( -1 );
    5529            1 :             };
    5530              : 
    5531            1 :             std::vector<std::string> parts;
    5532              : 
    5533            1 :             while ( separatorPos < reporterSpec.size() ) {
    5534            1 :                 const auto nextSeparator = findNextSeparator( separatorPos );
    5535            1 :                 parts.push_back( static_cast<std::string>( reporterSpec.substr(
    5536              :                     separatorPos, nextSeparator - separatorPos ) ) );
    5537              : 
    5538            1 :                 if ( nextSeparator == static_cast<size_t>( -1 ) ) {
    5539            1 :                     break;
    5540              :                 }
    5541            0 :                 separatorPos = nextSeparator + separatorSize;
    5542              :             }
    5543              : 
    5544              :             // Handle a separator at the end.
    5545              :             // This is not a valid spec, but we want to do validation in a
    5546              :             // centralized place
    5547            1 :             if ( separatorPos == reporterSpec.size() ) {
    5548            0 :                 parts.emplace_back();
    5549              :             }
    5550              : 
    5551            2 :             return parts;
    5552            0 :         }
    5553              : 
    5554            0 :         Optional<ColourMode> stringToColourMode( StringRef colourMode ) {
    5555            0 :             if ( colourMode == "default" ) {
    5556            0 :                 return ColourMode::PlatformDefault;
    5557            0 :             } else if ( colourMode == "ansi" ) {
    5558            0 :                 return ColourMode::ANSI;
    5559            0 :             } else if ( colourMode == "win32" ) {
    5560            0 :                 return ColourMode::Win32;
    5561            0 :             } else if ( colourMode == "none" ) {
    5562            0 :                 return ColourMode::None;
    5563              :             } else {
    5564            0 :                 return {};
    5565              :             }
    5566              :         }
    5567              :     } // namespace Detail

    5577            1 :     Optional<ReporterSpec> parseReporterSpec( StringRef reporterSpec ) {
    5578            1 :         auto parts = Detail::splitReporterSpec( reporterSpec );
    5579              : 
    5580            1 :         assert( parts.size() > 0 && "Split should never return empty vector" );
    5581              : 
    5582            1 :         std::map<std::string, std::string> kvPairs;
    5583            1 :         Optional<std::string> outputFileName;
    5584            1 :         Optional<ColourMode> colourMode;
    5585              : 
    5586              :         // First part is always reporter name, so we skip it
    5587            1 :         for ( size_t i = 1; i < parts.size(); ++i ) {
    5588            0 :             auto kv = splitKVPair( parts[i] );
    5589            0 :             auto key = kv.key, value = kv.value;
    5590              : 
    5591            0 :             if ( key.empty() || value.empty() ) { // NOLINT(bugprone-branch-clone)
    5592            0 :                 return {};
    5593            0 :             } else if ( key[0] == 'X' ) {
    5594              :                 // This is a reporter-specific option, we don't check these
    5595              :                 // apart from basic sanity checks
    5596            0 :                 if ( key.size() == 1 ) {
    5597            0 :                     return {};
    5598              :                 }
    5599              : 
    5600            0 :                 auto ret = kvPairs.emplace( std::string(kv.key), std::string(kv.value) );
    5601            0 :                 if ( !ret.second ) {
    5602              :                     // Duplicated key. We might want to handle this differently,
    5603              :                     // e.g. by overwriting the existing value?
    5604            0 :                     return {};
    5605              :                 }
    5606            0 :             } else if ( key == "out" ) {
    5607              :                 // Duplicated key
    5608            0 :                 if ( outputFileName ) {
    5609            0 :                     return {};
    5610              :                 }
    5611            0 :                 outputFileName = static_cast<std::string>( value );
    5612            0 :             } else if ( key == "colour-mode" ) {
    5613              :                 // Duplicated key
    5614            0 :                 if ( colourMode ) {
    5615            0 :                     return {};
    5616              :                 }
    5617            0 :                 colourMode = Detail::stringToColourMode( value );
    5618              :                 // Parsing failed
    5619            0 :                 if ( !colourMode ) {
    5620            0 :                     return {};
    5621              :                 }
    5622              :             } else {
    5623              :                 // Unrecognized option
    5624            0 :                 return {};
    5625              :             }
    5626              :         }
    5627              : 
    5628            2 :         return ReporterSpec{ CATCH_MOVE( parts[0] ),
    5629              :                              CATCH_MOVE( outputFileName ),
    5630              :                              CATCH_MOVE( colourMode ),
    5631            1 :                              CATCH_MOVE( kvPairs ) };
    5632            1 :     }
    5633              :

    5653              : namespace Catch {
    5654              : 
    5655              :     // This class encapsulates the idea of a pool of ostringstreams that can be reused.
    5656              :     struct StringStreams {
    5657              :         std::vector<Detail::unique_ptr<std::ostringstream>> m_streams;
    5658              :         std::vector<std::size_t> m_unused;
    5659              :         std::ostringstream m_referenceStream; // Used for copy state/ flags from
    5660              :         Detail::Mutex m_mutex;
    5661              : 
    5662            1 :         auto add() -> std::pair<std::size_t, std::ostringstream*> {
    5663            1 :             Detail::LockGuard _( m_mutex );
    5664            1 :             if( m_unused.empty() ) {
    5665            1 :                 m_streams.push_back( Detail::make_unique<std::ostringstream>() );
    5666            1 :                 return { m_streams.size()-1, m_streams.back().get() };
    5667              :             }
    5668              :             else {
    5669            0 :                 auto index = m_unused.back();
    5670            0 :                 m_unused.pop_back();
    5671            0 :                 return { index, m_streams[index].get() };
    5672              :             }
    5673              :         }
    5674              : 
    5675            1 :         void release( std::size_t index, std::ostream* originalPtr ) {
    5676            1 :             assert( originalPtr );
