    5713              : namespace Catch {
    5714              : 
    5715              :     namespace Generators {
    5716              :         namespace {
    5717              :             struct GeneratorTracker final : TestCaseTracking::TrackerBase,
    5718              :                                       IGeneratorTracker {
    5719              :                 GeneratorBasePtr m_generator;
    5720              : 
    5721            0 :                 GeneratorTracker(
    5722              :                     TestCaseTracking::NameAndLocation&& nameAndLocation,
    5723              :                     TrackerContext& ctx,
    5724            0 :                     ITracker* parent ):
    5725            0 :                     TrackerBase( CATCH_MOVE( nameAndLocation ), ctx, parent ) {}
    5726              : 
    5727              :                 static GeneratorTracker*
    5728            0 :                 acquire( TrackerContext& ctx,
    5729              :                          TestCaseTracking::NameAndLocationRef const&
    5730              :                              nameAndLocation ) {
    5731              :                     GeneratorTracker* tracker;
    5732              : 
    5733            0 :                     ITracker& currentTracker = ctx.currentTracker();
    5734              :                     // Under specific circumstances, the generator we want
    5735              :                     // to acquire is also the current tracker. If this is
    5736              :                     // the case, we have to avoid looking through current
    5737              :                     // tracker's children, and instead return the current
    5738              :                     // tracker.
    5739              :                     // A case where this check is important is e.g.
    5740              :                     //     for (int i = 0; i < 5; ++i) {
    5741              :                     //         int n = GENERATE(1, 2);
    5742              :                     //     }
    5743              :                     //
    5744              :                     // without it, the code above creates 5 nested generators.
    5745            0 :                     if ( currentTracker.nameAndLocation() == nameAndLocation ) {
    5746            0 :                         auto thisTracker = currentTracker.parent()->findChild(
    5747              :                             nameAndLocation );
    5748            0 :                         assert( thisTracker );
    5749            0 :                         assert( thisTracker->isGeneratorTracker() );
    5750            0 :                         tracker = static_cast<GeneratorTracker*>( thisTracker );
    5751            0 :                     } else if ( ITracker* childTracker =
    5752            0 :                                     currentTracker.findChild(
    5753              :                                         nameAndLocation ) ) {
    5754            0 :                         assert( childTracker );
    5755            0 :                         assert( childTracker->isGeneratorTracker() );
    5756            0 :                         tracker =
    5757              :                             static_cast<GeneratorTracker*>( childTracker );
    5758              :                     } else {
    5759            0 :                         return nullptr;
    5760              :                     }
    5761              : 
    5762            0 :                     if ( !tracker->isComplete() ) { tracker->open(); }
    5763              : 
    5764            0 :                     return tracker;
    5765              :                 }
    5766              : 
    5767              :                 // TrackerBase interface
    5768            0 :                 bool isGeneratorTracker() const override { return true; }
    5769            0 :                 auto hasGenerator() const -> bool override {
    5770            0 :                     return !!m_generator;
    5771              :                 }
    5772            0 :                 void close() override {
    5773            0 :                     TrackerBase::close();
    5774              :                     // If a generator has a child (it is followed by a section)
    5775              :                     // and none of its children have started, then we must wait
    5776              :                     // until later to start consuming its values.
    5777              :                     // This catches cases where `GENERATE` is placed between two
    5778              :                     // `SECTION`s.
    5779              :                     // **The check for m_children.empty cannot be removed**.
    5780              :                     // doing so would break `GENERATE` _not_ followed by
    5781              :                     // `SECTION`s.
    5782            0 :                     const bool should_wait_for_child = [&]() {
    5783              :                         // No children -> nobody to wait for
    5784            0 :                         if ( m_children.empty() ) { return false; }
    5785              :                         // If at least one child started executing, don't wait
    5786            0 :                         if ( std::find_if(
    5787            0 :                                  m_children.begin(),
    5788            0 :                                  m_children.end(),
    5789            0 :                                  []( TestCaseTracking::ITrackerPtr const&
    5790              :                                          tracker ) {
    5791            0 :                                      return tracker->hasStarted();
    5792            0 :                                  } ) != m_children.end() ) {
    5793            0 :                             return false;
    5794              :                         }
    5795              : 
    5796              :                         // No children have started. We need to check if they
    5797              :                         // _can_ start, and thus we should wait for them, or
    5798              :                         // they cannot start (due to filters), and we shouldn't
    5799              :                         // wait for them
    5800            0 :                         ITracker* parent = m_parent;
    5801              :                         // This is safe: there is always at least one section
    5802              :                         // tracker in a test case tracking tree
    5803            0 :                         while ( !parent->isSectionTracker() ) {
    5804            0 :                             parent = parent->parent();
    5805              :                         }
    5806            0 :                         assert( parent &&
    5807              :                                 "Missing root (test case) level section" );
    5808              : 
    5809            0 :                         auto const& parentSection =
    5810              :                             static_cast<SectionTracker const&>( *parent );
    5811            0 :                         auto const& filters = parentSection.getFilters();
    5812              :                         // No filters -> no restrictions on running sections
    5813            0 :                         if ( filters.empty() ) { return true; }
    5814              : 
    5815            0 :                         for ( auto const& child : m_children ) {
    5816            0 :                             if ( child->isSectionTracker() &&
    5817            0 :                                  std::find( filters.begin(),
    5818              :                                             filters.end(),
    5819              :                                             static_cast<SectionTracker const&>(
    5820            0 :                                                 *child )
    5821            0 :                                                 .trimmedName() ) !=
    5822            0 :                                      filters.end() ) {
    5823            0 :                                 return true;
    5824              :                             }
    5825              :                         }
    5826            0 :                         return false;
    5827            0 :                     }();
    5828              : 
    5829              :                     // This check is a bit tricky, because m_generator->next()
    5830              :                     // has a side-effect, where it consumes generator's current
    5831              :                     // value, but we do not want to invoke the side-effect if
    5832              :                     // this generator is still waiting for any child to start.
    5833            0 :                     assert( m_generator && "Tracker without generator" );
    5834            0 :                     if ( should_wait_for_child ||
    5835            0 :                          ( m_runState == CompletedSuccessfully &&
    5836            0 :                            m_generator->countedNext() ) ) {
    5837            0 :                         m_children.clear();
    5838            0 :                         m_runState = Executing;
    5839              :                     }
    5840            0 :                 }
    5841              : 
    5842              :                 // IGeneratorTracker interface
    5843            0 :                 auto getGenerator() const -> GeneratorBasePtr const& override {
    5844            0 :                     return m_generator;
    5845              :                 }
    5846            0 :                 void setGenerator( GeneratorBasePtr&& generator ) override {
    5847            0 :                     m_generator = CATCH_MOVE( generator );
    5848            0 :                 }
    5849              :             };
    5850              :         } // namespace
    5851              :     }
    5852              : 
    5853              :     namespace Detail {
    5854              :         // Assertions are owned by the thread that is executing them.
    5855              :         // This allows for lock-free progress in common cases where we
    5856              :         // do not need to send the assertion events to the reporter.
    5857              :         // This also implies that messages are owned by their respective
    5858              :         // threads, and should not be shared across different threads.
    5859              :         //
    5860              :         // This implies that various pieces of metadata referring to last
    5861              :         // assertion result/source location/message handling, etc
    5862              :         // should also be thread local. For now we just use naked globals
    5863              :         // below, in the future we will want to allocate piece of memory
    5864              :         // from heap, to avoid consuming too much thread-local storage.
    5865              : 
    5866              :         // This is used for the "if" part of CHECKED_IF/CHECKED_ELSE
    5867              :         static thread_local bool g_lastAssertionPassed = false;
    5868              : 
    5869              :         // This is the source location for last encountered macro. It is
    5870              :         // used to provide the users with more precise location of error
    5871              :         // when an unexpected exception/fatal error happens.
    5872              :         static thread_local SourceLineInfo g_lastKnownLineInfo("DummyLocation", static_cast<size_t>(-1));
    5873              : 
    5874              :         // Should we clear message scopes before sending off the messages to
    5875              :         // reporter? Set in `assertionPassedFastPath` to avoid doing the full
    5876              :         // clear there for performance reasons.
    5877              :         static thread_local bool g_clearMessageScopes = false;
    5878              : 
    5879              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_START_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION
    5880              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_SUPPRESS_GLOBALS_WARNINGS
    5881              :         // Actual messages to be provided to the reporter
    5882              :         static thread_local std::vector<MessageInfo> g_messages;
    5883              : 
    5884              :         // Owners for the UNSCOPED_X information macro
    5885              :         static thread_local std::vector<ScopedMessage> g_messageScopes;
    5886              :         CATCH_INTERNAL_STOP_WARNINGS_SUPPRESSION
    5887              : 
    5888              :     } // namespace Detail
    5889              : 
    5890            1 :     RunContext::RunContext(IConfig const* _config, IEventListenerPtr&& reporter)
    5891            1 :     :   m_runInfo(_config->name()),
    5892            1 :         m_config(_config),
    5893            1 :         m_reporter(CATCH_MOVE(reporter)),
    5894            1 :         m_outputRedirect( makeOutputRedirect( m_reporter->getPreferences().shouldRedirectStdOut ) ),
    5895            1 :         m_abortAfterXFailedAssertions( m_config->abortAfter() ),
    5896            1 :         m_reportAssertionStarting( m_reporter->getPreferences().shouldReportAllAssertionStarts ),
    5897            1 :         m_includeSuccessfulResults( m_config->includeSuccessfulResults() || m_reporter->getPreferences().shouldReportAllAssertions ),
    5898            6 :         m_shouldDebugBreak( m_config->shouldDebugBreak() )
    5899              :     {
    5900            1 :         getCurrentMutableContext().setResultCapture( this );
    5901            1 :         m_reporter->testRunStarting(m_runInfo);
    5902            1 :     }
    5903              : 
    5904            1 :     RunContext::~RunContext() {
    5905            1 :         updateTotalsFromAtomics();
    5906            1 :         m_reporter->testRunEnded(TestRunStats(m_runInfo, m_totals, aborting()));
    5907            1 :     }
    5908              : 
    5909          118 :     Totals RunContext::runTest(TestCaseHandle const& testCase) {
    5910          118 :         updateTotalsFromAtomics();
    5911          118 :         const Totals prevTotals = m_totals;
    5912              : 
    5913          118 :         auto const& testInfo = testCase.getTestCaseInfo();
    5914          118 :         m_reporter->testCaseStarting(testInfo);
    5915          118 :         testCase.prepareTestCase();
    5916          118 :         m_activeTestCase = &testCase;
    5917              : 
    5918              : 
    5919          118 :         ITracker& rootTracker = m_trackerContext.startRun();
    5920          118 :         assert(rootTracker.isSectionTracker());
    5921          118 :         static_cast<SectionTracker&>(rootTracker).addInitialFilters(m_config->getSectionsToRun());
    5922              : 
    5923              :         // We intentionally only seed the internal RNG once per test case,
    5924              :         // before it is first invoked. The reason for that is a complex
    5925              :         // interplay of generator/section implementation details and the
    5926              :         // Random*Generator types.
    5927              :         //
    5928              :         // The issue boils down to us needing to seed the Random*Generators
    5929              :         // with different seed each, so that they return different sequences
    5930              :         // of random numbers. We do this by giving them a number from the
    5931              :         // shared RNG instance as their seed.
    5932              :         //
    5933              :         // However, this runs into an issue if the reseeding happens each
    5934              :         // time the test case is entered (as opposed to first time only),
    5935              :         // because multiple generators could get the same seed, e.g. in
    5936              :         // ```cpp
    5937              :         // TEST_CASE() {
    5938              :         //     auto i = GENERATE(take(10, random(0, 100));
    5939              :         //     SECTION("A") {
    5940              :         //         auto j = GENERATE(take(10, random(0, 100));
    5941              :         //     }
    5942              :         //     SECTION("B") {
    5943              :         //         auto k = GENERATE(take(10, random(0, 100));
    5944              :         //     }
    5945              :         // }
    5946              :         // ```
    5947              :         // `i` and `j` would properly return values from different sequences,
    5948              :         // but `i` and `k` would return the same sequence, because their seed
    5949              :         // would be the same.
    5950              :         // (The reason their seeds would be the same is that the generator
    5951              :         //  for k would be initialized when the test case is entered the second
    5952              :         //  time, after the shared RNG instance was reset to the same value
    5953              :         //  it had when the generator for i was initialized.)
    5954          118 :         seedRng( *m_config );
    5955              : 
    5956          118 :         uint64_t testRuns = 0;
    5957          118 :         std::string redirectedCout;
    5958          118 :         std::string redirectedCerr;
    5959              :         do {
    5960          168 :             m_trackerContext.startCycle();
    5961          168 :             m_testCaseTracker = &SectionTracker::acquire(m_trackerContext, TestCaseTracking::NameAndLocationRef(testInfo.name, testInfo.lineInfo));
    5962              : 
    5963          168 :             m_reporter->testCasePartialStarting(testInfo, testRuns);
    5964              : 
    5965          168 :             updateTotalsFromAtomics();
    5966          168 :             const auto beforeRunTotals = m_totals;
    5967          168 :             runCurrentTest();
    5968          168 :             std::string oneRunCout = m_outputRedirect->getStdout();
    5969          168 :             std::string oneRunCerr = m_outputRedirect->getStderr();
    5970          168 :             m_outputRedirect->clearBuffers();
    5971          168 :             redirectedCout += oneRunCout;
    5972          168 :             redirectedCerr += oneRunCerr;
    5973              : 
    5974          168 :             updateTotalsFromAtomics();
    5975          168 :             const auto singleRunTotals = m_totals.delta(beforeRunTotals);
    5976          168 :             auto statsForOneRun = TestCaseStats(testInfo, singleRunTotals, CATCH_MOVE(oneRunCout), CATCH_MOVE(oneRunCerr), aborting());
    5977          168 :             m_reporter->testCasePartialEnded(statsForOneRun, testRuns);
    5978              : 
    5979          168 :             ++testRuns;
    5980          168 :         } while (!m_testCaseTracker->isSuccessfullyCompleted() && !aborting());
    5981              : 
    5982          118 :         Totals deltaTotals = m_totals.delta(prevTotals);
    5983          118 :         if (testInfo.expectedToFail() && deltaTotals.testCases.passed > 0) {
    5984            0 :             deltaTotals.assertions.failed++;
    5985            0 :             deltaTotals.testCases.passed--;
    5986            0 :             deltaTotals.testCases.failed++;
    5987              :         }
    5988          118 :         m_totals.testCases += deltaTotals.testCases;
    5989          118 :         testCase.tearDownTestCase();
    5990          236 :         m_reporter->testCaseEnded(TestCaseStats(testInfo,
    5991              :                                   deltaTotals,
    5992              :                                   CATCH_MOVE(redirectedCout),
    5993              :                                   CATCH_MOVE(redirectedCerr),
    5994          118 :                                   aborting()));
    5995              : 
    5996          118 :         m_activeTestCase = nullptr;
    5997          118 :         m_testCaseTracker = nullptr;
    5998              : 
    5999          236 :         return deltaTotals;
    6000          118 :     }
    6001              : 
    6002              : 
    6003            0 :     void RunContext::assertionEnded(AssertionResult&& result) {
    6004            0 :         Detail::g_lastKnownLineInfo = result.m_info.lineInfo;
    6005            0 :         if (result.getResultType() == ResultWas::Ok) {
    6006            0 :             m_atomicAssertionCount.passed++;
    6007            0 :             Detail::g_lastAssertionPassed = true;
    6008            0 :         } else if (result.getResultType() == ResultWas::ExplicitSkip) {
    6009            0 :             m_atomicAssertionCount.skipped++;
    6010            0 :             Detail::g_lastAssertionPassed = true;
    6011            0 :         } else if (!result.succeeded()) {
    6012            0 :             Detail::g_lastAssertionPassed = false;
    6013            0 :             if (result.isOk()) {
    6014              :             }
    6015            0 :             else if( m_activeTestCase->getTestCaseInfo().okToFail() ) // Read from a shared state established before the threads could start, this is fine
    6016            0 :                 m_atomicAssertionCount.failedButOk++;
    6017              :             else
    6018            0 :                 m_atomicAssertionCount.failed++;
    6019              :         }
    6020              :         else {
    6021            0 :             Detail::g_lastAssertionPassed = true;
    6022              :         }
    6023              : 
    6024            0 :         if ( Detail::g_clearMessageScopes ) {
    6025            0 :             Detail::g_messageScopes.clear();
    6026            0 :             Detail::g_clearMessageScopes = false;
    6027              :         }
    6028              : 
    6029              :         // From here, we are touching shared state and need mutex.
    6030            0 :         Detail::LockGuard lock( m_assertionMutex );
    6031              :         {
    6032            0 :             auto _ = scopedDeactivate( *m_outputRedirect );
    6033            0 :             updateTotalsFromAtomics();

    6035            0 :         }
    6036              : 
    6037            0 :         if ( result.getResultType() != ResultWas::Warning ) {
    6038            0 :             Detail::g_messageScopes.clear();

    6044            0 :     }

    6090            0 :     IGeneratorTracker* RunContext::createGeneratorTracker(

    6111          239 :     bool RunContext::testForMissingAssertions(Counts& assertions) {

    6143            0 :     void RunContext::sectionEndedEarly(SectionEndInfo&& endInfo) {
    6144            0 :         if ( m_unfinishedSections.empty() ) {
    6145            0 :             m_activeSections.back()->fail();
    6146              :         } else {

    6177            0 :     const AssertionResult * RunContext::getLastResult() const {
    6178              :         // m_lastResult is updated inside the assertion slow-path, under
    6179              :         // a mutex, so the read needs to happen under mutex as well.
    6180              : 
    6181              :         // TBD: The last result only makes sense if it is a thread-local
    6182              :         //      thing, because the answer is different per thread, like
    6183              :         //      last line info, whether last assertion passed, and so on.
    6184              :         //
    6185              :         //      However, the last result was also never updated in the
    6186              :         //      assertion fast path, so it was always somewhat broken,
    6187              :         //      and since IResultCapture::getLastResult is deprecated,
    6188              :         //      we will leave it as is, until it is finally removed.
    6189            0 :         Detail::LockGuard _( m_assertionMutex );
    6190            0 :         return &(*m_lastResult);
    6191              :     }

    6197            0 :     void RunContext::handleFatalErrorCondition( StringRef message ) {
    6198              :         // We lock only when touching the reporters directly, to avoid
    6199              :         // deadlocks when we call into other functions that also want
    6200              :         // to lock the mutex before touching reporters.
    6201              :         //
    6202              :         // This does mean that we allow other threads to run while handling
    6203              :         // a fatal error, but this is all a best effort attempt anyway.
    6204              :         {
    6205            0 :             Detail::LockGuard lock( m_assertionMutex );
    6206              :             // TODO: scoped deactivate here? Just give up and do best effort?
    6207              :             //       the deactivation can break things further, OTOH so can the
    6208              :             //       capture
    6209            0 :             auto _ = scopedDeactivate( *m_outputRedirect );
    6210              : 
    6211              :             // First notify reporter that bad things happened
    6212            0 :             m_reporter->fatalErrorEncountered( message );
    6213            0 :         }
    6214              : 
    6215              :         // Don't rebuild the result -- the stringification itself can cause more fatal errors
    6216              :         // Instead, fake a result data.
    6217            0 :         AssertionResultData tempResult( ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition, { false } );
    6218            0 :         tempResult.message = static_cast<std::string>(message);
    6219            0 :         AssertionResult result( makeDummyAssertionInfo(),
    6220            0 :                                 CATCH_MOVE( tempResult ) );
    6221              : 
    6222            0 :         assertionEnded(CATCH_MOVE(result) );
    6223              : 
    6224              : 
    6225              :         // At this point we touch sections/test cases from this thread
    6226              :         // to try and end them. Technically that is not supported when
    6227              :         // using multiple threads, but the worst thing that can happen
    6228              :         // is that the process aborts harder :-D
    6229            0 :         Detail::LockGuard lock( m_assertionMutex );
    6230              : 
    6231              :         // Best effort cleanup for sections that have not been destructed yet
    6232              :         // Since this is a fatal error, we have not had and won't have the opportunity to destruct them properly
    6233            0 :         while (!m_activeSections.empty()) {
    6234            0 :             auto const& nl = m_activeSections.back()->nameAndLocation();
    6235            0 :             SectionEndInfo endInfo{ SectionInfo(nl.location, nl.name), {}, 0.0 };
    6236            0 :             sectionEndedEarly(CATCH_MOVE(endInfo));
    6237            0 :         }
    6238            0 :         handleUnfinishedSections();
    6239              : 
    6240              :         // Recreate section for test case (as we will lose the one that was in scope)
    6241            0 :         auto const& testCaseInfo = m_activeTestCase->getTestCaseInfo();
    6242            0 :         SectionInfo testCaseSection(testCaseInfo.lineInfo, testCaseInfo.name);
    6243              : 
    6244            0 :         Counts assertions;
    6245            0 :         assertions.failed = 1;
    6246            0 :         SectionStats testCaseSectionStats(CATCH_MOVE(testCaseSection), assertions, 0, false);
    6247            0 :         m_reporter->sectionEnded( testCaseSectionStats );
    6248              : 
    6249            0 :         auto const& testInfo = m_activeTestCase->getTestCaseInfo();
    6250              : 
    6251            0 :         Totals deltaTotals;
    6252            0 :         deltaTotals.testCases.failed = 1;
    6253            0 :         deltaTotals.assertions.failed = 1;

    6255              :                                   deltaTotals,
    6256            0 :                                   std::string(),
    6257            0 :                                   std::string(),
    6258              :                                   false));
    6259            0 :         m_totals.testCases.failed++;
    6260            0 :         updateTotalsFromAtomics();
    6261            0 :         m_reporter->testRunEnded(TestRunStats(m_runInfo, m_totals, false));
    6262            0 :     }
    6263              : 
    6264            0 :     bool RunContext::lastAssertionPassed() {

    6289          168 :     void RunContext::runCurrentTest() {
    6290          168 :         auto const& testCaseInfo = m_activeTestCase->getTestCaseInfo();
    6291          168 :         SectionInfo testCaseSection(testCaseInfo.lineInfo, testCaseInfo.name);
    6292          168 :         m_reporter->sectionStarting(testCaseSection);

    6295          168 :         double duration = 0;
    6296          168 :         m_shouldReportUnexpected = true;

    6298              :

    6300              :         CATCH_TRY {
    6301              :             {
    6302          168 :                 auto _ = scopedActivate( *m_outputRedirect );
    6303          168 :                 timer.start();
    6304          168 :                 invokeActiveTestCase();
    6305          168 :             }
    6306          168 :             duration = timer.getElapsedSeconds();
    6307            0 :         } CATCH_CATCH_ANON (TestFailureException&) {
    6308              :             // This just means the test was aborted due to failure
    6309            0 :         } CATCH_CATCH_ANON (TestSkipException&) {
    6310              :             // This just means the test was explicitly skipped
    6311            0 :         } CATCH_CATCH_ALL {
    6312              :             // Under CATCH_CONFIG_FAST_COMPILE, unexpected exceptions under REQUIRE assertions
    6313              :             // are reported without translation at the point of origin.

    6315            0 :                 AssertionReaction dummyReaction;

    6317            0 :                                                    translateActiveException(),
    6318              :                                                    dummyReaction );
    6319              :             }
    6320            0 :         }

    6323          168 :         bool missingAssertions = testForMissingAssertions(assertions);
    6324              : 
    6325          168 :         m_testCaseTracker->close();

    6336          168 :     void RunContext::invokeActiveTestCase() {
    6337              :         // We need to engage a handler for signals/structured exceptions
    6338              :         // before running the tests themselves, or the binary can crash
    6339              :         // without failed test being reported.
    6340          168 :         FatalConditionHandlerGuard _(&m_fatalConditionhandler);

    6342              :         // variable, even though the type has non-trivial constructor and
    6343              :         // destructor. This is annoying and ugly, but it makes them stfu.
    6344              :         (void)_;

    6617          258 :     bool SourceLineInfo::operator == ( SourceLineInfo const& other ) const noexcept {
    6618          258 :         return line == other.line && (file == other.file || std::strcmp(file, other.file) == 0);
    6619              :     }
    6620            0 :     bool SourceLineInfo::operator < ( SourceLineInfo const& other ) const noexcept {
    6621              :         // We can assume that the same file will usually have the same pointer.
    6622              :         // Thus, if the pointers are the same, there is no point in calling the strcmp
    6623            0 :         return line < other.line || ( line == other.line && file != other.file && (std::strcmp(file, other.file) < 0));
    6624              :     }
    6625              : 
    6626            0 :     std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, SourceLineInfo const& info ) {

    6629              : #else

    6632            0 :         return os;
    6633              :     }

    6716            0 :         std::string::size_type end = str.find_last_not_of( whitespaceChars );
    6717              : 
    6718            0 :         return start != std::string::npos ? str.substr( start, 1+end-start ) : std::string();
    6719              :     }
    6720              : 
    6721          307 :     StringRef trim(StringRef ref) {
    6722          614 :         const auto is_ws = [](char c) {
    6723          614 :             return c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == '\n' || c == '\r';
    6724              :         };
    6725          307 :         size_t real_begin = 0;
    6726          307 :         while (real_begin < ref.size() && is_ws(ref[real_begin])) { ++real_begin; }
    6727          307 :         size_t real_end = ref.size();
    6728          307 :         while (real_end > real_begin && is_ws(ref[real_end - 1])) { --real_end; }
    6729              : 
    6730          307 :         return ref.substr(real_begin, real_end - real_begin);
    6731              :     }
    6732              : 
    6733            0 :     bool replaceInPlace( std::string& str, std::string const& replaceThis, std::string const& withThis ) {
    6734            0 :         std::size_t i = str.find( replaceThis );
    6735            0 :         if (i == std::string::npos) {
    6736            0 :             return false;
    6737              :         }
    6738            0 :         std::size_t copyBegin = 0;
    6739            0 :         std::string origStr = CATCH_MOVE(str);
    6740            0 :         str.clear();
    6741              :         // There is at least one replacement, so reserve with the best guess
    6742              :         // we can make without actually counting the number of occurrences.
    6743            0 :         str.reserve(origStr.size() - replaceThis.size() + withThis.size());
    6744              :         do {
    6745            0 :             str.append(origStr, copyBegin, i-copyBegin );
    6746            0 :             str += withThis;
    6747            0 :             copyBegin = i + replaceThis.size();
    6748            0 :             if( copyBegin < origStr.size() )
    6749            0 :                 i = origStr.find( replaceThis, copyBegin );
    6750              :             else
    6751            0 :                 i = std::string::npos;
    6752            0 :         } while( i != std::string::npos );
    6753            0 :         if ( copyBegin < origStr.size() ) {
    6754            0 :             str.append(origStr, copyBegin, origStr.size() );
    6755              :         }
    6756            0 :         return true;
    6757            0 :     }
    6758              : 
    6759            0 :     std::vector<StringRef> splitStringRef( StringRef str, char delimiter ) {

    6763            0 :             if( str[pos] == delimiter ) {
    6764            0 :                 if( pos - start > 1 )
    6765            0 :                     subStrings.push_back( str.substr( start, pos-start ) );
    6766            0 :                 start = pos+1;
    6767              :             }
    6768              :         }
    6769            0 :         if( start < str.size() )
    6770            0 :             subStrings.push_back( str.substr( start, str.size()-start ) );
    6771            0 :         return subStrings;
    6772            0 :     }

    6798              :         }

    6800              :     }

    6802            0 :     int StringRef::compare( StringRef rhs ) const {
    6803              :         auto cmpResult =
    6804            0 :             strncmp( m_start, rhs.m_start, std::min( m_size, rhs.m_size ) );
    6805              : 
    6806              :         // This means that strncmp found a difference before the strings
    6807              :         // ended, and we can return it directly
    6808            0 :         if ( cmpResult != 0 ) {
    6809            0 :             return cmpResult;
    6810              :         }
    6811              : 
    6812              :         // If strings are equal up to length, then their comparison results on
    6813              :         // their size
    6814            0 :         if ( m_size < rhs.m_size ) {
    6815            0 :             return -1;
    6816            0 :         } else if ( m_size > rhs.m_size ) {
    6817            0 :             return 1;
    6818              :         } else {
    6819            0 :             return 0;
    6820              :         }
    6821              :     }

    6891            1 :     TestCaseInfoHasher::TestCaseInfoHasher( hash_t seed ): m_seed( seed ) {}
    6892              : 
    6893          118 :     uint32_t TestCaseInfoHasher::operator()( TestCaseInfo const& t ) const {
    6894              :         // FNV-1a hash algorithm that is designed for uniqueness:
    6895          118 :         const hash_t prime = 1099511628211u;
    6896          118 :         hash_t hash = 14695981039346656037u;
    6897        10463 :         for ( const char c : t.name ) {
    6898        10345 :             hash ^= c;
    6899        10345 :             hash *= prime;
    6900              :         }
    6901          118 :         for ( const char c : t.className ) {
    6902            0 :             hash ^= c;
    6903            0 :             hash *= prime;
    6904              :         }
    6905          236 :         for ( const Tag& tag : t.tags ) {
    6906         1052 :             for ( const char c : tag.original ) {
    6907          934 :                 hash ^= c;
    6908          934 :                 hash *= prime;
    6909              :             }
    6910              :         }
    6911          118 :         hash ^= m_seed;
    6912          118 :         hash *= prime;
    6913          118 :         const uint32_t low{ static_cast<uint32_t>( hash ) };
    6914          118 :         const uint32_t high{ static_cast<uint32_t>( hash >> 32 ) };
    6915          118 :         return low * high;
    6916              :     }
    6917              : } // namespace Catch
    6918              : 
    6919              : 
    6920              :

    6928            1 :         static void enforceNoDuplicateTestCases(
    6929              :             std::vector<TestCaseHandle> const& tests ) {
    6930         1012 :             auto testInfoCmp = []( TestCaseInfo const* lhs,
    6931              :                                    TestCaseInfo const* rhs ) {
    6932         1012 :                 return *lhs < *rhs;
    6933              :             };
    6934              :             std::set<TestCaseInfo const*, decltype( testInfoCmp )&> seenTests(
    6935            1 :                 testInfoCmp );
    6936          119 :             for ( auto const& test : tests ) {
    6937          118 :                 const auto infoPtr = &test.getTestCaseInfo();
    6938          118 :                 const auto prev = seenTests.insert( infoPtr );
    6939          118 :                 CATCH_ENFORCE( prev.second,
    6940              :                                "error: test case \""
    6941              :                                    << infoPtr->name << "\", with tags \""
    6942              :                                    << infoPtr->tagsAsString()
    6943              :                                    << "\" already defined.\n"
    6944              :                                    << "\tFirst seen at "
    6945              :                                    << ( *prev.first )->lineInfo << "\n"
    6946              :                                    << "\tRedefined at " << infoPtr->lineInfo );
    6947              :             }
    6948            1 :         }

    6953            0 :             return testSpec.matches( testCase.getTestCaseInfo() ) &&
    6954            0 :                    isThrowSafe( testCase, config );

    6959            1 :     std::vector<TestCaseHandle> sortTests( IConfig const& config, std::vector<TestCaseHandle> const& unsortedTestCases ) {
    6960            1 :         switch (config.runOrder()) {
    6961            0 :         case TestRunOrder::Declared:
    6962            0 :             return unsortedTestCases;
    6963              : 
    6964            0 :         case TestRunOrder::LexicographicallySorted: {
    6965            0 :             std::vector<TestCaseHandle> sorted = unsortedTestCases;
    6966            0 :             std::sort(
    6967              :                 sorted.begin(),
    6968              :                 sorted.end(),
    6969            0 :                 []( TestCaseHandle const& lhs, TestCaseHandle const& rhs ) {
    6970            0 :                     return lhs.getTestCaseInfo() < rhs.getTestCaseInfo();
    6971              :                 }
    6972              :             );
    6973            0 :             return sorted;
    6974            0 :         }
    6975            1 :         case TestRunOrder::Randomized: {
    6976              :             using TestWithHash = std::pair<TestCaseInfoHasher::hash_t, TestCaseHandle>;
    6977              : 
    6978            1 :             TestCaseInfoHasher h{ config.rngSeed() };
    6979            1 :             std::vector<TestWithHash> indexed_tests;
    6980            1 :             indexed_tests.reserve(unsortedTestCases.size());
    6981              : 
    6982          119 :             for (auto const& handle : unsortedTestCases) {
    6983          118 :                 indexed_tests.emplace_back(h(handle.getTestCaseInfo()), handle);
    6984              :             }
    6985              : 
    6986            1 :             std::sort( indexed_tests.begin(),
    6987              :                        indexed_tests.end(),
    6988          968 :                        []( TestWithHash const& lhs, TestWithHash const& rhs ) {
    6989          968 :                            if ( lhs.first == rhs.first ) {
    6990            0 :                                return lhs.second.getTestCaseInfo() <
    6991            0 :                                       rhs.second.getTestCaseInfo();
    6992              :                            }
    6993          968 :                            return lhs.first < rhs.first;
    6994              :                        } );
    6995              : 
    6996            1 :             std::vector<TestCaseHandle> randomized;
    6997            1 :             randomized.reserve(indexed_tests.size());
    6998              : 
    6999          119 :             for (auto const& indexed : indexed_tests) {
    7000          118 :                 randomized.push_back(indexed.second);
    7001              :             }
    7002              : 
    7003            1 :             return randomized;
    7004            1 :         }
    7005              :         }
    7006              : 
    7007            0 :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("Unknown test order value!");
    7008              :     }

    7011            0 :         return !testCase.getTestCaseInfo().throws() || config.allowThrows();

    7014            0 :     std::vector<TestCaseHandle> filterTests( std::vector<TestCaseHandle> const& testCases, TestSpec const& testSpec, IConfig const& config ) {

    7022              :         }
    7023            0 :         return createShard(filtered, config.shardCount(), config.shardIndex());
    7024            0 :     }

    7162              :         // Close any still open children (e.g. generators)
    7163          239 :         while( &m_ctx.currentTracker() != this )
    7164            0 :             m_ctx.currentTracker().close();

    7167            0 :             case NeedsAnotherRun:
    7168            0 :                 break;

    7172          168 :                 break;

    7322          118 :         static StringRef extractClassName( StringRef classOrMethodName ) {
    7323          118 :             if ( !startsWith( classOrMethodName, '&' ) ) {
    7324          118 :                 return classOrMethodName;
    7325              :             }
    7326              : 
    7327              :             // Remove the leading '&' to avoid having to special case it later
    7328              :             const auto methodName =
    7329            0 :                 classOrMethodName.substr( 1, classOrMethodName.size() );
    7330              : 
    7331            0 :             auto reverseStart = std::make_reverse_iterator( methodName.end() );
    7332            0 :             auto reverseEnd = std::make_reverse_iterator( methodName.begin() );
    7333              : 
    7334              :             // We make a simplifying assumption that ":" is only present
    7335              :             // in the input as part of "::" from C++ typenames (this is
    7336              :             // relatively safe assumption because the input is generated
    7337              :             // as stringification of type through preprocessor).
    7338            0 :             auto lastColons = std::find( reverseStart, reverseEnd, ':' ) + 1;
    7339              :             auto secondLastColons =
    7340            0 :                 std::find( lastColons + 1, reverseEnd, ':' );
    7341              : 
    7342            0 :             auto const startIdx = reverseEnd - secondLastColons;
    7343            0 :             auto const classNameSize = secondLastColons - lastColons - 1;
    7344              : 
    7345            0 :             return methodName.substr(
    7346              :                 static_cast<std::size_t>( startIdx ),
    7347            0 :                 static_cast<std::size_t>( classNameSize ) );
    7348              :         }

    7414            0 :     bool TestSpecParser::visitChar( char c ) {
    7415            0 :         if( (m_mode != EscapedName) && (c == '\\') ) {
    7416            0 :             escape();
    7417            0 :             addCharToPattern(c);
    7418            0 :             return true;
    7419            0 :         }else if((m_mode != EscapedName) && (c == ',') )  {
    7420            0 :             return separate();
    7421              :         }
    7422              : 
    7423            0 :         switch( m_mode ) {
    7424            0 :         case None:
    7425            0 :             if( processNoneChar( c ) )
    7426            0 :                 return true;
    7427            0 :             break;
    7428            0 :         case Name:
    7429            0 :             processNameChar( c );
    7430            0 :             break;
    7431            0 :         case EscapedName:
    7432            0 :             endMode();
    7433            0 :             addCharToPattern(c);
    7434            0 :             return true;
    7435            0 :         default:
    7436              :         case Tag:
    7437              :         case QuotedName:
    7438            0 :             if( processOtherChar( c ) )
    7439            0 :                 return true;
    7440            0 :             break;
    7441              :         }
    7442              : 
    7443            0 :         m_substring += c;

    7445            0 :             m_patternName += c;
    7446            0 :             m_realPatternPos++;
    7447              :         }
    7448            0 :         return true;
    7449              :     }
    7450              :     // Two of the processing methods return true to signal the caller to return
    7451              :     // without adding the given character to the current pattern strings
    7452            0 :     bool TestSpecParser::processNoneChar( char c ) {

    7454            0 :         case ' ':
    7455            0 :             return true;
    7456            0 :         case '~':

    7458            0 :             return false;
    7459            0 :         case '[':
    7460            0 :             startNewMode( Tag );
    7461            0 :             return false;
    7462            0 :         case '"':
    7463            0 :             startNewMode( QuotedName );
    7464            0 :             return false;
    7465            0 :         default:
    7466            0 :             startNewMode( Name );
    7467            0 :             return false;
    7468              :         }
    7469              :     }
    7470            0 :     void TestSpecParser::processNameChar( char c ) {

    7473            0 :                 m_exclusion = true;
    7474              :             else
    7475            0 :                 endMode();

    7477              :         }
    7478            0 :     }

    7504            0 :     void TestSpecParser::escape() {

    7512            0 :                 return false;

    7514            0 :                 return c == '~';

    7516            0 :                 return c == '[';
    7517            0 :             case EscapedName:
    7518            0 :                 return true;

    7520            0 :                 return c == '"';
    7521            0 :             case Tag:

    7556            0 :     std::string TestSpecParser::preprocessPattern() {

    7560            0 :         m_escapeChars.clear();

    7562            0 :             m_exclusion = true;
    7563            0 :             token = token.substr(8);
    7564              :         }
    7565              : 
    7566            0 :         m_patternName.clear();

    7568              :

    7572            0 :     void TestSpecParser::addNamePattern() {
    7573            0 :         auto token = preprocessPattern();
    7574              : 
    7575            0 :         if (!token.empty()) {
    7576            0 :             if (m_exclusion) {
    7577            0 :                 m_currentFilter.m_forbidden.emplace_back(Detail::make_unique<TestSpec::NamePattern>(token, m_substring));
    7578              :             } else {
    7579            0 :                 m_currentFilter.m_required.emplace_back(Detail::make_unique<TestSpec::NamePattern>(token, m_substring));
    7580              :             }
    7581              :         }
    7582            0 :         m_substring.clear();
    7583            0 :         m_exclusion = false;
    7584            0 :         m_mode = None;
    7585            0 :     }
    7586              : 
    7587            0 :     void TestSpecParser::addTagPattern() {
    7588            0 :         auto token = preprocessPattern();
    7589              : 
    7590            0 :         if (!token.empty()) {
    7591              :             // If the tag pattern is the "hide and tag" shorthand (e.g. [.foo])
    7592              :             // we have to create a separate hide tag and shorten the real one
    7593            0 :             if (token.size() > 1 && token[0] == '.') {
    7594            0 :                 token.erase(token.begin());
    7595            0 :                 if (m_exclusion) {
    7596            0 :                     m_currentFilter.m_forbidden.emplace_back(Detail::make_unique<TestSpec::TagPattern>(".", m_substring));
    7597              :                 } else {
    7598            0 :                     m_currentFilter.m_required.emplace_back(Detail::make_unique<TestSpec::TagPattern>(".", m_substring));
    7599              :                 }
    7600              :             }
    7601            0 :             if (m_exclusion) {
    7602            0 :                 m_currentFilter.m_forbidden.emplace_back(Detail::make_unique<TestSpec::TagPattern>(token, m_substring));
    7603              :             } else {
    7604            0 :                 m_currentFilter.m_required.emplace_back(Detail::make_unique<TestSpec::TagPattern>(token, m_substring));
    7605              :             }
    7606              :         }
    7607            0 :         m_substring.clear();
    7608            0 :         m_exclusion = false;
    7609            0 :         m_mode = None;
    7610            0 :     }

    7621            0 :     bool isWhitespace( char c ) {
    7622            0 :         return c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == '\n' || c == '\r';
    7623              :     }
    7624              : 
    7625            0 :     bool isBreakableBefore( char c ) {
    7626              :         static const char chars[] = "[({<|";
    7627            0 :         return std::memchr( chars, c, sizeof( chars ) - 1 ) != nullptr;
    7628              :     }
    7629              : 
    7630            0 :     bool isBreakableAfter( char c ) {
    7631              :         static const char chars[] = "])}>.,:;*+-=&/\\";
    7632            0 :         return std::memchr( chars, c, sizeof( chars ) - 1 ) != nullptr;
    7633              :     }
    7634              : 
    7635              : } // namespace
    7636              : 
    7637              : namespace Catch {
    7638              :     namespace TextFlow {
    7639            0 :         void AnsiSkippingString::preprocessString() {
    7640            0 :             for ( auto it = m_string.begin(); it != m_string.end(); ) {
    7641              :                 // try to read through an ansi sequence
    7642            0 :                 while ( it != m_string.end() && *it == '\033' &&
    7643            0 :                         it + 1 != m_string.end() && *( it + 1 ) == '[' ) {
    7644            0 :                     auto cursor = it + 2;
    7645            0 :                     while ( cursor != m_string.end() &&
    7646            0 :                             ( isdigit( *cursor ) || *cursor == ';' ) ) {
    7647            0 :                         ++cursor;
    7648              :                     }
    7649            0 :                     if ( cursor == m_string.end() || *cursor != 'm' ) {
    7650            0 :                         break;
    7651              :                     }
    7652              :                     // 'm' -> 0xff
    7653            0 :                     *cursor = AnsiSkippingString::sentinel;
    7654              :                     // if we've read an ansi sequence, set the iterator and
    7655              :                     // return to the top of the loop
    7656            0 :                     it = cursor + 1;
    7657              :                 }
    7658            0 :                 if ( it != m_string.end() ) {
    7659            0 :                     ++m_size;
    7660            0 :                     ++it;
    7661              :                 }
    7662              :             }
    7663            0 :         }
    7664              : 
    7665            0 :         AnsiSkippingString::AnsiSkippingString( std::string const& text ):
    7666            0 :             m_string( text ) {
    7667            0 :             preprocessString();
    7668            0 :         }
    7669              : 
    7670            0 :         AnsiSkippingString::AnsiSkippingString( std::string&& text ):
    7671            0 :             m_string( CATCH_MOVE( text ) ) {
    7672            0 :             preprocessString();
    7673            0 :         }
    7674              : 
    7675            0 :         AnsiSkippingString::const_iterator AnsiSkippingString::begin() const {
    7676            0 :             return const_iterator( m_string );
    7677              :         }
    7678              : 
    7679            0 :         AnsiSkippingString::const_iterator AnsiSkippingString::end() const {
    7680            0 :             return const_iterator( m_string, const_iterator::EndTag{} );
    7681              :         }
    7682              : 
    7683            0 :         std::string AnsiSkippingString::substring( const_iterator begin,
    7684              :                                                    const_iterator end ) const {
    7685              :             // There's one caveat here to an otherwise simple substring: when
    7686              :             // making a begin iterator we might have skipped ansi sequences at
    7687              :             // the start. If `begin` here is a begin iterator, skipped over
    7688              :             // initial ansi sequences, we'll use the true beginning of the
    7689              :             // string. Lastly: We need to transform any chars we replaced with
    7690              :             // 0xff back to 'm'
    7691            0 :             auto str = std::string( begin == this->begin() ? m_string.begin()
    7692              :                                                            : begin.m_it,
    7693            0 :                                     end.m_it );
    7694            0 :             std::transform( str.begin(), str.end(), str.begin(), []( char c ) {
    7695            0 :                 return c == AnsiSkippingString::sentinel ? 'm' : c;
    7696              :             } );
    7697            0 :             return str;
    7698              :         }
    7699              : 
    7700            0 :         void AnsiSkippingString::const_iterator::tryParseAnsiEscapes() {
    7701              :             // check if we've landed on an ansi sequence, and if so read through
    7702              :             // it
    7703            0 :             while ( m_it != m_string->end() && *m_it == '\033' &&
    7704            0 :                     m_it + 1 != m_string->end() &&  *( m_it + 1 ) == '[' ) {
    7705            0 :                 auto cursor = m_it + 2;
    7706            0 :                 while ( cursor != m_string->end() &&
    7707            0 :                         ( isdigit( *cursor ) || *cursor == ';' ) ) {
    7708            0 :                     ++cursor;
    7709              :                 }
    7710            0 :                 if ( cursor == m_string->end() ||
    7711            0 :                      *cursor != AnsiSkippingString::sentinel ) {
    7712            0 :                     break;
    7713              :                 }
    7714              :                 // if we've read an ansi sequence, set the iterator and
    7715              :                 // return to the top of the loop
    7716            0 :                 m_it = cursor + 1;
    7717              :             }
    7718            0 :         }
    7719              : 
    7720            0 :         void AnsiSkippingString::const_iterator::advance() {
    7721            0 :             assert( m_it != m_string->end() );
    7722            0 :             m_it++;
    7723            0 :             tryParseAnsiEscapes();
    7724            0 :         }
    7725              : 
    7726            0 :         void AnsiSkippingString::const_iterator::unadvance() {
    7727            0 :             assert( m_it != m_string->begin() );
    7728            0 :             m_it--;
    7729              :             // if *m_it is 0xff, scan back to the \033 and then m_it-- once more
    7730              :             // (and repeat check)
    7731            0 :             while ( *m_it == AnsiSkippingString::sentinel ) {
    7732            0 :                 while ( *m_it != '\033' ) {
    7733            0 :                     assert( m_it != m_string->begin() );
    7734            0 :                     m_it--;
    7735              :                 }
    7736              :                 // if this happens, we must have been a begin iterator that had
    7737              :                 // skipped over ansi sequences at the start of a string
    7738            0 :                 assert( m_it != m_string->begin() );
    7739            0 :                 assert( *m_it == '\033' );
    7740            0 :                 m_it--;
    7741              :             }
    7742            0 :         }
    7743              : 
    7744            0 :         static bool isBoundary( AnsiSkippingString const& line,
    7745              :                                 AnsiSkippingString::const_iterator it ) {
    7746            0 :             return it == line.end() ||
    7747            0 :                    ( isWhitespace( *it ) &&
    7748            0 :                      !isWhitespace( *it.oneBefore() ) ) ||
    7749            0 :                    isBreakableBefore( *it ) ||
    7750            0 :                    isBreakableAfter( *it.oneBefore() );
    7751              :         }
    7752              : 
    7753            0 :         void Column::const_iterator::calcLength() {
    7754            0 :             m_addHyphen = false;
    7755            0 :             m_parsedTo = m_lineStart;
    7756            0 :             AnsiSkippingString const& current_line = m_column.m_string;
    7757              : 
    7758            0 :             if ( m_parsedTo == current_line.end() ) {
    7759            0 :                 m_lineEnd = m_parsedTo;
    7760            0 :                 return;
    7761              :             }
    7762              : 
    7763            0 :             assert( m_lineStart != current_line.end() );
    7764            0 :             if ( *m_lineStart == '\n' ) { ++m_parsedTo; }
    7765              : 
    7766            0 :             const auto maxLineLength = m_column.m_width - indentSize();
    7767            0 :             std::size_t lineLength = 0;
    7768            0 :             while ( m_parsedTo != current_line.end() &&
    7769            0 :                     lineLength < maxLineLength && *m_parsedTo != '\n' ) {
    7770            0 :                 ++m_parsedTo;
    7771            0 :                 ++lineLength;
    7772              :             }
    7773              : 
    7774              :             // If we encountered a newline before the column is filled,
    7775              :             // then we linebreak at the newline and consider this line
    7776              :             // finished.
    7777            0 :             if ( lineLength < maxLineLength ) {
    7778            0 :                 m_lineEnd = m_parsedTo;
    7779              :             } else {
    7780              :                 // Look for a natural linebreak boundary in the column
    7781              :                 // (We look from the end, so that the first found boundary is
    7782              :                 // the right one)
    7783            0 :                 m_lineEnd = m_parsedTo;
    7784            0 :                 while ( lineLength > 0 &&
    7785            0 :                         !isBoundary( current_line, m_lineEnd ) ) {
    7786            0 :                     --lineLength;
    7787            0 :                     --m_lineEnd;
    7788              :                 }
    7789            0 :                 while ( lineLength > 0 &&
    7790            0 :                         isWhitespace( *m_lineEnd.oneBefore() ) ) {
    7791            0 :                     --lineLength;
    7792            0 :                     --m_lineEnd;
    7793              :                 }
    7794              : 
    7795              :                 // If we found one, then that is where we linebreak, otherwise
    7796              :                 // we have to split text with a hyphen
    7797            0 :                 if ( lineLength == 0 ) {
    7798            0 :                     m_addHyphen = true;
    7799            0 :                     m_lineEnd = m_parsedTo.oneBefore();
    7800              :                 }
    7801              :             }
    7802              :         }
    7803              : 
    7804            0 :         size_t Column::const_iterator::indentSize() const {
    7805            0 :             auto initial = m_lineStart == m_column.m_string.begin()
    7806            0 :                                ? m_column.m_initialIndent
    7807            0 :                                : std::string::npos;
    7808            0 :             return initial == std::string::npos ? m_column.m_indent : initial;
    7809              :         }
    7810              : 
    7811            0 :         std::string Column::const_iterator::addIndentAndSuffix(
    7812              :             AnsiSkippingString::const_iterator start,
    7813              :             AnsiSkippingString::const_iterator end ) const {
    7814            0 :             std::string ret;
    7815            0 :             const auto desired_indent = indentSize();
    7816              :             // ret.reserve( desired_indent + (end - start) + m_addHyphen );
    7817            0 :             ret.append( desired_indent, ' ' );
    7818              :             // ret.append( start, end );
    7819            0 :             ret += m_column.m_string.substring( start, end );
    7820            0 :             if ( m_addHyphen ) { ret.push_back( '-' ); }
    7821              : 
    7822            0 :             return ret;
    7823            0 :         }
    7824              : 
    7825            0 :         Column::const_iterator::const_iterator( Column const& column ):
    7826            0 :             m_column( column ),
    7827            0 :             m_lineStart( column.m_string.begin() ),

    7830            0 :             assert( m_column.m_width > m_column.m_indent );

    7832              :                     m_column.m_width > m_column.m_initialIndent );

    7835            0 :                 m_lineStart = m_column.m_string.end();
    7836              :             }
    7837            0 :         }

    7839            0 :         std::string Column::const_iterator::operator*() const {

    7843              : 
    7844            0 :         Column::const_iterator& Column::const_iterator::operator++() {

    7851            0 :                         isWhitespace( *m_lineStart ) ) {
    7852            0 :                     ++m_lineStart;
    7853              :                 }

    8008            0 :     WildcardPattern::WildcardPattern( std::string const& pattern,
    8009            0 :                                       CaseSensitive caseSensitivity )
    8010            0 :     :   m_caseSensitivity( caseSensitivity ),
    8011            0 :         m_pattern( normaliseString( pattern ) )
    8012              :     {
    8013            0 :         if( startsWith( m_pattern, '*' ) ) {
    8014            0 :             m_pattern = m_pattern.substr( 1 );
    8015            0 :             m_wildcard = WildcardAtStart;
    8016              :         }
    8017            0 :         if( endsWith( m_pattern, '*' ) ) {
    8018            0 :             m_pattern = m_pattern.substr( 0, m_pattern.size()-1 );
    8019            0 :             m_wildcard = static_cast<WildcardPosition>( m_wildcard | WildcardAtEnd );
    8020              :         }
    8021            0 :     }
    8022              : 
    8023            0 :     bool WildcardPattern::matches( std::string const& str ) const {
    8024            0 :         switch( m_wildcard ) {
    8025            0 :             case NoWildcard:
    8026            0 :                 return m_pattern == normaliseString( str );
    8027            0 :             case WildcardAtStart:
    8028            0 :                 return endsWith( normaliseString( str ), m_pattern );
    8029            0 :             case WildcardAtEnd:
    8030            0 :                 return startsWith( normaliseString( str ), m_pattern );
    8031            0 :             case WildcardAtBothEnds:
    8032            0 :                 return contains( normaliseString( str ), m_pattern );
    8033            0 :             default:
    8034            0 :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Unknown enum" );
    8035              :         }
    8036              :     }
    8037              : 
    8038            0 :     std::string WildcardPattern::normaliseString( std::string const& str ) const {
    8039            0 :         return trim( m_caseSensitivity == CaseSensitive::No ? toLower( str ) : str );
    8040              :     }
    8041              : }
    8042              : 
    8043              : 
    8044              : // Note: swapping these two includes around causes MSVC to error out
    8045              : //       while in /permissive- mode. No, I don't know why.
    8046              : //       Tested on VS 2019, 18.{3, 4}.x
    8047              : 
    8048              : #include <cstdint>

    8055              : 
    8056            0 :     size_t trailingBytes(unsigned char c) {
    8057            0 :         if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
    8058            0 :             return 2;
    8059              :         }
    8060            0 :         if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
    8061            0 :             return 3;
    8062              :         }
    8063            0 :         if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
    8064            0 :             return 4;
    8065              :         }
    8066            0 :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
    8067              :     }
    8068              : 
    8069            0 :     uint32_t headerValue(unsigned char c) {
    8070            0 :         if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
    8071            0 :             return c & 0x1F;
    8072              :         }
    8073            0 :         if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
    8074            0 :             return c & 0x0F;
    8075              :         }
    8076            0 :         if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
    8077            0 :             return c & 0x07;
    8078              :         }
    8079            0 :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
    8080              :     }
    8081              : 
    8082            0 :     void hexEscapeChar(std::ostream& os, unsigned char c) {
    8083            0 :         std::ios_base::fmtflags f(os.flags());
    8084            0 :         os << "\\x"_sr
    8085            0 :             << std::uppercase << std::hex << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2)
    8086            0 :             << static_cast<int>(c);
    8087            0 :         os.flags(f);
    8088            0 :     }
    8089              : 
    8090            0 :     constexpr bool shouldNewline(XmlFormatting fmt) {
    8091            0 :         return !!(static_cast<std::underlying_type_t<XmlFormatting>>(fmt & XmlFormatting::Newline));
    8092              :     }
    8093              : 
    8094            0 :     constexpr bool shouldIndent(XmlFormatting fmt) {
    8095            0 :         return !!(static_cast<std::underlying_type_t<XmlFormatting>>(fmt & XmlFormatting::Indent));
    8096              :     }
    8097              : 
    8098              : } // anonymous namespace
    8099              : 
    8100            0 :     void XmlEncode::encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const {
    8101              :         // Apostrophe escaping not necessary if we always use " to write attributes
    8102              :         // (see: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax)
    8103            0 :         size_t last_start = 0;
    8104            0 :         auto write_to = [&]( size_t idx ) {
    8105            0 :             if ( last_start < idx ) {
    8106            0 :                 os << m_str.substr( last_start, idx - last_start );
    8107              :             }
    8108            0 :             last_start = idx + 1;
    8109            0 :         };
    8110              : 
    8111            0 :         for ( std::size_t idx = 0; idx < m_str.size(); ++idx ) {
    8112            0 :             unsigned char c = static_cast<unsigned char>( m_str[idx] );
    8113            0 :             switch ( c ) {
    8114            0 :             case '<':
    8115            0 :                 write_to( idx );
    8116            0 :                 os << "&lt;"_sr;
    8117            0 :                 break;
    8118            0 :             case '&':
    8119            0 :                 write_to( idx );
    8120            0 :                 os << "&amp;"_sr;
    8121            0 :                 break;
    8122              : 
    8123            0 :             case '>':
    8124              :                 // See: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax
    8125            0 :                 if ( idx > 2 && m_str[idx - 1] == ']' && m_str[idx - 2] == ']' ) {
    8126            0 :                     write_to( idx );
    8127            0 :                     os << "&gt;"_sr;
    8128              :                 }
    8129            0 :                 break;
    8130              : 
    8131            0 :             case '\"':
    8132            0 :                 if ( m_forWhat == ForAttributes ) {
    8133            0 :                     write_to( idx );
    8134            0 :                     os << "&quot;"_sr;
    8135              :                 }
    8136            0 :                 break;
    8137              : 
    8138            0 :             default:
    8139              :                 // Check for control characters and invalid utf-8
    8140              : 
    8141              :                 // Escape control characters in standard ascii
    8142              :                 // see
    8143              :                 // http://stackoverflow.com/questions/404107/why-are-control-characters-illegal-in-xml-1-0
    8144            0 :                 if ( c < 0x09 || ( c > 0x0D && c < 0x20 ) || c == 0x7F ) {
    8145            0 :                     write_to( idx );
    8146            0 :                     hexEscapeChar( os, c );
    8147            0 :                     break;
    8148              :                 }
    8149              : 
    8150              :                 // Plain ASCII: Write it to stream
    8151            0 :                 if ( c < 0x7F ) {
    8152            0 :                     break;
    8153              :                 }
    8154              : 
    8155              :                 // UTF-8 territory
    8156              :                 // Check if the encoding is valid and if it is not, hex escape
    8157              :                 // bytes. Important: We do not check the exact decoded values for
    8158              :                 // validity, only the encoding format First check that this bytes is
    8159              :                 // a valid lead byte: This means that it is not encoded as 1111 1XXX
    8160              :                 // Or as 10XX XXXX
    8161            0 :                 if ( c < 0xC0 || c >= 0xF8 ) {
    8162            0 :                     write_to( idx );
    8163            0 :                     hexEscapeChar( os, c );
    8164            0 :                     break;
    8165              :                 }
    8166              : 
    8167            0 :                 auto encBytes = trailingBytes( c );
    8168              :                 // Are there enough bytes left to avoid accessing out-of-bounds
    8169              :                 // memory?
    8170            0 :                 if ( idx + encBytes - 1 >= m_str.size() ) {
    8171            0 :                     write_to( idx );
    8172            0 :                     hexEscapeChar( os, c );
    8173            0 :                     break;
    8174              :                 }
    8175              :                 // The header is valid, check data
    8176              :                 // The next encBytes bytes must together be a valid utf-8
    8177              :                 // This means: bitpattern 10XX XXXX and the extracted value is sane
    8178              :                 // (ish)
    8179            0 :                 bool valid = true;
    8180            0 :                 uint32_t value = headerValue( c );
    8181            0 :                 for ( std::size_t n = 1; n < encBytes; ++n ) {
    8182            0 :                     unsigned char nc = static_cast<unsigned char>( m_str[idx + n] );
    8183            0 :                     valid &= ( ( nc & 0xC0 ) == 0x80 );
    8184            0 :                     value = ( value << 6 ) | ( nc & 0x3F );
    8185              :                 }
    8186              : 
    8187            0 :                 if (
    8188              :                     // Wrong bit pattern of following bytes
    8189            0 :                     ( !valid ) ||
    8190              :                     // Overlong encodings
    8191            0 :                     ( value < 0x80 ) ||
    8192            0 :                     ( 0x80 <= value && value < 0x800 && encBytes > 2 ) ||
    8193            0 :                     ( 0x800 < value && value < 0x10000 && encBytes > 3 ) ||
    8194              :                     // Encoded value out of range
    8195              :                     ( value >= 0x110000 ) ) {
    8196            0 :                     write_to( idx );
    8197            0 :                     hexEscapeChar( os, c );
    8198            0 :                     break;
    8199              :                 }
    8200              : 
    8201              :                 // If we got here, this is in fact a valid(ish) utf-8 sequence
    8202            0 :                 idx += encBytes - 1;
    8203            0 :                 break;
    8204              :             }
    8205              :         }
    8206              : 
    8207            0 :         write_to( m_str.size() );
    8208            0 :     }
    8209              : 
    8210            0 :     std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode ) {
    8211            0 :         xmlEncode.encodeTo( os );
    8212            0 :         return os;
    8213              :     }
    8214              : 
    8215            0 :     XmlWriter::ScopedElement::ScopedElement( XmlWriter* writer, XmlFormatting fmt )

    8295            0 :             m_os << "/>";
    8296            0 :             m_tagIsOpen = false;

    8298            0 :             newlineIfNecessary();

    8301              :             }
