    8459              : 
    8460              :     template <typename FP>
    8461            0 :     bool almostEqualUlps(FP lhs, FP rhs, uint64_t maxUlpDiff) {
    8462              :         // Comparison with NaN should always be false.
    8463              :         // This way we can rule it out before getting into the ugly details
    8464            0 :         if (Catch::isnan(lhs) || Catch::isnan(rhs)) {
    8465            0 :             return false;
    8466              :         }
    8467              : 
    8468              :         // This should also handle positive and negative zeros, infinities
    8469            0 :         const auto ulpDist = ulpDistance(lhs, rhs);
    8470              : 
    8471            0 :         return ulpDist <= maxUlpDiff;
    8472              :     }
    8473              : 
    8474              : 
    8475              : template <typename FP>
    8476            0 : FP step(FP start, FP direction, uint64_t steps) {
    8477            0 :     for (uint64_t i = 0; i < steps; ++i) {
    8478            0 :         start = Catch::nextafter(start, direction);
    8479              :     }
    8480            0 :     return start;
    8481              : }
    8482              : 
    8483              : // Performs equivalent check of std::fabs(lhs - rhs) <= margin
    8484              : // But without the subtraction to allow for INFINITY in comparison
    8485            0 : bool marginComparison(double lhs, double rhs, double margin) {
    8486            0 :     return (lhs + margin >= rhs) && (rhs + margin >= lhs);
    8487              : }
    8488              : 
    8489              : template <typename FloatingPoint>
    8490            0 : void write(std::ostream& out, FloatingPoint num) {
    8491            0 :     out << std::scientific
    8492            0 :         << std::setprecision(std::numeric_limits<FloatingPoint>::max_digits10 - 1)
    8493            0 :         << num;
    8494            0 : }
    8495              : 
    8496              : } // end anonymous namespace
    8497              :

    8503              :         Double
    8504              :     };
    8505              :

    8513            0 :     }

    8517            0 :     bool WithinAbsMatcher::match(double const& matchee) const {
    8518            0 :         return (matchee + m_margin >= m_target) && (m_target + m_margin >= matchee);

    8534            0 :     }

    8540              : #endif
    8541              : 
    8542            0 :     bool WithinUlpsMatcher::match(double const& matchee) const {
    8543            0 :         switch (m_type) {
    8544            0 :         case Detail::FloatingPointKind::Float:
    8545            0 :             return almostEqualUlps<float>(static_cast<float>(matchee), static_cast<float>(m_target), m_ulps);
    8546            0 :         case Detail::FloatingPointKind::Double:
    8547            0 :             return almostEqualUlps<double>(matchee, m_target, m_ulps);
    8548            0 :         default:
    8549            0 :             CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Unknown Detail::FloatingPointKind value" );
    8550              :         }
    8551              :     }
    8552              : 
    8553              : #if defined(__clang__)
    8554              : #pragma clang diagnostic pop
    8555              : #endif
    8556              : 
    8557            0 :     std::string WithinUlpsMatcher::describe() const {
    8558            0 :         std::stringstream ret;
    8559              : 
    8560            0 :         ret << "is within " << m_ulps << " ULPs of ";
    8561              : 
    8562            0 :         if (m_type == Detail::FloatingPointKind::Float) {
    8563            0 :             write(ret, static_cast<float>(m_target));
    8564            0 :             ret << 'f';
    8565              :         } else {
    8566            0 :             write(ret, m_target);
    8567              :         }
    8568              : 
    8569            0 :         ret << " ([";
    8570            0 :         if (m_type == Detail::FloatingPointKind::Double) {
    8571            0 :             write( ret,
    8572            0 :                    step( m_target,
    8573            0 :                          -std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity(),
    8574            0 :                          m_ulps ) );
    8575            0 :             ret << ", ";
    8576            0 :             write( ret,
    8577            0 :                    step( m_target,
    8578              :                          std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity(),
    8579            0 :                          m_ulps ) );
    8580              :         } else {
    8581              :             // We have to cast INFINITY to float because of MinGW, see #1782
    8582            0 :             write( ret,
    8583            0 :                    step( static_cast<float>( m_target ),
    8584            0 :                          -std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity(),
    8585            0 :                          m_ulps ) );
    8586            0 :             ret << ", ";
    8587            0 :             write( ret,
    8588            0 :                    step( static_cast<float>( m_target ),
    8589              :                          std::numeric_limits<float>::infinity(),
    8590            0 :                          m_ulps ) );
    8591              :         }
    8592            0 :         ret << "])";
    8593              : 
    8594            0 :         return ret.str();
    8595            0 :     }

    8597            0 :     WithinRelMatcher::WithinRelMatcher(double target, double epsilon):

    8600            0 :         CATCH_ENFORCE(m_epsilon >= 0., "Relative comparison with epsilon <  0 does not make sense.");

    8602            0 :     }

    8606            0 :         return marginComparison(matchee, m_target,
    8607            0 :                                 std::isinf(relMargin)? 0 : relMargin);

    8697            0 :     CasedString::CasedString( std::string const& str, CaseSensitive caseSensitivity )

    8701            0 :     std::string CasedString::adjustString( std::string const& str ) const {
    8702            0 :         return m_caseSensitivity == CaseSensitive::No
    8703            0 :                ? toLower( str )
    8704            0 :                : str;
    8705              :     }
    8706            0 :     StringRef CasedString::caseSensitivitySuffix() const {
    8707            0 :         return m_caseSensitivity == CaseSensitive::Yes
    8708            0 :                    ? StringRef()
    8709            0 :                    : " (case insensitive)"_sr;

    8764            0 :             flags |= std::regex::icase;
    8765              :         }

    8767            0 :         return std::regex_match(matchee, reg);

    8803            0 :         std::string describe_multi_matcher(StringRef combine, std::string const* descriptions_begin, std::string const* descriptions_end) {
    8804            0 :             std::string description;
    8805            0 :             std::size_t combined_size = 4;
    8806            0 :             for ( auto desc = descriptions_begin; desc != descriptions_end; ++desc ) {
    8807            0 :                 combined_size += desc->size();
    8808              :             }
    8809            0 :             combined_size += static_cast<size_t>(descriptions_end - descriptions_begin - 1) * combine.size();
    8810              : 
    8811            0 :             description.reserve(combined_size);
    8812              : 
    8813            0 :             description += "( ";
    8814            0 :             bool first = true;
    8815            0 :             for( auto desc = descriptions_begin; desc != descriptions_end; ++desc ) {
    8816            0 :                 if( first )
    8817            0 :                     first = false;
    8818              :                 else
    8819            0 :                     description += combine;
    8820            0 :                 description += *desc;
    8821              :             }
    8822            0 :             description += " )";
    8823            0 :             return description;
    8824            0 :         }
    8825              :

    8924              :     // Colour::LightGrey
    8925              :     static constexpr Colour::Code compactDimColour = Colour::FileName;
    8926              : 
    8927              : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC
    8928              :     static constexpr Catch::StringRef compactFailedString = "FAILED"_sr;
    8929              :     static constexpr Catch::StringRef compactPassedString = "PASSED"_sr;
    8930              : #else
    8931              :     static constexpr Catch::StringRef compactFailedString = "failed"_sr;
    8932              :     static constexpr Catch::StringRef compactPassedString = "passed"_sr;
    8933              : #endif
    8934              : 
    8935              : // Implementation of CompactReporter formatting
    8936              : class AssertionPrinter {
    8937              : public:
    8938              :     AssertionPrinter& operator= (AssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
    8939              :     AssertionPrinter(AssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
    8940            0 :     AssertionPrinter(std::ostream& _stream, AssertionStats const& _stats, bool _printInfoMessages, ColourImpl* colourImpl_)
    8941            0 :         : stream(_stream)
    8942            0 :         , result(_stats.assertionResult)
    8943            0 :         , messages(_stats.infoMessages)
    8944            0 :         , itMessage(_stats.infoMessages.begin())
    8945            0 :         , printInfoMessages(_printInfoMessages)
    8946            0 :         , colourImpl(colourImpl_)
    8947            0 :     {}
    8948              : 
    8949            0 :     void print() {
    8950            0 :         printSourceInfo();
    8951              : 
    8952            0 :         itMessage = messages.begin();
    8953              : 
    8954            0 :         switch (result.getResultType()) {
    8955            0 :         case ResultWas::Ok:
    8956            0 :             printResultType(Colour::ResultSuccess, compactPassedString);
    8957            0 :             printOriginalExpression();
    8958            0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
    8959            0 :             if (!result.hasExpression())
    8960            0 :                 printRemainingMessages(Colour::None);
    8961              :             else
    8962            0 :                 printRemainingMessages();
    8963            0 :             break;
    8964            0 :         case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
    8965            0 :             if (result.isOk())
    8966            0 :                 printResultType(Colour::ResultSuccess, compactFailedString + " - but was ok"_sr);
    8967              :             else
    8968            0 :                 printResultType(Colour::Error, compactFailedString);
    8969            0 :             printOriginalExpression();
    8970            0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
    8971            0 :             printRemainingMessages();
    8972            0 :             break;
    8973            0 :         case ResultWas::ThrewException:
    8974            0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, compactFailedString);
    8975            0 :             printIssue("unexpected exception with message:");
    8976            0 :             printMessage();
    8977            0 :             printExpressionWas();
    8978            0 :             printRemainingMessages();
    8979            0 :             break;
    8980            0 :         case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
    8981            0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, compactFailedString);
    8982            0 :             printIssue("fatal error condition with message:");
    8983            0 :             printMessage();
    8984            0 :             printExpressionWas();
    8985            0 :             printRemainingMessages();
    8986            0 :             break;
    8987            0 :         case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
    8988            0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, compactFailedString);
    8989            0 :             printIssue("expected exception, got none");
    8990            0 :             printExpressionWas();
    8991            0 :             printRemainingMessages();
    8992            0 :             break;
    8993            0 :         case ResultWas::Info:
    8994            0 :             printResultType(Colour::None, "info"_sr);
    8995            0 :             printMessage();
    8996            0 :             printRemainingMessages();
    8997            0 :             break;
    8998            0 :         case ResultWas::Warning:
    8999            0 :             printResultType(Colour::None, "warning"_sr);
    9000            0 :             printMessage();
    9001            0 :             printRemainingMessages();
    9002            0 :             break;
    9003            0 :         case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
    9004            0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, compactFailedString);
    9005            0 :             printIssue("explicitly");
    9006            0 :             printRemainingMessages(Colour::None);
    9007            0 :             break;
    9008            0 :         case ResultWas::ExplicitSkip:
    9009            0 :             printResultType(Colour::Skip, "skipped"_sr);
    9010            0 :             printMessage();
    9011            0 :             printRemainingMessages();
    9012            0 :             break;
    9013              :             // These cases are here to prevent compiler warnings
    9014            0 :         case ResultWas::Unknown:
    9015              :         case ResultWas::FailureBit:
    9016              :         case ResultWas::Exception:
    9017            0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, "** internal error **");
    9018            0 :             break;
    9019              :         }
    9020            0 :     }
    9021              : 
    9022              : private:
    9023            0 :     void printSourceInfo() const {
    9024            0 :         stream << colourImpl->guardColour( Colour::FileName )
    9025            0 :                << result.getSourceInfo() << ':';
    9026            0 :     }
    9027              : 
    9028            0 :     void printResultType(Colour::Code colour, StringRef passOrFail) const {
    9029            0 :         if (!passOrFail.empty()) {
    9030            0 :             stream << colourImpl->guardColour(colour) << ' ' << passOrFail;
    9031            0 :             stream << ':';
    9032              :         }
    9033            0 :     }
    9034              : 
    9035            0 :     void printIssue(char const* issue) const {
    9036            0 :         stream << ' ' << issue;
    9037            0 :     }
    9038              : 
    9039            0 :     void printExpressionWas() {
    9040            0 :         if (result.hasExpression()) {
    9041            0 :             stream << ';';
    9042              :             {
    9043            0 :                 stream << colourImpl->guardColour(compactDimColour) << " expression was:";
    9044              :             }
    9045            0 :             printOriginalExpression();
    9046              :         }
    9047            0 :     }
    9048              : 
    9049            0 :     void printOriginalExpression() const {
    9050            0 :         if (result.hasExpression()) {
    9051            0 :             stream << ' ' << result.getExpression();
    9052              :         }
    9053            0 :     }
    9054              : 
    9055            0 :     void printReconstructedExpression() const {
    9056            0 :         if (result.hasExpandedExpression()) {
    9057            0 :             stream << colourImpl->guardColour(compactDimColour) << " for: ";
    9058            0 :             stream << result.getExpandedExpression();
    9059              :         }
    9060            0 :     }
    9061              : 
    9062            0 :     void printMessage() {
    9063            0 :         if (itMessage != messages.end()) {
    9064            0 :             stream << " '" << itMessage->message << '\'';
    9065            0 :             ++itMessage;
    9066              :         }
    9067            0 :     }
    9068              : 
    9069            0 :     void printRemainingMessages(Colour::Code colour = compactDimColour) {
    9070            0 :         if (itMessage == messages.end())
    9071            0 :             return;
    9072              : 
    9073            0 :         const auto itEnd = messages.cend();
    9074            0 :         const auto N = static_cast<std::size_t>(itEnd - itMessage);
    9075              : 
    9076            0 :         stream << colourImpl->guardColour( colour ) << " with "
    9077            0 :                << pluralise( N, "message"_sr ) << ':';
    9078              : 
    9079            0 :         while (itMessage != itEnd) {
    9080              :             // If this assertion is a warning ignore any INFO messages
    9081            0 :             if (printInfoMessages || itMessage->type != ResultWas::Info) {
    9082            0 :                 printMessage();
    9083            0 :                 if (itMessage != itEnd) {
    9084            0 :                     stream << colourImpl->guardColour(compactDimColour) << " and";
    9085              :                 }
    9086            0 :                 continue;
    9087              :             }
    9088            0 :             ++itMessage;
    9089              :         }
    9090              :     }
    9091              : 
    9092              : private:
    9093              :     std::ostream& stream;
    9094              :     AssertionResult const& result;
    9095              :     std::vector<MessageInfo> const& messages;
    9096              :     std::vector<MessageInfo>::const_iterator itMessage;
    9097              :     bool printInfoMessages;
    9098              :     ColourImpl* colourImpl;
    9099              : };

    9122            0 :         void CompactReporter::assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& _assertionStats ) {
    9123            0 :             AssertionResult const& result = _assertionStats.assertionResult;
    9124              : 
    9125            0 :             bool printInfoMessages = true;
    9126              : 
    9127              :             // Drop out if result was successful and we're not printing those
    9128            0 :             if( !m_config->includeSuccessfulResults() && result.isOk() ) {
    9129            0 :                 if( result.getResultType() != ResultWas::Warning && result.getResultType() != ResultWas::ExplicitSkip )

    9179              : 
    9180              : // Formatter impl for ConsoleReporter
    9181              : class ConsoleAssertionPrinter {
    9182              : public:
    9183              :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter& operator= (ConsoleAssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
    9184              :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter(ConsoleAssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
    9185            0 :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter(std::ostream& _stream, AssertionStats const& _stats, ColourImpl* colourImpl_, bool _printInfoMessages)
    9186            0 :         : stream(_stream),
    9187            0 :         stats(_stats),
    9188            0 :         result(_stats.assertionResult),
    9189            0 :         colour(Colour::None),
    9190            0 :         messages(_stats.infoMessages),
    9191            0 :         colourImpl(colourImpl_),
    9192            0 :         printInfoMessages(_printInfoMessages) {
    9193            0 :         switch (result.getResultType()) {
    9194            0 :         case ResultWas::Ok:
    9195            0 :             colour = Colour::Success;
    9196            0 :             passOrFail = "PASSED"_sr;
    9197              :             //if( result.hasMessage() )
    9198            0 :             if (messages.size() == 1)
    9199            0 :                 messageLabel = "with message"_sr;
    9200            0 :             if (messages.size() > 1)
    9201            0 :                 messageLabel = "with messages"_sr;
    9202            0 :             break;
    9203            0 :         case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
    9204            0 :             if (result.isOk()) {
    9205            0 :                 colour = Colour::Success;
    9206            0 :                 passOrFail = "FAILED - but was ok"_sr;
    9207              :             } else {
    9208            0 :                 colour = Colour::Error;
    9209            0 :                 passOrFail = "FAILED"_sr;
    9210              :             }
    9211            0 :             if (messages.size() == 1)
    9212            0 :                 messageLabel = "with message"_sr;
    9213            0 :             if (messages.size() > 1)
    9214            0 :                 messageLabel = "with messages"_sr;
    9215            0 :             break;
    9216            0 :         case ResultWas::ThrewException:
    9217            0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
    9218            0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED"_sr;
    9219              :             // todo switch
    9220            0 :             switch (messages.size()) { case 0:
    9221            0 :                 messageLabel = "due to unexpected exception with "_sr;
    9222            0 :                 break;
    9223            0 :             case 1:
    9224            0 :                 messageLabel = "due to unexpected exception with message"_sr;
    9225            0 :                 break;

    9352              : class Duration {
    9353              :     enum class Unit : uint8_t {
    9354              :         Auto,
    9355              :         Nanoseconds,
    9356              :         Microseconds,
    9357              :         Milliseconds,
    9358              :         Seconds,
    9359              :         Minutes
    9360              :     };
    9361              :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond = 1000;
    9362              :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond = 1000 * s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond;
    9363              :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInASecond = 1000 * s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond;
    9364              :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMinute = 60 * s_nanosecondsInASecond;
    9365              : 
    9366              :     double m_inNanoseconds;
    9367              :     Unit m_units;
    9368              : 
    9369              : public:
    9370            0 :     explicit Duration(double inNanoseconds, Unit units = Unit::Auto)
    9371            0 :         : m_inNanoseconds(inNanoseconds),
    9372            0 :         m_units(units) {
    9373            0 :         if (m_units == Unit::Auto) {
    9374            0 :             if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond)
    9375            0 :                 m_units = Unit::Nanoseconds;
    9376            0 :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond)
    9377            0 :                 m_units = Unit::Microseconds;
    9378            0 :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInASecond)
    9379            0 :                 m_units = Unit::Milliseconds;
    9380            0 :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMinute)
    9381            0 :                 m_units = Unit::Seconds;
    9382              :             else
    9383            0 :                 m_units = Unit::Minutes;
    9384              :         }
    9385              : 
    9386            0 :     }
    9387              : 
    9388            0 :     auto value() const -> double {
    9389            0 :         switch (m_units) {
    9390            0 :         case Unit::Microseconds:
    9391            0 :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond);
    9392            0 :         case Unit::Milliseconds:
    9393            0 :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond);
    9394            0 :         case Unit::Seconds:
    9395            0 :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInASecond);
    9396            0 :         case Unit::Minutes:
    9397            0 :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMinute);
    9398            0 :         default:
    9399            0 :             return m_inNanoseconds;
    9400              :         }
    9401              :     }
    9402            0 :     StringRef unitsAsString() const {
    9403            0 :         switch (m_units) {
    9404            0 :         case Unit::Nanoseconds:
    9405            0 :             return "ns"_sr;
    9406            0 :         case Unit::Microseconds:
    9407            0 :             return "us"_sr;
    9408            0 :         case Unit::Milliseconds:
    9409            0 :             return "ms"_sr;
    9410            0 :         case Unit::Seconds:
    9411            0 :             return "s"_sr;
    9412            0 :         case Unit::Minutes:
    9413            0 :             return "m"_sr;
    9414            0 :         default:
    9415            0 :             return "** internal error **"_sr;
    9416              :         }
    9417              : 
    9418              :     }
    9419            0 :     friend auto operator << (std::ostream& os, Duration const& duration) -> std::ostream& {
    9420            0 :         return os << duration.value() << ' ' << duration.unitsAsString();
    9421              :     }
    9422              : };
    9423              : } // end anon namespace

    9715              : 
    9716            0 :     m_stream << lineOfChars( '-' ) << '\n'
    9717            0 :              << m_colour->guardColour( Colour::FileName ) << lineInfo << '\n'
    9718            0 :              << lineOfChars( '.' ) << "\n\n"
    9719            0 :              << std::flush;
    9720            0 : }
    9721              : 
    9722            0 : void ConsoleReporter::printClosedHeader(std::string const& _name) {
    9723            0 :     printOpenHeader(_name);
    9724            0 :     m_stream << lineOfChars('.') << '\n';
    9725            0 : }
    9726            0 : void ConsoleReporter::printOpenHeader(std::string const& _name) {
    9727            0 :     m_stream << lineOfChars('-') << '\n';
    9728              :     {
    9729            0 :         auto guard = m_colour->guardColour( Colour::Headers ).engage( m_stream );
    9730            0 :         printHeaderString(_name);
    9731            0 :     }
    9732            0 : }
    9733              : 
    9734            0 : void ConsoleReporter::printHeaderString(std::string const& _string, std::size_t indent) {
    9735              :     // We want to get a bit fancy with line breaking here, so that subsequent
    9736              :     // lines start after ":" if one is present, e.g.
    9737              :     // ```
    9738              :     // blablabla: Fancy
    9739              :     //            linebreaking
    9740              :     // ```
    9741              :     // but we also want to avoid problems with overly long indentation causing
    9742              :     // the text to take up too many lines, e.g.
    9743              :     // ```
    9744              :     // blablabla: F
    9745              :     //            a
    9746              :     //            n
    9747              :     //            c
    9748              :     //            y
    9749              :     //            .
    9750              :     //            .
    9751              :     //            .
    9752              :     // ```
    9753              :     // So we limit the prefix indentation check to first quarter of the possible
    9754              :     // width
    9755            0 :     std::size_t idx = _string.find( ": " );
    9756            0 :     if ( idx != std::string::npos && idx < CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH / 4 ) {
    9757            0 :         idx += 2;
    9758              :     } else {
    9759            0 :         idx = 0;
    9760              :     }
    9761            0 :     m_stream << TextFlow::Column( _string )
    9762            0 :                   .indent( indent + idx )
    9763            0 :                   .initialIndent( indent )
    9764            0 :            << '\n';
    9765            0 : }
    9766              : 
    9767            1 : void ConsoleReporter::printTotalsDivider(Totals const& totals) {
    9768            1 :     if (totals.testCases.total() > 0) {
    9769            1 :         std::size_t failedRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.failed, totals.testCases.total());
    9770            1 :         std::size_t failedButOkRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.failedButOk, totals.testCases.total());
    9771            1 :         std::size_t passedRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.passed, totals.testCases.total());
    9772            1 :         std::size_t skippedRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.skipped, totals.testCases.total());
    9773            1 :         while (failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio + skippedRatio < CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1)
    9774            0 :             findMax(failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio, skippedRatio)++;
    9775            2 :         while (failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio > CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1)
    9776            1 :             findMax(failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio, skippedRatio)--;
    9777              : 
    9778            1 :         m_stream << m_colour->guardColour( Colour::Error )
    9779            2 :                  << std::string( failedRatio, '=' )
    9780            2 :                  << m_colour->guardColour( Colour::ResultExpectedFailure )
    9781            2 :                  << std::string( failedButOkRatio, '=' );
    9782            1 :         if ( totals.testCases.allPassed() ) {
    9783            2 :             m_stream << m_colour->guardColour( Colour::ResultSuccess )
    9784            2 :                      << std::string( passedRatio, '=' );
    9785              :         } else {
    9786            0 :             m_stream << m_colour->guardColour( Colour::Success )
    9787            0 :                      << std::string( passedRatio, '=' );
    9788              :         }
    9789            2 :         m_stream << m_colour->guardColour( Colour::Skip )
    9790            2 :                  << std::string( skippedRatio, '=' );
    9791              :     } else {
    9792            0 :         m_stream << m_colour->guardColour( Colour::Warning )
    9793            0 :                  << std::string( CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1, '=' );
    9794              :     }
    9795            1 :     m_stream << '\n';
    9796            1 : }

    9816              :         struct BySectionInfo {
    9817            0 :             BySectionInfo( SectionInfo const& other ): m_other( other ) {}
    9818              :             BySectionInfo( BySectionInfo const& other ) = default;
    9819            0 :             bool operator()(
    9820              :                 Detail::unique_ptr<CumulativeReporterBase::SectionNode> const&
    9821              :                     node ) const {
    9822              :                 return (
    9823            0 :                     ( node->stats.sectionInfo.name == m_other.name ) &&
    9824            0 :                     ( node->stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo == m_other.lineInfo ) );
    9825              :             }
    9826              :             void operator=( BySectionInfo const& ) = delete;
    9827              :

    9865            0 :     void CumulativeReporterBase::benchmarkEnded(BenchmarkStats<> const& benchmarkStats) {
    9866            0 :         m_sectionStack.back()->assertionsAndBenchmarks.emplace_back(benchmarkStats);
    9867            0 :     }
    9868              : 
    9869              :     void
    9870            0 :     CumulativeReporterBase::sectionStarting( SectionInfo const& sectionInfo ) {
    9871              :         // We need a copy, because SectionStats expect to take ownership
    9872            0 :         SectionStats incompleteStats( SectionInfo(sectionInfo), Counts(), 0, false );
    9873              :         SectionNode* node;
    9874            0 :         if ( m_sectionStack.empty() ) {
    9875            0 :             if ( !m_rootSection ) {
    9876              :                 m_rootSection =
    9877            0 :                     Detail::make_unique<SectionNode>( incompleteStats );
    9878              :             }
    9879            0 :             node = m_rootSection.get();
    9880              :         } else {
    9881            0 :             SectionNode& parentNode = *m_sectionStack.back();
    9882            0 :             auto it = std::find_if( parentNode.childSections.begin(),
    9883              :                                     parentNode.childSections.end(),
    9884              :                                     BySectionInfo( sectionInfo ) );
    9885            0 :             if ( it == parentNode.childSections.end() ) {
    9886              :                 auto newNode =
    9887            0 :                     Detail::make_unique<SectionNode>( incompleteStats );
    9888            0 :                 node = newNode.get();
    9889            0 :                 parentNode.childSections.push_back( CATCH_MOVE( newNode ) );
    9890            0 :             } else {
    9891            0 :                 node = it->get();
    9892              :             }
    9893              :         }
    9894              : 
    9895            0 :         m_deepestSection = node;
    9896            0 :         m_sectionStack.push_back( node );
    9897            0 :     }
    9898              : 
    9899            0 :     void CumulativeReporterBase::assertionEnded(
    9900              :         AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) {
    9901            0 :         assert( !m_sectionStack.empty() );
    9902              :         // AssertionResult holds a pointer to a temporary DecomposedExpression,
    9903              :         // which getExpandedExpression() calls to build the expression string.
    9904              :         // Our section stack copy of the assertionResult will likely outlive the
    9905              :         // temporary, so it must be expanded or discarded now to avoid calling
    9906              :         // a destroyed object later.
    9907            0 :         if ( m_shouldStoreFailedAssertions &&
    9908            0 :              !assertionStats.assertionResult.isOk() ) {
    9909            0 :             static_cast<void>(
    9910              :                 assertionStats.assertionResult.getExpandedExpression() );
    9911              :         }
    9912            0 :         if ( m_shouldStoreSuccesfulAssertions &&
    9913            0 :              assertionStats.assertionResult.isOk() ) {
    9914            0 :             static_cast<void>(
    9915              :                 assertionStats.assertionResult.getExpandedExpression() );
    9916              :         }
    9917            0 :         SectionNode& sectionNode = *m_sectionStack.back();
    9918            0 :         sectionNode.assertionsAndBenchmarks.emplace_back( assertionStats );
    9919            0 :     }
    9920              : 
    9921            0 :     void CumulativeReporterBase::sectionEnded( SectionStats const& sectionStats ) {
    9922            0 :         assert( !m_sectionStack.empty() );
    9923            0 :         SectionNode& node = *m_sectionStack.back();
    9924            0 :         node.stats = sectionStats;
    9925            0 :         m_sectionStack.pop_back();
    9926            0 :     }
    9927              : 
    9928            0 :     void CumulativeReporterBase::testCaseEnded(
    9929              :         TestCaseStats const& testCaseStats ) {
    9930            0 :         auto node = Detail::make_unique<TestCaseNode>( testCaseStats );
    9931            0 :         assert( m_sectionStack.size() == 0 );
    9932            0 :         node->children.push_back( CATCH_MOVE(m_rootSection) );
    9933            0 :         m_testCases.push_back( CATCH_MOVE(node) );
    9934              : 
    9935            0 :         assert( m_deepestSection );
    9936            0 :         m_deepestSection->stdOut = testCaseStats.stdOut;
    9937            0 :         m_deepestSection->stdErr = testCaseStats.stdErr;
    9938            0 :     }
    9939              : 
    9940              : 
    9941            0 :     void CumulativeReporterBase::testRunEnded( TestRunStats const& testRunStats ) {
    9942            0 :         assert(!m_testRun && "CumulativeReporterBase assumes there can only be one test run");
    9943            0 :         m_testRun = Detail::make_unique<TestRunNode>( testRunStats );
    9944            0 :         m_testRun->children.swap( m_testCases );
    9945            0 :         testRunEndedCumulative();
    9946            0 :     }

   10005              :     namespace {
   10006            0 :         void listTestNamesOnly(std::ostream& out,
   10007              :                                std::vector<TestCaseHandle> const& tests) {
   10008            0 :             for (auto const& test : tests) {
   10009            0 :                 auto const& testCaseInfo = test.getTestCaseInfo();
   10010              : 
   10011            0 :                 if (startsWith(testCaseInfo.name, '#')) {
   10012            0 :                     out << '"' << testCaseInfo.name << '"';
   10013              :                 } else {
   10014            0 :                     out << testCaseInfo.name;
   10015              :                 }
   10016              : 
   10017            0 :                 out << '\n';
   10018              :             }
   10019            0 :             out << std::flush;
   10020            0 :         }
   10021              :     } // end unnamed namespace
   10022              : 
   10023              : 
   10024              :     // Because formatting using c++ streams is stateful, drop down to C is
   10025              :     // required Alternatively we could use stringstream, but its performance
   10026              :     // is... not good.
   10027            0 :     std::string getFormattedDuration( double duration ) {
   10028              :         // Max exponent + 1 is required to represent the whole part
   10029              :         // + 1 for decimal point
   10030              :         // + 3 for the 3 decimal places
   10031              :         // + 1 for null terminator
   10032            0 :         const std::size_t maxDoubleSize = DBL_MAX_10_EXP + 1 + 1 + 3 + 1;
   10033              :         char buffer[maxDoubleSize];
   10034              : 
   10035              :         // Save previous errno, to prevent sprintf from overwriting it
   10036            0 :         ErrnoGuard guard;
   10037              : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   10038              :         size_t printedLength = static_cast<size_t>(
   10039              :             sprintf_s( buffer, "%.3f", duration ) );
   10040              : #else
   10041              :         size_t printedLength = static_cast<size_t>(
   10042            0 :             std::snprintf( buffer, maxDoubleSize, "%.3f", duration ) );
   10043              : #endif
   10044            0 :         return std::string( buffer, printedLength );
   10045            0 :     }
   10046              : 
   10047          239 :     bool shouldShowDuration( IConfig const& config, double duration ) {
   10048          239 :         if ( config.showDurations() == ShowDurations::Always ) {
   10049            0 :             return true;
   10050              :         }
   10051          239 :         if ( config.showDurations() == ShowDurations::Never ) {
   10052            0 :             return false;
   10053              :         }
   10054          239 :         const double min = config.minDuration();
   10055          239 :         return min >= 0 && duration >= min;
   10056              :     }
   10057              : 
   10058            0 :     std::string serializeFilters( std::vector<std::string> const& filters ) {
   10059              :         // We add a ' ' separator between each filter
   10060            0 :         size_t serialized_size = filters.size() - 1;
   10061            0 :         for (auto const& filter : filters) {
   10062            0 :             serialized_size += filter.size();
   10063              :         }
   10064              : 
   10065            0 :         std::string serialized;
   10066            0 :         serialized.reserve(serialized_size);
   10067            0 :         bool first = true;
   10068              : 
   10069            0 :         for (auto const& filter : filters) {
   10070            0 :             if (!first) {
   10071            0 :                 serialized.push_back(' ');
   10072              :             }
   10073            0 :             first = false;
   10074            0 :             serialized.append(filter);
   10075              :         }
   10076              : 
   10077            0 :         return serialized;
   10078            0 :     }
   10079              : 
   10080            0 :     std::ostream& operator<<( std::ostream& out, lineOfChars value ) {
   10081            0 :         for ( size_t idx = 0; idx < CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1; ++idx ) {
   10082            0 :             out.put( value.c );
   10083              :         }
   10084            0 :         return out;
   10085              :     }

   10087              :     void
   10088            0 :     defaultListReporters( std::ostream& out,

   10090              :                           Verbosity verbosity ) {
   10091            0 :         out << "Available reporters:\n";
   10092              :         const auto maxNameLen =
   10093            0 :             std::max_element( descriptions.begin(),
   10094              :                               descriptions.end(),
   10095            0 :                               []( ReporterDescription const& lhs,
   10096              :                                   ReporterDescription const& rhs ) {
   10097            0 :                                   return lhs.name.size() < rhs.name.size();
   10098              :                               } )
   10099            0 :                 ->name.size();
   10100              : 
   10101            0 :         for ( auto const& desc : descriptions ) {
   10102            0 :             if ( verbosity == Verbosity::Quiet ) {
   10103            0 :                 out << TextFlow::Column( desc.name )
   10104            0 :                            .indent( 2 )
   10105            0 :                            .width( 5 + maxNameLen )
   10106            0 :                     << '\n';
   10107              :             } else {
   10108            0 :                 out << TextFlow::Column( desc.name + ':' )
   10109            0 :                                .indent( 2 )
   10110            0 :                                .width( 5 + maxNameLen ) +
   10111            0 :                            TextFlow::Column( desc.description )
   10112            0 :                                .initialIndent( 0 )
   10113            0 :                                .indent( 2 )
   10114            0 :                                .width( CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - maxNameLen - 8 )
   10115            0 :                     << '\n';
   10116              :             }
   10117              :         }
   10118            0 :         out << '\n' << std::flush;
   10119            0 :     }
   10120              : 
   10121            0 :     void defaultListListeners( std::ostream& out,
   10122              :                                std::vector<ListenerDescription> const& descriptions ) {
   10123            0 :         out << "Registered listeners:\n";
   10124              : 
   10125            0 :         if(descriptions.empty()) {
   10126            0 :             return;
   10127              :         }
   10128              : 
   10129              :         const auto maxNameLen =
   10130            0 :             std::max_element( descriptions.begin(),
   10131              :                               descriptions.end(),
   10132            0 :                               []( ListenerDescription const& lhs,
   10133              :                                   ListenerDescription const& rhs ) {
   10134            0 :                                   return lhs.name.size() < rhs.name.size();
   10135              :                               } )
   10136            0 :                 ->name.size();
   10137              : 
   10138            0 :         for ( auto const& desc : descriptions ) {
   10139            0 :             out << TextFlow::Column( static_cast<std::string>( desc.name ) +
   10140              :                                      ':' )
   10141            0 :                            .indent( 2 )
   10142            0 :                            .width( maxNameLen + 5 ) +
   10143            0 :                        TextFlow::Column( desc.description )
   10144            0 :                            .initialIndent( 0 )
   10145            0 :                            .indent( 2 )
   10146            0 :                            .width( CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - maxNameLen - 8 )
   10147            0 :                 << '\n';
   10148              :         }
   10149              : 
   10150            0 :         out << '\n' << std::flush;
   10151              :     }
   10152              : 
   10153            0 :     void defaultListTags( std::ostream& out,
   10154              :                           std::vector<TagInfo> const& tags,
   10155              :                           bool isFiltered ) {
   10156            0 :         if ( isFiltered ) {
   10157            0 :             out << "Tags for matching test cases:\n";
   10158              :         } else {
   10159            0 :             out << "All available tags:\n";
   10160              :         }
   10161              : 
   10162              :         // minimum whitespace to pad tag counts, possibly overwritten below
   10163            0 :         size_t maxTagCountLen = 2;
   10164              : 
   10165              :         // determine necessary padding for tag count column
   10166            0 :         if ( ! tags.empty() ) {
   10167              :             const auto maxTagCount =
   10168            0 :                 std::max_element( tags.begin(),
   10169              :                                   tags.end(),
   10170            0 :                                   []( auto const& lhs, auto const& rhs ) {
   10171            0 :                                       return lhs.count < rhs.count;
   10172              :                                   } )
   10173            0 :                     ->count;
   10174              :             
   10175              :             // more padding necessary for 3+ digits
   10176            0 :             if (maxTagCount >= 100) {
   10177            0 :                 auto numDigits = 1 + std::floor( std::log10( maxTagCount ) );
   10178            0 :                 maxTagCountLen = static_cast<size_t>( numDigits );
   10179              :             }
   10180              :         }
   10181              : 
   10182            0 :         for ( auto const& tagCount : tags ) {
   10183            0 :             ReusableStringStream rss;
   10184            0 :             rss << "  " << std::setw( maxTagCountLen ) << tagCount.count << "  ";
   10185            0 :             auto str = rss.str();
   10186            0 :             auto wrapper = TextFlow::Column( tagCount.all() )
   10187            0 :                                .initialIndent( 0 )
   10188            0 :                                .indent( str.size() )
   10189            0 :                                .width( CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 10 );
   10190            0 :             out << str << wrapper << '\n';
   10191            0 :         }
   10192            0 :         out << pluralise(tags.size(), "tag"_sr) << "\n\n" << std::flush;
   10193            0 :     }
   10194              : 
   10195            0 :     void defaultListTests(std::ostream& out, ColourImpl* streamColour, std::vector<TestCaseHandle> const& tests, bool isFiltered, Verbosity verbosity) {
   10196              :         // We special case this to provide the equivalent of old
   10197              :         // `--list-test-names-only`, which could then be used by the
   10198              :         // `--input-file` option.
   10199            0 :         if (verbosity == Verbosity::Quiet) {
   10200            0 :             listTestNamesOnly(out, tests);
   10201            0 :             return;
   10202              :         }
   10203              : 
   10204            0 :         if (isFiltered) {
   10205            0 :             out << "Matching test cases:\n";
   10206              :         } else {
   10207            0 :             out << "All available test cases:\n";
   10208              :         }
   10209              :

   10235              :     namespace {
   10236              :         class SummaryColumn {
   10237              :         public:
   10238            0 :             SummaryColumn( std::string suffix, Colour::Code colour ):
   10239            0 :                 m_suffix( CATCH_MOVE( suffix ) ), m_colour( colour ) {}
   10240              : 
   10241            0 :             SummaryColumn&& addRow( std::uint64_t count ) && {
   10242            0 :                 std::string row = std::to_string(count);
   10243            0 :                 auto const new_width = std::max( m_width, row.size() );
   10244            0 :                 if ( new_width > m_width ) {
   10245            0 :                     for ( auto& oldRow : m_rows ) {
   10246            0 :                         oldRow.insert( 0, new_width - m_width, ' ' );
   10247              :                     }
   10248              :                 } else {
   10249            0 :                     row.insert( 0, m_width - row.size(), ' ' );
   10250              :                 }
   10251            0 :                 m_width = new_width;
   10252            0 :                 m_rows.push_back( row );
   10253            0 :                 return std::move( *this );
   10254            0 :             }
   10255              : 
   10256            0 :             std::string const& getSuffix() const { return m_suffix; }
   10257            0 :             Colour::Code getColour() const { return m_colour; }

   10259            0 :                 return m_rows[index];

   10269            0 :         void printSummaryRow( std::ostream& stream,
   10270              :                               ColourImpl& colour,
   10271              :                               StringRef label,
   10272              :                               std::vector<SummaryColumn> const& cols,
   10273              :                               std::size_t row ) {
   10274            0 :             for ( auto const& col : cols ) {
   10275            0 :                 auto const& value = col.getRow( row );

   10278            0 :                     stream << label << ": ";
   10279            0 :                     if ( value != "0" ) {
   10280            0 :                         stream << value;
   10281              :                     } else {
   10282            0 :                         stream << colour.guardColour( Colour::Warning )
   10283            0 :                                << "- none -";
   10284              :                     }

   10679            0 :                     tag_writer.write( tag.original );
   10680              :                 }
   10681            0 :             }
   10682            0 :             writeSourceInfo( desc_writer, info.lineInfo );
   10683            0 :         }
   10684            0 :     }
   10685            0 :     void JsonReporter::listTags( std::vector<TagInfo> const& tags ) {
   10686            0 :         startListing();
   10687              : 
   10688            0 :         auto writer = m_objectWriters.top().write( "tags"_sr ).writeArray();
   10689            0 :         for ( auto const& tag : tags ) {
   10690            0 :             auto tag_writer = writer.writeObject();
   10691              :             {
   10692              :                 auto aliases_writer =
   10693            0 :                     tag_writer.write( "aliases"_sr ).writeArray();

   10695            0 :                     aliases_writer.write( alias );
   10696              :                 }
   10697            0 :             }
   10698            0 :             tag_writer.write( "count"_sr ).write( tag.count );

   10713              :     namespace {
   10714            0 :         std::string getCurrentTimestamp() {
   10715              :             time_t rawtime;
   10716            0 :             std::time(&rawtime);
   10717              : 
   10718            0 :             std::tm timeInfo = {};
   10719              : #if defined (_MSC_VER) || defined (__MINGW32__)
   10720              :             gmtime_s(&timeInfo, &rawtime);
   10721              : #elif defined (CATCH_PLATFORM_PLAYSTATION)
   10722              :             gmtime_s(&rawtime, &timeInfo);
   10723              : #elif defined (__IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__)
   10724              :             timeInfo = *std::gmtime(&rawtime);
   10725              : #else
   10726            0 :             gmtime_r(&rawtime, &timeInfo);
   10727              : #endif
   10728              : 
   10729            0 :             auto const timeStampSize = sizeof("2017-01-16T17:06:45Z");
   10730              :             char timeStamp[timeStampSize];
   10731            0 :             const char * const fmt = "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ";
   10732              : 
   10733            0 :             std::strftime(timeStamp, timeStampSize, fmt, &timeInfo);
   10734              : 
   10735            0 :             return std::string(timeStamp, timeStampSize - 1);
   10736              :         }
   10737              : 
   10738            0 :         std::string fileNameTag(std::vector<Tag> const& tags) {
   10739            0 :             auto it = std::find_if(begin(tags),
   10740              :                                    end(tags),
   10741            0 :                                    [] (Tag const& tag) {
   10742            0 :                                        return tag.original.size() > 0
   10743            0 :                                            && tag.original[0] == '#'; });
   10744            0 :             if (it != tags.end()) {
   10745              :                 return static_cast<std::string>(
   10746            0 :                     it->original.substr(1, it->original.size() - 1)
   10747            0 :                 );
   10748              :             }
   10749            0 :             return std::string();
   10750              :         }
   10751              : 
   10752              :         // Formats the duration in seconds to 3 decimal places.
   10753              :         // This is done because some genius defined Maven Surefire schema
   10754              :         // in a way that only accepts 3 decimal places, and tools like
   10755              :         // Jenkins use that schema for validation JUnit reporter output.
   10756            0 :         std::string formatDuration( double seconds ) {
   10757            0 :             ReusableStringStream rss;
   10758            0 :             rss << std::fixed << std::setprecision( 3 ) << seconds;
   10759            0 :             return rss.str();
   10760            0 :         }
   10761              : 
   10762            0 :         static void normalizeNamespaceMarkers(std::string& str) {
   10763            0 :             std::size_t pos = str.find( "::" );
   10764            0 :             while ( pos != std::string::npos ) {
   10765            0 :                 str.replace( pos, 2, "." );
   10766            0 :                 pos += 1;
   10767            0 :                 pos = str.find( "::", pos );
   10768              :             }
   10769            0 :         }
   10770              : 
   10771              :     } // anonymous namespace
   10772              :

   10818            0 :     void JunitReporter::writeRun( TestRunNode const& testRunNode, double suiteTime ) {
   10819            0 :         XmlWriter::ScopedElement e = xml.scopedElement( "testsuite" );
   10820              : 
   10821            0 :         TestRunStats const& stats = testRunNode.value;
   10822            0 :         xml.writeAttribute( "name"_sr, stats.runInfo.name );
   10823            0 :         xml.writeAttribute( "errors"_sr, unexpectedExceptions );
   10824            0 :         xml.writeAttribute( "failures"_sr, stats.totals.assertions.failed-unexpectedExceptions );
   10825            0 :         xml.writeAttribute( "skipped"_sr, stats.totals.assertions.skipped );
   10826            0 :         xml.writeAttribute( "tests"_sr, stats.totals.assertions.total() );

   10828            0 :         if( m_config->showDurations() == ShowDurations::Never )

   10846              :

   10849            0 :             writeTestCase( *child );

   10854              : 
   10855            0 :     void JunitReporter::writeTestCase( TestCaseNode const& testCaseNode ) {
   10856            0 :         TestCaseStats const& stats = testCaseNode.value;
   10857              : 
   10858              :         // All test cases have exactly one section - which represents the
   10859              :         // test case itself. That section may have 0-n nested sections
   10860            0 :         assert( testCaseNode.children.size() == 1 );
   10861            0 :         SectionNode const& rootSection = *testCaseNode.children.front();
   10862              : 
   10863              :         std::string className =
   10864            0 :             static_cast<std::string>( stats.testInfo->className );
   10865              : 
   10866            0 :         if( className.empty() ) {
   10867            0 :             className = fileNameTag(stats.testInfo->tags);
   10868            0 :             if ( className.empty() ) {
   10869            0 :                 className = "global";
   10870              :             }
   10871              :         }
   10872              : 
   10873            0 :         if ( !m_config->name().empty() )
   10874            0 :             className = static_cast<std::string>(m_config->name()) + '.' + className;
   10875              : 
   10876            0 :         normalizeNamespaceMarkers(className);
   10877              : 
   10878            0 :         writeSection( className, "", rootSection, stats.testInfo->okToFail() );
   10879            0 :     }
   10880              : 
   10881            0 :     void JunitReporter::writeSection( std::string const& className,
   10882              :                                       std::string const& rootName,
   10883              :                                       SectionNode const& sectionNode,
   10884              :                                       bool testOkToFail) {
   10885            0 :         std::string name = trim( sectionNode.stats.sectionInfo.name );
   10886            0 :         if( !rootName.empty() )
   10887            0 :             name = rootName + '/' + name;
   10888              : 
   10889            0 :         if ( sectionNode.stats.assertions.total() > 0
   10890            0 :            || !sectionNode.stdOut.empty()
   10891            0 :            || !sectionNode.stdErr.empty() ) {
   10892            0 :             XmlWriter::ScopedElement e = xml.scopedElement( "testcase" );
   10893            0 :             if( className.empty() ) {
   10894            0 :                 xml.writeAttribute( "classname"_sr, name );
   10895            0 :                 xml.writeAttribute( "name"_sr, "root"_sr );
   10896              :             }
   10897              :             else {
   10898            0 :                 xml.writeAttribute( "classname"_sr, className );
   10899            0 :                 xml.writeAttribute( "name"_sr, name );
   10900              :             }
   10901            0 :             xml.writeAttribute( "time"_sr, formatDuration( sectionNode.stats.durationInSeconds ) );
   10902              :             // This is not ideal, but it should be enough to mimic gtest's
   10903              :             // junit output.
   10904              :             // Ideally the JUnit reporter would also handle `skipTest`
   10905              :             // events and write those out appropriately.
   10906            0 :             xml.writeAttribute( "status"_sr, "run"_sr );
   10907              : 
   10908            0 :             if (sectionNode.stats.assertions.failedButOk) {
   10909            0 :                 xml.scopedElement("skipped")
   10910            0 :                     .writeAttribute("message", "TEST_CASE tagged with !mayfail");
   10911              :             }
   10912              : 
   10913            0 :             writeAssertions( sectionNode );
   10914              : 
   10915              : 
   10916            0 :             if( !sectionNode.stdOut.empty() )
   10917            0 :                 xml.scopedElement( "system-out" ).writeText( trim( sectionNode.stdOut ), XmlFormatting::Newline );
   10918            0 :             if( !sectionNode.stdErr.empty() )
   10919            0 :                 xml.scopedElement( "system-err" ).writeText( trim( sectionNode.stdErr ), XmlFormatting::Newline );
   10920            0 :         }
   10921            0 :         for( auto const& childNode : sectionNode.childSections )
   10922            0 :             if( className.empty() )
   10923            0 :                 writeSection( name, "", *childNode, testOkToFail );
   10924              :             else
   10925            0 :                 writeSection( className, name, *childNode, testOkToFail );
   10926            0 :     }
   10927              : 
   10928            0 :     void JunitReporter::writeAssertions( SectionNode const& sectionNode ) {
   10929            0 :         for (auto const& assertionOrBenchmark : sectionNode.assertionsAndBenchmarks) {
   10930            0 :             if (assertionOrBenchmark.isAssertion()) {
   10931            0 :                 writeAssertion(assertionOrBenchmark.asAssertion());
   10932              :             }
   10933              :         }
   10934            0 :     }
   10935              : 
   10936            0 :     void JunitReporter::writeAssertion( AssertionStats const& stats ) {
   10937            0 :         AssertionResult const& result = stats.assertionResult;
   10938            0 :         if ( !result.isOk() ||
   10939            0 :              result.getResultType() == ResultWas::ExplicitSkip ) {
   10940            0 :             std::string elementName;
   10941            0 :             switch( result.getResultType() ) {
   10942            0 :                 case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   10943              :                 case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   10944            0 :                     elementName = "error";
   10945            0 :                     break;
   10946            0 :                 case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   10947              :                 case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   10948              :                 case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   10949            0 :                     elementName = "failure";
   10950            0 :                     break;
   10951            0 :                 case ResultWas::ExplicitSkip:
   10952            0 :                     elementName = "skipped";
   10953            0 :                     break;
   10954              :                 // We should never see these here:
   10955            0 :                 case ResultWas::Info:
   10956              :                 case ResultWas::Warning:
   10957              :                 case ResultWas::Ok:
   10958              :                 case ResultWas::Unknown:
   10959              :                 case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   10960              :                 case ResultWas::Exception:
   10961            0 :                     elementName = "internalError";
   10962            0 :                     break;
   10963              :             }
   10964              : 
   10965            0 :             XmlWriter::ScopedElement e = xml.scopedElement( elementName );
   10966              : 
   10967            0 :             xml.writeAttribute( "message"_sr, result.getExpression() );
   10968            0 :             xml.writeAttribute( "type"_sr, result.getTestMacroName() );
   10969              : 
   10970            0 :             ReusableStringStream rss;
   10971            0 :             if ( result.getResultType() == ResultWas::ExplicitSkip ) {
   10972            0 :                 rss << "SKIPPED\n";
   10973              :             } else {
   10974            0 :                 rss << "FAILED" << ":\n";
   10975            0 :                 if (result.hasExpression()) {
   10976            0 :                     rss << "  ";
   10977            0 :                     rss << result.getExpressionInMacro();
   10978            0 :                     rss << '\n';
   10979              :                 }
   10980            0 :                 if (result.hasExpandedExpression()) {
   10981            0 :                     rss << "with expansion:\n";
   10982            0 :                     rss << TextFlow::Column(result.getExpandedExpression()).indent(2) << '\n';
   10983              :                 }
   10984              :             }
   10985              : 
   10986            0 :             if( result.hasMessage() )
   10987            0 :                 rss << result.getMessage() << '\n';
   10988            0 :             for( auto const& msg : stats.infoMessages )
   10989            0 :                 if( msg.type == ResultWas::Info )
   10990            0 :                     rss << msg.message << '\n';
   10991              : 
   10992            0 :             rss << "at " << result.getSourceInfo();
   10993            0 :             xml.writeText( rss.str(), XmlFormatting::Newline );
   10994            0 :         }
   10995            0 :     }

   11014            0 :     void MultiReporter::addListener( IEventListenerPtr&& listener ) {
   11015            0 :         updatePreferences(*listener);
   11016            0 :         m_reporterLikes.insert(m_reporterLikes.begin() + m_insertedListeners, CATCH_MOVE(listener) );
   11017            0 :         ++m_insertedListeners;

   11020            0 :     void MultiReporter::addReporter( IEventListenerPtr&& reporter ) {
   11021            0 :         updatePreferences(*reporter);
   11022              : 
   11023              :         // We will need to output the captured stdout if there are reporters
   11024              :         // that do not want it captured.
   11025              :         // We do not consider listeners, because it is generally assumed that
   11026              :         // listeners are output-transparent, even though they can ask for stdout
   11027              :         // capture to do something with it.
   11028            0 :         m_haveNoncapturingReporters |= !reporter->getPreferences().shouldRedirectStdOut;
   11029              : 
   11030              :         // Reporters can always be placed to the back without breaking the
   11031              :         // reporting order
   11032            0 :         m_reporterLikes.push_back( CATCH_MOVE( reporter ) );
   11033            0 :     }

   11266            0 :     void SonarQubeReporter::writeTestCase(TestCaseNode const& testCaseNode) {
   11267              :         // All test cases have exactly one section - which represents the
   11268              :         // test case itself. That section may have 0-n nested sections
   11269            0 :         assert(testCaseNode.children.size() == 1);
   11270            0 :         SectionNode const& rootSection = *testCaseNode.children.front();
   11271            0 :         writeSection("", rootSection, testCaseNode.value.testInfo->okToFail());
   11272            0 :     }
   11273              : 
   11274            0 :     void SonarQubeReporter::writeSection(std::string const& rootName, SectionNode const& sectionNode, bool okToFail) {

   11286            0 :             writeAssertions(sectionNode, okToFail);
   11287            0 :         }

   11289            0 :         for (auto const& childNode : sectionNode.childSections)

   11293            0 :     void SonarQubeReporter::writeAssertions(SectionNode const& sectionNode, bool okToFail) {

   11296            0 :                 writeAssertion(assertionOrBenchmark.asAssertion(), okToFail);
   11297              :             }
   11298              :         }
   11299            0 :     }
   11300              : 
   11301            0 :     void SonarQubeReporter::writeAssertion(AssertionStats const& stats, bool okToFail) {
   11302            0 :         AssertionResult const& result = stats.assertionResult;
   11303            0 :         if ( !result.isOk() ||
   11304            0 :              result.getResultType() == ResultWas::ExplicitSkip ) {
   11305            0 :             std::string elementName;
   11306            0 :             if (okToFail) {
   11307            0 :                 elementName = "skipped";
   11308              :             } else {
   11309            0 :                 switch (result.getResultType()) {
   11310            0 :                 case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   11311              :                 case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   11312            0 :                     elementName = "error";
   11313            0 :                     break;
   11314            0 :                 case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   11315              :                 case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   11316              :                 case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   11317            0 :                     elementName = "failure";
   11318            0 :                     break;
   11319            0 :                 case ResultWas::ExplicitSkip:
   11320            0 :                     elementName = "skipped";
   11321            0 :                     break;
   11322              :                     // We should never see these here:
   11323            0 :                 case ResultWas::Info:
   11324              :                 case ResultWas::Warning:
   11325              :                 case ResultWas::Ok:
   11326              :                 case ResultWas::Unknown:
   11327              :                 case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   11328              :                 case ResultWas::Exception:
   11329            0 :                     elementName = "internalError";
   11330            0 :                     break;
   11331              :                 }
   11332              :             }
   11333              : 
   11334            0 :             XmlWriter::ScopedElement e = xml.scopedElement(elementName);
   11335              : 
   11336            0 :             ReusableStringStream messageRss;
   11337            0 :             messageRss << result.getTestMacroName() << '(' << result.getExpression() << ')';
   11338            0 :             xml.writeAttribute("message"_sr, messageRss.str());
   11339              : 
   11340            0 :             ReusableStringStream textRss;
   11341            0 :             if ( result.getResultType() == ResultWas::ExplicitSkip ) {
   11342            0 :                 textRss << "SKIPPED\n";
   11343              :             } else {
   11344            0 :                 textRss << "FAILED:\n";
   11345            0 :                 if (result.hasExpression()) {
   11346            0 :                     textRss << '\t' << result.getExpressionInMacro() << '\n';
   11347              :                 }
   11348            0 :                 if (result.hasExpandedExpression()) {
   11349            0 :                     textRss << "with expansion:\n\t" << result.getExpandedExpression() << '\n';
   11350              :                 }
   11351              :             }
   11352              : 
   11353            0 :             if (result.hasMessage())
   11354            0 :                 textRss << result.getMessage() << '\n';
   11355              : 
   11356            0 :             for (auto const& msg : stats.infoMessages)
   11357            0 :                 if (msg.type == ResultWas::Info)
   11358            0 :                     textRss << msg.message << '\n';
   11359              : 
   11360            0 :             textRss << "at " << result.getSourceInfo();

   11362            0 :         }
   11363            0 :     }
